Reviews.Title: “What you expect from the brand and more too”
Reviews.Author: KHH1985
Reviews.Content: Perfect welcomming for us and our friends by the bell captain, and immediate service for valet parking (althoug a bit expensive). Greeting followed by speedy and attentive check-in, including asignment of the right room, as we brought our dog, and our friends did not. When arriving at the room, we get everything requested, although would have loved a view over Potsdamer Platz (we faced Sony Center and Tiergarten). In room there was bed and extra ammenieties for our dog, which was perfect. Breakfast in the lobby level restaurant is a must, and can only recommend. Restaurant recommendations and bookings by the concierge were great, see seperately, and came with a huge selection. Upon departure our car was packed by the bell captain and ready for departure, and extra which I have not seen before - only thing that could have created at 6 star experience would have been four bottles of water for the drive home. Will for sure come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Happy”
Reviews.Author: n_bi-coastal
Reviews.Content: Met our daughter and her family for a week in Berlin over Easter. Despite the mob scene of visiting almost any city during spring break, the Ritz provided a respite from the chaos outside the hotel. Our rooms, although not cheap, by 5* status they were reasonable enough that we opted for the club floor, which proved to be a smart decision, as we were able to have breakfast as part of the rate, in addition to a few lunches, and even dinner in the club lounge. There were more than adequate snacks for the kids. We felt like the lounge became our home away from home. I can't say enough about Fabian, the Club concierge and the rest of the staff, who could not do enough for us. They guided us to the right restaurants and even were able to secure tickets to a sold out art show The rooms were spotless, beautifully appointed with a fine view of the Sony Center and Potsdamer Platz. Bathrooms were equally clean with glass enclosed shower and an additional deep tub, and double sinks. This was our second trip to Berlin, and, because of the hotel and its staff, most satisfying. I highly recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DASDSA
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, ideally located, very good personnel, extra rich breakfast, very good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate CHOOSE it!”
Reviews.Author: K_gphysiocenter
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin for 5 days. This was my first time in Germany. I chose to stay in Carlton Ritz. I payed a supplement of 80 euros and I was accommodated in the club ward of the hotel. I must say that it worths the money not only because of the provided services but also because of the personnel which make the difference. Although the overall ambience of the hotel is perfect I believe that the bistrot of the hotel should be improved. It is not good value for money at all. Finally I can't but say that the Germans are very clean and very sympatic people.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury, some things need addressing”
Reviews.Author: smast
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back after an Easter break at the Ritz Carlton Berlin, great service, great location, bedrooms are becoming a little tired now though, still immaculately clean but little things are slipping, bedding only changed every 3 days, no turn down service in the evening, no chocolates on the pillow, generic shampoo, shower gel and conditioner, 1 bar of soap etc. no longer the luxury bulgari amenities and no orchid in the bathroom. this may sound petty but it's a 5 star hotel and these are te little things that make a place stand out, The spa is neglected, on each occasion I visited there was no attendant, wet towels left on the floor and pool area was dirty, Room service was quick but expensive and 2 gin and tonics in the bar was €40, Just a little dissapoineted as it used to be worth the money. Please RC don't skimp on things to save money as we do notice and are not stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spwinaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for several days and enjoyed all of the amenities. The buffet-style breakfast was delicious but pricey. The rooms were of course spotless and beautiful. The front desk staff was courteous and the concierge desk was very helpful but not overly friendly. I had to use the business center a lot, it was pretty expensive but once in a while you could use the internet with out a code. The location was perfect! Very close to the train station (Hauptbahnhof) and a nice walk to pieces of the wall and to the Brandenburg Gate and a short cab ride to the Kurfurstendamm. Would highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: car1215
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved staying at the Ritz Carlton last Spring 2011. The rooms were beautiful (especially the gorgeous bathroom), spacious and clean and the lobby area is very nice. The service was great and they pay attention to small details. For example, when we would finish our morning run, we would be handed a bottle of water on our way back into the hotel. The location is also terrific. We really enjoyed our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way!”
Reviews.Author: Bala B
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel! I dont even have to mention the cleaningness and beauty of the rooms, however, we really liked the bathroom, shower and the bath, impressive. The location is perfect for Berlin tourists. After a long walking touristy day, we jumped into the pool and the hot tub to relax and rejuvinate our feet and exhausted selves. It is a luxury hotel but worth the stay and money!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: YonitG
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel during March 2012. The rooms are extremely comfort and nice ( not big thou) the view if you get a street view is straight looking into an office building. At the beginning they sent our luggage to another room and it took them more then an hour to find out that they delivered our luggage to another guest room... a situation that should not happen especially in the Ritz hotel but they did apologize and arrange for dinner as a compensation. The hotel also open his gate to pets so don't panic if you get attack by 2 bulldogs in the hall at rooms floor.... the Breakfast is an AMAZING and i must admit its one from the nicest i have seen ( and i did see a lot as a frequent business traveler). The concierge charge 20% service charge if they arrange tickets or other travel services. All in all its a nice hotel,but i expected a bit more in terms of service from the "Ritz Carlton" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Maxsar911
Reviews.Content: The price for the Ritz in Berlin was quite reasonable considering I was in a major European capital. That takes a bit of getting used to. It is like the prices you get staying in Chicago versus New York or San Francisco. The hotel itself is very new and nice. The service I got was excellent. They have a funny routine where they close the curtains around the bar at 6:00pm then they play a song and have a guy in an old style guard costume open them. I have no idea quite what that was all about, but I am all for it. The hotel is right next to the train station. There is a nice Wall memorial just a few steps away from the hotel. The exercise room is very good. I also have stayed at the Intercontinental in Berlin. There is no comparison. The Ritz is a couple steps above.

Reviews.Title: “RITZ BERLIN ECONOMIC CRISIS”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Berlin several times in recent years, more satisfied and happy to come back. Lately, unfortunately the hotel is in economic crisis, everything has changed including their service. In the rooms with the excuse of saving the environment are no longer change the sheets every day (typical of a 5 star deluxe), is no longer made the nightly turn down (only if requested and not always done so despite the request), the arrival room are no longer the excellent fresh fruit and chocolates on the bedside table, and at night no more chocolates on the pillow. The products of very low quality bathroom and placed sparingly, once stood in the bathroom more than anywhere else, lots of shampoo and shower baths, but now for two people are given only a tiny tube of shampoo and a bathroom shower to be shared . The pool is forgotten, the staff is no longer present and you have to take for himself the towels, clean the bed used by previous customers. How clean the spa area leaves much be desired. The beds are the most confortable in the world despite the crisis, the more lavish decor, great location. The price I would say cheaply for a five star luxury. Too bad sin for the service if you are still looking for a super-luxury class hotels and impeccable service is still in Berlin, we strongly recommend the De Rome Rocco Forte's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: buckland
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed for 9 nights in end December/early January. We had 2 interconnecting rooms. Our rate was really reasonable and included buffet breakfast. We loved the hotel. The location is fantastic with the train station right outside the front door. We hit a little bit of wet weather and so when we wanted to get to the shopping centre which was close by used the underground walkway from the train station to the shops. One night we felt like a movie and across the road was a cinema that showed all movies in English. It was only about a 5 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and other really interesting sights. We basically walked everywhere and at the end of the day after lots of walking caught the train back to the hotel. We arrived just before New Years Eve, across the road were Christmas Markets where we went most nights after dinner for a pretzel or other treats. Our rooms were extremely comfortable. We had a room with a king bed and then the second room had two double beds. The bathroom is massive with lovely shampoos and soaps etc. The rooms have DVD players and if you visit Concierge they have a selection of DVDs that you can take up to your room to watch (there is no fee for this). Not a huge amount of English speaking movies to choose from though. The rooms are quite spacious with everything you would need. There was plenty of room for us all, our children were 18, 16, 13. We were always warmly greeted by staff as we either left the hotel for the day or upon our return. In the mornings near the lift there were a selection of biscuits/treats that you could take with you. My youngest son loved the main restaurant for breakfast because behind the front counter were jars and jars of sweets. If you asked the staff member behind the counter they would fill up a bag of sweets (of your choice) for you to take...there was no fee for this. So my son had a bag of sweets to munch on as we toured around Berlin. It was a nice touch. The buffet breakfast was nice, it had basically everything you could ask for with cheeses, sliced meats, salmon, hot food, crepes, breads, fruits, pastries etc. My only minor gripe is the fruit juices, at most buffets that we have been to, you can go up and pour a fruit juice whenever you liked. At the restaurant you had to ask staff for one, if the restaurant was busy it could sometimes take a while to get a juice. The main bar area was nice with a piano play and singer most nights. It is not a huge bar so a lot of the time we had trouble getting a seat and had to sit in the foyer area. The bar prices, like most hotels, were pretty pricey. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast so I can't give any comments on their lunch or dinners. There is a small indoor pool which we used after a long day of walking. The hotel doesn't offer free wifi but around the corner from the hotel is a Starbucks which we would frequent daily to get emails etc. If you are going to Berlin for New Years Eve this is a great hotel as it is so close to the Brandenburg Gate where all the action is. Highly recommend the hotel for a really comfortable stay, where you feel welcomed. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the bests”
Reviews.Author: Tolga K
Reviews.Content: Clean and luxury hotel with wonderful staff. Restaurants, breakfast service, rooms were quite satisfactory and in fact beyond satisfactory, they were spectacular. One of the best hotels I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “A Complete Letdown”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: I originally selected this hotel over others in Berlin – including Hotel Adlon – due to its top 3 Tripadvisor ranking at the time. I noted with dismay that ever since then its position had been continually sliding ever downwards! I really had hoped that the recent spate of less than good reviews was down to overly particular guests or the occasional bad experience, which can happen even at the best properties. As I’d booked it through a third party agent (I would advise using a price comparison web-site as I got a far better deal than if I’d booked directly with the hotel) and paid in advance there was no turning back! Before I launch into the full review, I will note that the best thing about this hotel is the breakfast. It is superb, and any criticism would only really come down to very personal taste and would be nit-picking. Everything is catered for – a wonderful selection of fresh fruit, including berries, and cereals. Lots of different breads, rolls, and even bagels, and a toaster so one can toast whatever selectiong one wishes; there is also an equally large array of jams/conserves to enjoy with the bread. There is a good selection of cold cuts, fish, high quality cheeses, as well as the usual American style hot buffet complete with omelettes made to order. As if this isn’t enough, crepes, American pancakes, French toast, and waffles can all be made to order (at no extra charge). In short, this is an exemplary hotel breakfast in both terms of quality and variety. The service was usually attentive with glasses regularly topped up, but once it started to get busy (around 9.30 onwards, especially at the weekend) one did notice a drop in attention to detail, as well as a queue snaking its way into the bar area. If you are going to stay here, make sure you have breakfast included as it is the major redeeming factor of this property!! Upon arrival, a fur caped doorman opened my taxi door, and swiftly removed the luggage and welcomed me to the hotel. If only things had continued like this… The girl at the front desk was polite, but far from welcoming as the doorman had been. Things went wrong when she asked for my voucher; I explained that whilst I had booked through a third party I had e-mailed the hotel directly to confirm everything was as it should be and they had never mentioned the need for any voucher. She was very persistent and went away to ask someone else, and still insisted on the voucher. I advised that I could probably dig out an email once I had access to a computer and print it off for them. She still wasn’t really satisfied, and a little huffily said that they would contact the travel agent for another copy. To add to this, I had been travelling since 4am that morning; whilst I did not expect the hotel to specifically know that, the front desk should always be wary that most travellers will always be somewhat weary from their journey! I’d have expected that she’d have checked me in and then contacted me if I had indeed needed to provide the voucher (which as it turned out I didn’t). A bell boy showed me up to my room and was extremely friendly and professional and showed me the various features of the room, how to operate touch-panel light switches etc. This was a thoughtful touch, and much appreciated. The room itself was an huge letdown (I will discuss the rooms in more detail a little later) and the double glazing was far from top quality and a hissing noise could be heard where the window did not seal fully on the hinged side. I complained about this, and they advised someone would look at the window whilst I was out. I returned and the problem was as before and there was no note explaining what had happened. I went to shower and get ready to go out; the box containing the vanity kit was empty which I was not best pleased with. I spoke to the duty manager on my way out and he assured me he would resolve the issue with the window. I returned from dinner, still no note and the hissing sound ever more apparent. I called the guest service department yet again (I am sure they were bored of my calls!!) and they advised that maintenance considered the noise to be normal. I am not someone who requires complete silence, but it was a very particular noise and the room otherwise was pretty quiet so it would’ve been rather noticeable. The next day I returned and was offered a change of room, and a complimentary upgrade, which was a thoughtful gesture. They sent someone up to help with my luggage, the very first room I was showed to smelt very strongly of stale cigar smoke, so that was not going to work! Then I was shown another room which on first impressions seemed to be fine. Whilst I was getting ready to go out for dinner I noticed a tapping sound coming from the entrance/air-con unit. I called guest services who promptly sent up maintenance who advised that it was just fan noise from the hotel’s central air-con which would stop at 10pm. This would of course have been acceptable to me, so I left it at that. I returned long after 10pm to find the air-con grilles covered in duct tape, and the tapping sound was still apparent in the hall. I called for a manager to come and speak to me. He arrived quickly and offered to move me yet again, bearing in mind that I had moved rooms 3 times already I was not best pleased, but left with little alternative. The final room was at least free of irritating noises. Now a little bit on the rooms themselves… Like the rest of the hotel they feel extremely dated. Given the hotel only opened in 2004 I found it staggering how 1980s in style the décor was; 1980s style geometric “cascade” chandeliers in the corridors, and lots of similarly naff touches. The carpets in the rooms are now worn very thin; if one treads in the corners where hardly anyone walks, one can feel the original deep pile. The furniture is functional, but ugly again. The bathroom is also extremely dated in pink marble, and has some simply bizarre features. The bathtub features a separate hand-shower attachment which is supplied disconnected to the water outlet, and one has to fiddle around to connect it; why?!? This property was built in 2004, bath-tubs have long had retractable handshowers – hardly a cutting edge solution! The separate shower cubicle had a peculiar corner “seat” which no adult would be small enough to use! Also, the marble counter-top has a glass upper layer, presumably with the intention that the marble isn't marked so easily, instead hard water marks form around the edge of the basin as well as chips showing as light reflects off of the glass; it is yet another bizarre feature as marble on its can always be re-polished and filed down whereas this would need a new glass "upper". The beds are made up as standard with a duvet per person i.e. two single duvets on a king bed which might be the local style, but in an international hotel a single duvet as standard and two upon request would be sensible - I had to ask for one duvet in each of the rooms. The lighting was very poor in the bedroom, which is fine for “mood” lighting, but there was no overhead light to make it bright. Even the bathroom could’ve done with being a little brighter. The touch panel light controls are backlit by bright blue LEDs which do give out quite a bit of light when all the other lights are off and curtains drawn. The rooms were completely devoid of any thoughtful touches. The so called spa area was diabolical. On their web-site they advertise it as a La Prairie spa, it no longer is. They have a few treatment rooms but these are all locked up, unless one books in advance and they order in a therapist as there are none employed full time in house. The pool is literally the size of a postage stamp; the jet stream - which would’ve enabled one to swim more than two strokes before having to turn - was not functioning with enough power to be effective. There is also a Jacuzzi, and sauna area with a hot and not quite so hot sauna. Most people went straight from their rooms to the “spa” in their bathrobes so changing rooms were not an issue… On my last day I was only given a late check-out until 1.30pm (I did not need to leave the hotel until 5pm) which was fair enough and the front desk had advised that I could use the changing facilities in the spa to shower. Foolishly I had never bothered to inspect the changing rooms whilst I had had a room of my own; this proved to be a big mistake!! The changing room is tiny, has a wall of lockers, and a loo and basin in a small cubicle together, and that is it. The shower that is across the corridor from it (how does that work?!) was out of order so the only showers available were those in the sauna area or by the pool. Hardly convenient. Furthermore the changing rooms open directly onto the pool area, so if you are stood in the wrong place people sat by the pool would get a full view into them! Again, given the hotel was built in 2004 the spa area is very poor indeed. Other than the breakfast, there was very little I enjoyed about this hotel. How this property has consistently made it onto CN, T+L, etc. lists is truly beyond me, it just goes to show that those lists are really worth very little. Externally the architecture and style is very impressive, but internally I was staggered that a modern, purpose built hotel should be so un-user-friendly, and so clumsily conceived. The service was best from the door staff who without exception were friendly and welcoming. I think that the Ritz Carlton branding is this hotel’s own worst enemy; it raises expectations above what one would be happy with at a Marriott (directly around the corner), Hilton, etc. and it fails to deliver. The fact that this property sells its rooms at a discount through various third parties, again highlights that this is not a property at the top of its game. Berlin itself is a fabulous city, and I would like to think it has an equally fabulous city centre hotel… The Ritz Cartlon certainly isn’t it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knubjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Thursday Feb 2nd 2012 - Sunday 5th 2012. We were lucky and got an upgrade to a suite. The room was great, the breakfast was fantastic and the location was perfect. Short distance from everything we wanted to do in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant surprise - will return”
Reviews.Author: blonde222
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking for me - at a very reasonable price via lastminute.com - so I was astounded to be upgraded to the most enormous of suites. Pure luck - the hotel was completely full and I guess they had nowhere else to put me. But much appreciated anyway. What I liked even more were the staff: all genuinely friendly and helpful, from the concierge (who could speak not only excellent English but also threw in a bit of Greek when I confessed I spoke more Greek than German...) to the very welcoming doorman, to the receptionists, to the lady who brought Earl Grey tea bags and showed me how to use the coffee machine in my suite. My stay wasn't long enough to explore the hotel fully or use the restaurant, but my room (or should I say rooms) were spotless, very well insulated from street noise, and had every known creature comfort. I counted about five TVs, at least three phones and one chandelier. My only gripes about the room - and this is really clutching at straws - is that for a hotel in the business district it wasn't very modern-business friendly. it was very hard to find an electric socket to plug one's phone charger or laptop into, particularly in the bedroom and even in the study (where there was a fax machine, TV and phone no less but no obvious spare socket). I ended up unplugging lights and moving furniture to do it. This is by no means a problem unique to the Ritz Carlton though, it's pretty universal wherever you go. Secondly, I was disappointed that there is no free wi-fi in room - there's a hefty daily charge. Again the RC is not alone in this: the bigger and flasher the hotel is, the more likely it is to charge a fortune for internet access. When so many boutique hotels offer it for free, why do these hotels persist? I was also impressed by two other small details: that the restaurant the concierge booked us a table in already knew that we were going to the Philharmonic, and so served us suitably briskly without even having to ask; and that I booked room service breakfast for 5am as I had an early flight, and it arrived absolutely on the dot, piping hot. Overall: excellent hotel, excellent service, thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A splurge for us...and well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: seraphic
Reviews.Content: It was a landmark birthday and anniversary so my boyfriend and I decided to visit wonderful Berlin and do it up at the Ritz Carlton. We were not disappointed! Aside from Berlin being a fabulous city, the RC was a warm and luxurious place to call home for the week. The staff is incredibly warm and friendly.....and we particularly hit it off with Terry, who man's the door, as he and my bf are both jazz musicians. I was concerned that there might be a pretentious vibe at RC, but that was so far off from what we encountered. Everyone was truly lovely and down to earth. We found an amazing deal at booking.com (250 euros/day) that included the buffet breakfast, which typically goes for 38 euros/per person. The buffet was amazing....unlimited freshly squeezed juices, lattes, cappuccinos, espressos, etc, and crepes made to order, eggs made to order, sundry lox and herring, assorted cheeses. fresh prosciutto, yogurts, exotic fruits,,etc. The room was spacious and immaculate, and elegantly furnished. We loved the feather bed and having a doorbell alert us to any visitors. The dark chocolate treat every night was a sweet touch :-) The bathroom was huge, and we loved the quad music system with music piped into the bathroom from the DVD player in the main room. The bathtub was a wonderful treat as was the shower. The water pressure was perfect and there was no shortage of hot water. Location was stellar as well...albeit Berlin is 8 x's the size of Paris so be prepared to metro it or cab it. It's a 10 minute walk to the Jewish memorial, the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag. All worth visiting. Postdamer platz is right out the front door, as is Sony Center. We saw a fabulous concert of the Berlin Philharmonic just a 5 minute walk from RC. Also- check out the Solar club/restaurant....also a 10 minute walk from RC. Museumplatz can conceivably be walked if there wasn't a cold freeze happening! Overall I'd highly recommend the RC and will gladly stay there again when I return to Berlin in a warmer season!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JuggapahJK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is somewhat disappointing. It certainly is a very nice hotel visually and the rooms are pleasant and comfortable but the service is much to be desired. Any request via guest services is extremely slow, including room service. The prices are unjustifiably overpriced for what you are getting and the service is poor. We had to wait 20 minutes to be served at the bar; the morning of our first stay there was no hot water and I was told this was due to too many people using the shower at the same time-after phoning three times, I had to walk to the hotel next door in -18 degrees weather to shower and was subsequently 2 hours late for an appointment-only when complaining again did the manager upgrade my room. When my flight was cancelled the next day, the hotel showed little concern for my dilemma and made no attempt to assist in the situation. I checked into the Hyatt hotel the following day which excelled in every way that the ritz didn't.

Reviews.Title: “THE CLUB LOUNGE - ANOTHER LEVEL OF SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: JonatanLoter
Reviews.Content: I went back to the hotel this January... And I would NEVER stay in any other hotel in Berlin rather than The Ritz. I stayed at the 10th. floor, which is like an executive level... And I've received the best service I've ever received in a hotel in my whole entire life, the guys working in the Club Lounge are amazing, they not just make you feel at home, they also give you a royal treatment! Every single detail is taken care in the Ritz: The chocolate, the water, the cleaning, the towels, the umbrella... I needed some plug adaptors and they offered me as much as I wanted. The rooms are big, comfortable, with a desk and arm chair in which you can seat and read. The bathroom is HUGE and so nice, with the shower and the toilette separately, and a huge bathtub. The cleaning stuff are always with a smile on their face as well as all the hotel staff. I really think that a hotel provides much more than a bed and a bathroom, and the management of the hotel lead by Robert Petrovic, truly understand the needs of a traveler, and exceed all expectations in a very gentle and kind maner. If any traveler is thinking about Berlin and can afford the Ritz, don't hesitate to stay here, is the best choice. And if you can pay a bit more, stay at the Club Lounge... PLEASE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Ritz is a must!”
Reviews.Author: KB75201
Reviews.Content: We, with another couple, spent 4 nights here in December. We travel internationally frequently and not only is this one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at, it is one of the best Ritz Carlton's we have ever stayed in. We were in Europe for 3 weeks, traveling through Switzerland and Germany, and to our surprise, the Ritz was also the least expensive hotel we stayed at on our entire trip! Upon our arrival, we were greated at the train station by 2 very cheerful bellmen with a van to take us to the hotel. It was a challange to fit 6 adults and 13 pieces of luggage in the van, but, they handled it beautifully. Our room was spacious, which is hard to find in Europe, and elegant. The staff was superb and they went out of their way to see to our every need. The restaurant was outstanding and the food delicious. The breakfasts are unbelievable. The daily 6:00pm opening ceremony for the Curtain Bar with the Beefeater was a fun surprise. Located right across from the Sony Center and the Potsdamer Platz metro train station makes it super easy to catch trains to where ever you want to go. We can not say enough great things about this hotel other than if you ever find yourself in Berlin, it is a must stay! ( and say "Hi" to Terry Green, one of the doormen, he will take great care of you!)

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: provenceislovely
Reviews.Content: If you want to be spoiled--definitely make this your destination for Berlin. Berlin is not an expensive city, and of all the Ritz Carlton Hotels that I have enjoyed, this is certainly one of the finest in terms of elegance, and service. If you can, be certain to book the club level which is really a treat. The rooms are beautiful and nicely appointed, and the beds are very comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: antonios1602
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great (+) The location is very good...not as good as others but there is metro station just opposite. (underground in berlin is not as good!!) The breakfast is just mythical.......you should go there even just for the breakfast. The rooms are very nice, but they are a bit too heavy...you know the american-british style. The bed is perhaps the best I ever had!!! (-) Many politician stay here, making the arrival at the hotel a bit problematic especially if you have to wait outside for 10 min because of police restrictions. Its a bit overpriced!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jessieeIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Ritz Carlton. The location of the hotel is fantastic, close to all the sights and only about 10 minute walk to Brandenburg Gate. The staff are very nice and accomodating. However, there are a few things that I was disappointed about the hotel, the lighting in the room is abysmal, which is a pity as otherwise the room is great and we had to go back down to the front desk in search of our luggage as it was never delivered to the room. The the main disappointment was the restaurant. We arrived late in the evening and as it was sleeting outside decided to eat in the hotel instead of venturing outside. For a Friday night the restaurant was empty which is never a good sign. We ordered our meals and literally 10 minutes later the food arrived, tepid and appeared to have been reheated. For the price of the meal this was disgraceful. I would advise not eating there and inside going around the corner to the restaurant in the Marriott Hotel where the food and service is fantastic. Overall though it was a lovely hotel to stay in and I would recommend it...just dont eat there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Soujourner69
Reviews.Content: Going to spend the last couple of days of 2011 in Berlin we decided that we might as well splurge a bit for the occasion and our choice of lodging fell on the Ritz-Carlton. The hotels location at the Potsdamer Platz makes it convenient for sightseeing: the Brandenburger Gate, the Reichstag and the boulevard 'Unter den Linden' are within easy walking distance plus train and subway stations are located right outside the door. Our room was a standard one with a King-sized bed on the 7th or 8th floor. It was spacious & quiet came equipped with all the usual amenities and sported a big bathroom with a huge bathtub. Judging from my stay at another Ritz-Carlton property on a different continent before, the general design and style of the room is what one would expect from that brand. Hotel staff were friendly and amiable and offered quick and competent service. We didn't try out the spa or the breakfast, since we were more interested in seeing as much of Berlin as possible in a few days, so I cannot commend on those. Final verdict: nice luxury, great location, good value for money! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlaura
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right in the middle of Potsdamer Platz,we had a reservation at the club floor which is the best ,it worth the price,the service is perfect and they are doing their best to make you feel good. The restaurant is very expensive and the cuisine is not that good so I recommend to eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowHappyHolidays
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Calton Berlin is located in Potsdamer Platz with easy access underground to the railway and metro system in an area which represent the new Berlin adjacent the Sony. Within easy walking distance is the Holocaust Memorial and Brandenburger Tor. The hotel represents old classic values and the styling matches the services with its lavish marble stairs to exquisite chandlers complemented by the polite and helpful staff who will do anything to make your stay most enjoyable. Traditional and sophisticatedly decorated bedrooms accompanied by lavish luxurious bathrooms with amazing shower enclosure and the largest bath I have ever experienced in a hotel and as you would expect from the Ritz a bath running service. Beautiful Spa, with exquisite pool and sauna and punch pool prefect after a day exploring. A hotel for people who enjoy the finer things in the live….. I would love to return to Berlin to explore more of this fun and developing city and I would certainly enquire if the Ritz Calton had availability

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sylvester1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at theRitz-CarLton Berlin for two nights in early January 2012. We had read glowing reviews on TA and were looking forward to our stay. We were not let down. We arrived at about 4.30 pm and had to be at the Opera by 6. The staff managed to help us on our way as quickly as possible. We stayed on the 7th floor with a king size bed. I'm very particular with my bed and found the bed very comfortable. Overall we found the room clean, comfortable and very quiet. The bathroom was especially impressive with both a generous shower and bath. The French Brasserie downstairs was also a delight serving some impressive meals at odd hours when you need them. The staff were also excellent although I found a few of the native German male staff members a bit aloof. Location wise it was suitable for us being close to the Brandenburg gate and the stores around Galleries Lafayette although this won't suit everyone. In short, if you're in Berlinfor a few days to spoil yourself then the RCB would have to be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Moveround
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Ritz Carlton Berlin for 2 nights in August 2011. This hotel is a great place to stay. Breakfast is a bit difficult as everyone is milling around the same area. We had dinner one evening and it was very pleasant. I was quite sick with the influenza and the waiter and the maitre d were very concered and most helpful. They offered to arrange for a hot bath to be drawn for me and to call a doctor. We also had a late supper in the very relaxing lounge area. All the staff were great and our room was terrific with every ammenity. Our view was of the Berlin Memorial Wall right outside our hotel. This hotel is very central to many sights. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much Hyped - Sadly Vanilla”
Reviews.Author: wheresmyhat
Reviews.Content: A lot of hype in these reviews, which encouraged my family and I to stay here in January 2012. Sadly very vanilla experience, nothing really special. Not sure who is more snobby the guests or the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: jga831
Reviews.Content: I came here for Christmas 2011 and was very happy with the high quality of the rooms and the outstanding service. I've stayed at a number of Ritz's in my day and this one is the best. The staff all spoke English very well and the seasonal decorations were outstanding. The rooms were clean and very well put together with the best looking doors I have ever seen in a hotel. The room was also quiet and everything worked. We ate at the restaurant for Christmas Eve dinner with a friendly waiter and wonderful food. It is near the city center with an easy walk to the Unter de Linden (sp?) and right across the street from the train station and just one block from Berlin's subway system. The only negative I have - - and this is in a relative sense - - is that the workout facilities were run of the mill. Also, the pool may be soaking, but it is not a swimming pool by any stretch. Nevertheless, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Berlin, but not enough light in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AustrianVisitor
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fabulous, the rooms are spacious, quiet and nicely furnished. The service is very good, the staff well trained and friendly. The only big downside is the poor light in the rooms. Especially the bathroom lighting is a disaster. If you have to put on makeup - bring your own torch!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel,amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Hockedy
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin and also to this fabulous hotel. It has to be one of finest Hotels in the World. Excellent location, service, food and after-service. I left my bracelet in our room and they were very quick to send it on to me. We were on a business trip this time but will definitely return to Berlin and stay in this Hotel as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Ritz-Carlton Berlin. The fixtures and fittings all remain excellent, but the service has noticeably declined. Starting with the positives: my room was spacious and quiet and clean overall although I noticed some areas that hadn't seen a dusting for some time. The bed was easily the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the bathroom was well appointed, and the buffet breakfast was superb. But the negatives: 19.95 euro per day per device for slow internet, minimal free bottled water, overpriced minibar, some un-trained staff, many staff who didn't understand English, forgetful housekeeping, a gym that is modest but with no water save a usually empty jug open to the air, a tiny indoor pool, the carpet in the lift lobby on my floor remaining dirty for several days, conscientious yet obviously overstretched staff in the breakfast areas, a front desk staff who agree with your complaints but just shrug....all these things point to poor management. This was not in evidence on my previous stays. When I was checking in, a guest was loudly and rudely berating a front desk staff member about lack of service. I was embarrassed and felt sorry for the staff member, but after six nights in this hotel I can now sympathise with that guest.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful welcome! Taken to the Club Lounge and offered a glass of Champagne as we checked in, together with lunch from the buffet. We spent a couple of hours relaxing in the lounge before being shown to our room, 1009. A lovely room, chinzy but in a good way! The curtains were controlled by a panel on each side of the bed, together with the lights, including night lights under the bedside tables. A very comfy bed, although it had single duvets on a king size bed, comfy chair, desk, mini bar etc. iPod dock. There was also a plate of Doughnuts! The bathroom was quite big with two basins, a separate wc (with a glass door), bath and shower. The Club Lounge was excellent, with very good food displays and service, including free mini Mars bars! The Curtain Bar also offered very good service in a traditional setting. An excellent live singer/pianist gave it atmosphere, which went missing when he finished. The location is good, adjacent to Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous aesthetics but the service could be improved with two exceptions....”
Reviews.Author: Candi-O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz in Berlin in August 2011 for 4 nights with my Sister. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and in an excellent location but I must assume that the focus on business travelers rather than 2 professional women from Manhattan traveling for pleasure is not their preferred focus. I stay in Ritz Carlton hotels as often as I can because of the total experience but definitely felt that most of the staff seemed inexperienced and awkward. I say most because the Manager who handled a major mishap and one of the bartenders were of the RItz Carlton top quality ilk and I appreciated that. Upon check-in, the staff at the front desk seemed confused and wound up putting us in a room that was already occupied. After attempting to enter the room (I should add that the presentation of the room key in lovely card stock with the room number written beautifully was a great touch) several times, an angry (and rightly so) gentleman opened OUR room door dressed (thank goodness) in a Ritz bathrobe with an icy glare! With no words spoken, he pointed to HIS room number and we showed him our room key envelope on which the same number was written. He then slammed the door in our faces. Honestly, I totally understand his reaction to the disturbance. Stunned, my SIster and I laughed it off and lugged our bags back to the reception desk. We explained what happened to a staff member who quickly summoned a Manager. Upon hearing the situation, the Manager whisked us away to the bar to have drinks "on the house", ook our luggage from us and moments later, presented us with a new envelope containing a key to a beautiful junior suite. The upgrade was appreciated and the fact that the room was unoccupied was quite a relief this time around. The second exception to the odd service provided by the RItz in Berlin was the very thoughtful "Happy Birthday" cake slice (with a candle) and birthday greeting card from the staff that was awaiting our return to the room on the afternoon of my Birthday. That special touch coupled with the service in the bar and subsequent upgrade due to the first guest room mishap, were truly appreciated. What I found surprising was the lack of assistance from the Concierge desk (only general info that one would know from reading a guidebook introduction was provided), consistent misinformation about the hotel's business center and the overall sense that the each staff person that we encountered seemed thoroughly taken off-guard and ill-prepared for basic questions. In summary, I think that if one is traveling for business or does not need concierge assistance for a pleasure visit, then this hotel is perfect. As a well-prepared traveler who requires minimal guidance from a concierge with the exception of seeking info on the surrounding area of the hotel and "in the know" info about special events, I would have appreciated better service from the hotel. The RItz Carlton family of hotels is known for a luxurious overall experience and this particular Ritz needs to improve its customer service to be on par with its family members. That said, I did LOVE the junior suite and am always a sucker for birthday cards, which is why I rated this hotel "very good" instead of average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all posible senses”
Reviews.Author: Borja T
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for Christmas weekend. Can't complain about nothing at all. Excellent service, fantastic restaurant, fantastic bar... and great location. Any issue was solved in a really profesional way, of course this is what you expect from any 5* hotel, but this not always happens. Will come back for sure, and I for sure recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ants48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in March 2011 and had a great time. I was for some reason upgraded to the club level and therefore enjoyed a wonderful room with a supremely comfortable King sized bed and access to the Club Lounge which was very nice. The staff are all super friendly and professional. The atmosphere of the hotel is very upscale and very posh with all the chandeliers etc. The buffet breakfast was simply the best of any hotel I've ever been to with an enormous amount to choose from and it was all delicious. The staff were however a little slow in clearing plates etc, including that of tables that had already departed. The hotel is in the Potsdamer Platz area which is a great and modern area to stay. The Sony Centre at night has the Wow factor and the shopping mall was great. It's only a short walk to the Brandenburg Tor and the middle of this wonderful city. The pool area however was very disappointing, located in the basement of the hotel with no natural light and it was far to small for a hotel of this calibre. There is no hotel car service and the concierge desk was too small for the size of the hotel and had insufficient staff on duty, which has cost it the fifth star. Still, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. I am American travelling with my German husband and child. Like a lot of Germans I have met, he doesn't always see the value in spending money on luxury. When I convince him to splurge a little he better get every cent of his moneys worth or he will grumble and complain the whole stay. Being from America, I am used to great customer service and nice immaculate rooms, especially in a five star hotel. Both of our requirements were met by this hotel. We loved our Executive suite. The breakfast the first morning was fantastic with crepe/pancake bar, omelette bar, seafood, and all other typical breakfast foods you would expect, American, British and European. The second day we arrived a little bit later for breakfast and we had to sit in the annex. If we hadn't have been in the main breakfast room the day before we would have never known about the crepes, omelettes and other items as they were not in the annex dining room. We had to order it all through the waiter. That took a while but no complaints, the service was great. Two negative things 1) We wanted to do room service one night but we didn't like the menu offering at the Brasserie Desbrosses and it was expensive for the type of food they offered. But the resturants across the street in the Sony Center were good (and my husband loved the cheaper prices). 2) The hot water in my sink, one of three sinks in our suite, took for ever to get hot even though I had just used it and turned it off only a second ago. So I opted to waste water and energy by keeping the hot water running while I brushed my teeth and washed my face. But it wasn't enough of an issue for me to mention it to the hotel or request maintenance. Some of the positives for the hotel are besides the exceptional five star hotel experience, when my six year old was cooperative, we could walk to a lot of the sights in Berlin or take the subway which was very close by. So we didn't need our car. When she wasn't cooperative we just stayed in lovely pool area. Legoland discovery center was across the street so even when the weather was cold with blowing icy rain and snow we had enough to do within the hotel and nearby to keep us entertained. Lot's of little extras for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, festive stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tangek
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton Berlin approximately 2 weeks before Christmas, as a party of 2 parents and a 4 year old child. We booked the reservation directly with the hotel, in order to get both a rollaway bed for our son, and breakfast included. Our flight arrived quite late, and the room was guaranteed with our credit card, so we had no issues. The hotel lobby was decorated festively, with a large Christmas tree and homemade gingerbread house of the size of a small child. Our son loved both seeing the house as well as the train which ran on tracks encircling the house. To discourage looting from the gingerbread house, the hotel offered up baskets of chocolates for passers-by. Quite festive!! The hotel also had a small games table for kids, which our son loved, and also 2 miniature Mercedes cars which he pedaled around the lobby. Our room was spacious, even with the rollaway bed added. We had a king sized bed with a soft mattress topper and warm covers. The TV, which had ample foreign language selections (although not much for children) stood on a dresser across from the bed, which also housed the mini-bar. Our son was greeted with a small basket of candy, which he enjoyed. Free glass bottles of water were replenished daily. We also had a closet in the hall to hang our clothing, and an ironing board and safe were included. The room overlooked the neighboring building, so not much of a view. The bathroom was large and comfortable, with both a tub and shower, as well as a double sink. Somewhat unusually, the shower and toilet were enclosed behind the same glass doors, not really a problem except feet could get wet when visiting the toilet. Toiletries and amenities were plentiful, including robes and slippers. Breakfast in the cafe was spectacular. Selections were various and of excellent quality. We particularly enjoyed the made-to-order waffles and crepes, omelettes, and shaved prosciutto. Even the cheeses, fruits, and breads had quite interesting selections. And our request for foamed milk for our son was met instantly! A breakfast package is strongly encouraged. Our only word of warning is that the cafe filled up on weekends, spilling over to another room which wasn't nearly as nice. Wake up early on weekends to ensure a seat in the cafe. The location in Potsdamer Platz was excellent. We were directly across the road from S and U Bahn train stops. The Sony Center and shops were also across the street. A Vapiano restaurant (Italian chain) was on the next block, a particular favorite of our son. And a Christmas Market was in the square, giving us some fun in the evenings before we retired. A huge park was immediately behind the hotel. Also, we walked to Brandenburg Gate in approx 15 minutes. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel, but did stop for a drink in the bar. The ambience is incredible, and the bar filled up slightly later at night. Drinks were pricey but the overall experience is worth it. We would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “At the top”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect days! 2 nights in contrmprorary stylish luxury! Toooo fantastic! Great staff! Great food! Great bed! Great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: diane119
Reviews.Content: although we found the hotel lobby and the room in which we stayed lovely we found the service lacked the polish one would expect in a fine hotel. we check in after 6 o clock and went out immediately after showering. in the morning we found turn down service had not replaced the towels or shampoo. it took one hour for the new towels to arrive and frankly the attendant who serviced the bathroom had a body Oder problem. when we asked for a restaurant dinner recommeati9ond we were told no restaurant that ewe suggested compared to the hotel restaurant. we found the food to be over salted and the waitress poured our wine into the water glasses along with our water. the spa did not have plastic bags for our swim suits exc exc. on the whole our experience was poor and we would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and welcoming luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_FRA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at this hotel and were impressed. The hotel is furnished in a classic style which is warm and welcoming like every staff member we met. The location is perfect, directly at the Potsdamer Platz and 10 minute walking to the Bradenburger Gate. The check-in went fast and effective as you can expect from a Ritz. The room was very very nice, traditional style with all the charm of an "old age" like furnishing. My wife enjoyed a spa treatment and loved it very much. We had also drinks at the bar and we have been impressed by the atmosphere, the kindness of the staff and also the drinks were fine. We enjoyed the atmosphere of this excellent property very much. There are a lot of good restaurants and cool location within walking distance. I can recommend the hotel both for business and also for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “If only the rest of the city was as good!”
Reviews.Author: Thierry B
Reviews.Content: Think its existing rating and things people say about it already speak volumes of quality! I would just add that the lobby baris absolutely wonderful

Reviews.Title: “A Special Property - The Perfect Synthesis of Refinement and Gracious Warmth”
Reviews.Author: zenexplorer2
Reviews.Content: This is, by any measure, a truly exceptional property. The "hardware" is beautiful: elegant public spaces in traditional style, rooms with an incredibly warm, cozy and refined feeling, a spa with a beautiful current pool, multiple saunas, and a wonderfully bubbly whirlpool. But even better is the "software"..a consistently gracious, warm and welcoming staff ready to assist you is any way possible. I have had the pleasure to stay here many, many times over the last seven or eight years, and each stay has been impeccable in all regards. Any imperfection has been quickly reconciled and remedied; any problem immediately responded to. The concierge staff is particularly exceptional, with a great deal of experience and a graciousness that is in stark contrast to the sometimes "correct" but less than warm concierge desks in other Berlin properties. Food and beverage is exceptional. Room service is always prompt and well prepared, with even late night orders maintaining a very high level of preparation. Berlin offers an incredibly competitive hotel scene, with a broad range of choice at the high end, often at good value. And it is a large city geographically. The Ritz offers an experience that I believe is the equal of any to be found in the city. It is very traditional in design and architecture, but with a contemporary, "unstuffy" approach to service. While locational preferences may vary, I find the Potsdamerplatz area to be convenient. In the end, it is the warmth, refinement and consistency of the service that makes this hotel truly exceptional, even against the high standards of 5 star German hotels.

Reviews.Title: “luxury but with no soul”
Reviews.Author: y_nasi
Reviews.Content: i stayed in a elegant suite and i can't complain about the overall service, but in a city like berlin i feel this is not really a place to stay, being really distant from the spirit of the city. you can find much better choices in my opinion, more sophisticated even if less grand.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful anniversary experience, and exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOTELCONNOISSEUR1966
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at this hotel on the occasion of our 25th anniversary. We booked a 3 night stay and the hotel kindly upgraded us to one of their beautiful suites. All the suites and indeed rooms at this hotel are designed in a classic American style with dark cherry wood furniture with smart fabrics. My favourite suite is the Grand Suite and they are very spacious and superbly designed with magnificent bathrooms. We had booked access to the Club Lounge whch really is like a hotel within an hotel and what makes it truly memorable are wonderful staff over seen my the charming Fabian. The lounge is small and intimate and offers a very good array of food and drink throughout the day. The hotel has only one main restaurant which is a French style brasserie called Desbrosses. It is a large restaurant and features items from the original restaurant reclaimed from France. The food is good and the menu contains some interesting dishes. Service is generally good but you can be forgotten about if you sit outside. In my opinion the hotel would benefit from a Fine Dining restaurant and I was personally disappointed when Vitrum closed. It is nice to be able to dine in a different restaurant to where you have had breakfast. Service throughout the hotel is very high and you genuinely feel that nothing is too much trouble. A great hotel is more than a beautiful building with luxurious surroundings it is also about the quality and sincerity of the service and this is what makes the Ritz-Carlton Berlin a truly great hotel, not just in Berlin or indeed Germany but one of the very best in Europe and beyond. It is my belief that this excellence comes from the top and Mr Petrovic, the hotel's General Manager, more than supports this belief and is a truly great hotelier. There is so much more I could say about this excellnt hotel but my best advice is try it out for yourself. Thank-you to all the staff for making our anniversary a truly memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mortimer1995
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is new and yet old-fashioned. It's high class and therefore quite expensive. But you do get a lot for your money. The welcome is friendly, the bags are immediately taken care of and at the reception you feel, the personnel is well trained. The regular room itself is large and furnished with (almost) everything you need. The Bathroom is also very large with a separate shower cabin and a separate toilet. The bathtub is also inviting for an hour to relax. Everything seems to be furnished with with marble what gives the bathroom a very luxurious impression. The kind size bed is comfortable and, as requested, you can get feather-free pillows and duvets. You have lots of space, also to stow your bags and cloths. A minibar is available as is a TV and DVD player. What I did miss (and did get on request) was the tea-making facility. This should be generally available, I think. You can use the internet through an available cable if you have your notebook with book. In the times of tablet pcs and iPhones you need to have a wireless connection. And this is my only negative point in the room: You may have access, but it's expensive and not very customer-friendly. In a hotel like the Ritz Carlton this should be offered free, in my opinion. The breakfast at the inhouse french brasserie is amazing. You can't eat everything that's being offered here. Incredible what you can choose from. But the whole thing has its prize: EURO 38 for a breakfast is incredibly, too - even by acknowledging whats' being offered. Because you do not have much choice: The available continental breakfast offers not very much at a high price of EURO 25. And if you pick all the ingredients of your personal favourite breakfast separately it's far too expensive, too - and you reach the EURO 38 immediately. So the buffet is truly the only alternative. And when you do come for breakfast, without being asked what you REALLY want, the buffet is automatically being charged. The whole experience here is good, but you do not really feel like being in Berlin. It feels more like New York or Chicago. It's a Ritz Carlton branch right out of the catalogue with the same look and feel as everywhere else, so nothing really special. The big plus is the location at the Potsdamer Platz, though. And people are really very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon59
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton was one of my most pleasant hotel stays. Whether you travel on business or leisure it is a great hotel and in easy reach to most of the central attractions. Everything was just perfect, the staff, the room, the food and especially the service. I cannot highly recommend it enough. Pro: Staff, rooms, food, service and especially the drinks on the bar. Contra: The view out of the rooms was not amazing, but the room made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH”
Reviews.Author: Michele2247
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 nights @ The Ritz-Carlton Berlin, and couldn't fault it. Hotel immaculate, service superb, room and bathroom beautiful, location good, breakfast excellent. Every member of staff were delightful, especially the head Concierge who couldn't have been more helpful and professional. And loved the Beefeater, Robert! Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nouveau baroque chique that meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: HDYankee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the RC Berlin multiple times. It is my favourite hotel in Berlin. Everybody on staff, from the bell boys to the reception, the concierge, the room service, all the way to the service lady that lights the fire in the suite, is very capable and well-trained. The rooms are close to immaculate, beds are wonderful, the wooden interiors feel adequate, the design is plush, though close to decadent. The bathrooms are really nice as well, although the lime in the showers does need some attending to. The TVs need some updating as well. The breakfast buffet is unmanageably vast, the quality is top notch. Located right on Potadamer Platz, the RC is a real celebrity hotspot, especially during the film festival and other events and concerts. The chance of meeting somebody famous is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE”
Reviews.Author: dragon3333
Reviews.Content: Just on the potsdamer platz, immaculate view and location. RECOMMEND A+++++++ EVERYTHING IN THE WALKING DISTANCE. Restaurants, museum, close to Branderburger Tor,and everything you want to see in Berlin. WORTH EVERY PENNY

Reviews.Title: “6th Time and always the best”
Reviews.Author: ueno18
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms good outlets but the most important great staff! Will return anytime! Stayed between 2010 and 2011 6 times.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ritz - Disappointing Spa”
Reviews.Author: AboyGT2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. 3 block walk to to most attractions and across street from Sony Center. Typical Ritz hospitality right from doormen, check-in, housekeeping, and anyone from hotel staff we encountered. Beautiful lobby and bar area, with great bartenders. Stayed during August 2011 with wife and three children. We had two connecting rooms with views out onto Potsdamer Platz. Very elegantly decorated with high end furnishings and wonderful marble baths. My only complaints would be the spa and the buffet breakfast. As this was summer and we were there through a weekend the morning crowd was a little overwhelming for the restaurant. People were waiting to long for tables even after extra tables were set up in the bar area and lobby. Not to mention the very high price tag for the buffet. I highly recommend booking breakfast with the room. As far as the spa it seemed like an after thought. Very small pool area for adults as well as children and the sauna was very cramped. I understand this is a city hotel but it is newly built and spas are a very big part of the hotel experience these days. All in all I highly recommend this Ritz Carlton as one of the top modern hotels in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel right in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sueaussie
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton for three nights in September. From the moment we walked into the foyer we were treated like VIPs. The 'beefeater' who greets you at the door is very friendly and is happy to let you pose for a photo with him. Our room was large and luxurious with a very comfortable king size bed. The location is perfect. It is over the road from the Sony Centre with a large variety of restaurants and eateries to choose from. The train station is just over the road and you are within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate and the Holocaust Museum. If ever we are fortunate enough to visit the beautiful city of Berlin again, we will most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “So sad it's over...”
Reviews.Author: Rolini
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this amazing hotel, and all I can say is wow! The service was impeccable, all the staff was just amazing – anything you want, you shall get! The rooms – spacious, clean, comfy big bed with amazing sheets…that's the downside – as very difficult to get out of this amazing bed… The bathrooms – a dream! Marble all around, big bath tub, 2 sinks, and amazing shower. The breakfast – full of variety, cheeses, fish, bread, sweets, fruit – whatever you want. Kept me going all day.. The area – is perfect, the S BAHN (train and underground) is just outside the door, full of restaurants, and walking distance to everything. Alexander the concierge – just a smile from him every evening made our stay...always giving us good information, and always with a smile. David Solomon – tried to fix a problem that we had, he was so generous so understanding and so king – it made all the difference. So if you are thinking about a hotel in Berlin – think no more – this is defiantly the one. Will be back for sure. The only downside I have to say is that when we stayed, there was a very high profile VIP staying, they closed every street leading to the hotel with hundreds of policeman, police cars, motorcycles and dogs, every time he came in or out of the hotel, which meant no one goes in or out of the hotel. We got stuck for an hour in the cold evening outside the hotel. That's what we call "living on the Ritz..." :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: romandavydov
Reviews.Content: After week-end in The Ritz-Carlton Berlin in February 2011 I think this is best hotel in the city in terms of location, room quality and service. Conveniently located near U-bahn/S-bahn station, and surraunded by lots of cafe and gourme restaurants, it's right choice for week-end, leisure or business stay. Less then 1 km from most attraction, and only 6 EUR by taxi from railway station. Our friend get a birthday cake also. I'm very happy after this hotel and their look-like-new rooms with royal facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights using Marriott rewards points. Great location on Potsdamer Platz - 5 minute walk to Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden. Excellent service, very comfortable rooms. Wifi in rooms. Great bathrooms with walk in rain showers. Only criticism was the price of drinks in both the mini bar ( a small water €5!) and the bar but its the Ritz after all. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “totally impress me”
Reviews.Author: pumkinsnow
Reviews.Content: i had three nights at this hotel and never had any nights i could not stay awake!!! The hotel and all atmosphere put me to bed so quickly. I wish i had more meeting days in Berlin so that i could stay there longer......

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz-Carlton Berlin”
Reviews.Author: versusB
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton, Berlin, is truly an awesome place. A couple of friends and myself were traveling to Berlin for a weekend of fun. Having had booked a Suite at the Ritz-Carlton we were sure to have a great home for the weekend. Upon arrival we immediately recognized this stay will not simply be great no but just perfect! I also would like to point out that often a group of students, having a fun weekend in their mind, are not too well welcomed and treated in 5 star hotels! Not in the Ritz-Carlton Berlin. From the Bell-boy on to housekeeping Staff, Roomservice, SPA personnel, Front desk agents, Concierge, Bar etc everyone was incredibly nice and helpful it did not matter how often we called for the smallest thing we were always greeted professionally and always treated as kings! The Hotel is beautifully decorated with an amazing Lobby and a beautiful "La prairie Boutique SPA". The Rooms are luxurious and meet all expectations, does not matter if you are on business or leisure travel. Besides all this positive feedback i would like to leave on point to improve. The Bathrooms in the double rooms do need some renovations at some time in the near future, they are beautiful however for perfectionists they have some small mistakes. However, It was a pleasure staying at the Ritz-Carlton, and I will not even consider staying somewhere else at my next visit to Berlin! I can recommend this Hotel over any other in the City of Berlin and especially for those who are looking for perfect service! Also try out the Curtain club it has a unique atmosphere, this rich tradition followed bar in the modern "poor and sexy" city of Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AlisoTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at Potsdammer Platz. We walked to the Brandenberg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, and to various other sites. It's a perfect spot. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were a little bit smaller than the other Ritz Carlton's that I've been to (Dubai IFC & Moscow), but it was still nice. Loved the bar downstairs with the actual Beefeater...very nice guy. Their French restaurant was perfect for breakfast. Valet parking was fast and there were no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sunma
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel!!!!! Great view to Potsdamer Platz and the Wall....

Reviews.Title: “Did not know such excellent service exists in Germany”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: There is only one word for the experience...fantastic. The hotel is located where the Berlin wall was located at the Potdamerplatz. The PPZ station is opposite the hotel. Brandenburg Tor is a 5 minute walk away. The hotel itself is excellent, an old world charm. The building seems historical from outside. The lobby is grand. We had a twin bed room which was very large as per European standards. The room was pretty high tech also. The only thing is that WIFI was 20 Euros!!! Steep. The flip side is that the hotel is in the part of Berlin that was rebuilt after the wall came down and so there are not too many restaurants around the hotel. But this is nothing a short train or taxi ride can not solve. Very easy to get around Berlin. Taxis are plentiful. Our rate had breakfast included and what a huge breakfast it was. Almost every food option to start your day with. The service in the hotel is also excellent. Everyone spoke flawless english and always had a smile on their face. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Quality”
Reviews.Author: banksy677
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the Ritz Carlton, Stayed in a club room and have to say it was worth it. Many thanks to all the staff for making our 4 night stay memorable. Thanks Katty for the great service in the club lounge. This hotel has made me think of checking out if there is a Ritz Carlton on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, but poor concierge service”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtraveler23
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights. The room was a good size and the bathroom was great, separate shower and tub (huge) and double sink. Nice amenities in bathroom, although not great. Although the rooms are a bit pricey, we got breakfast included and access to the Club floor. the Club itself was probably the nicest I have ever seen. They put out food four times daily and the food, drinks and Internet access are all included. If you wanted to, you could probably just eat at the Club and save a fortune on eating out ( I think some people actually did this). But even if you just ate at the Club once per day, along with the other things included, it really makes the room price much more reasonable. The only let down was the Concierge desk. Several times I asked for information on certain activities and the Concierge on duty said he /she would get back to me and never did. Another time I asked the Concierge to make a reservation for us at a jazz club. Since we were heading out for the day, the Concierge said she would leave a message for us when we returned. No message. I called down to the Concierge, explained the situation to a different Concierge and said the performance started in an hour could they please confirm our reservation. No return call. We took our chances and went to the concert. No reservation had been made for us ( although we did get a table). In light of how wonderful the hotel was in every other way, this was really a major flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: fredalynn
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday Aug. 19th, 2011 and departed on Weds. Aug. 24th. This was our second time staying at this Ritz-Carlton and our fifth trip to Berlin. Our stay was excellent. The hotel is well maintained, the service is appropriate (friendly but not too familiar) and the concierge desk was most helpful, particularly with unusual requests. Karina, one of the concierges, "went the extra mile" to help solve some shipping problems for us. The breakfast that is served at this Ritz Carlton is one of if not the best I have had anywhere. The hotel's location (depending on what one plans to do in Berlin) is not, in my opinion, as convenient as that of The Regent or The Adlon but its other qualities more than make up for it. It is right across from the U-Bahn and an underground shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Opulence”
Reviews.Author: PaulF71
Reviews.Content: Modern Opulence Great location right on top of Potsdamer Platz. It is a tasteful mix of modern and traditional, the rooms are a very good size and come with all the accoutrements that one would expect of a five star hotel. The robes are fluffy and the slippers of a good size. The breakfast is something to behold and if it were not for work, I could have stayed there for hours. The service was immaculate and the staff ever helpful. Having stayed here on a number of occasions it is (for my money) the best hotel in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quality in all respects”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulAddicted
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton in Berlin exceeded our expectations. We were very warmly welcomed by Mandy who when were checked in arranged for our bags to be brought up and took us up to the room to show us the features. She was everything you would want from a staff member: warm, approachable and professional. The room was large and in very good condition and the furniture and fittings were lovely. It was a twin room with ample space between the beds, the desk and the sitting area. The bathroom was a particular standout with twin basins, a large separate bath and shower and toilet behind their own glass doors off the main bathroom area. The breakfasts in the hotel restaurant were plentiful and the dining room had a very nice atmosphere. The location is fantastic - for anyone who wants to be in the thick of it in Berlin, Potsdammer Platz is a location that is hard to beat with so many of the main sites within walking distance and one of Berlin's main railway interchanges 30m from the door of the hotel. We stayed 5 nights and on the 5th night we received a card and deserts from the staff in our room to thank us for our stay. We were thoroughly impressed with all aspects of the hotel and think it thoroughly deserves its ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine much better”
Reviews.Author: ibremner
Reviews.Content: We arrived early - before the normal check-in time - still our room was available on club level, and a glass of champagne and some small eats were on offer. Our room was comfy and looked out onto Potsdamer Platz. That began our experience, and with the club lounge open from 7 a.m. till 10:00 p.m., we were always able to have a bite to eat and some coffee, tea, or wine whenever we wanted. Though price was higher than for a normal room, surely this amenity was worth the incremenable cost. Also the friendliness and kindness of the staff in the lounge made us feel as if we were really coming home every day after our sightseeing. Though hotel is close to Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie and a good shopping mall, nonetheless, staff in the lounge provided detailed helpful advice on how to travel on underground and by bus to points near and far, i.e., Potsdam. Small negatives: It took four hrs. and two phone calls to have a sink drain adjusted in our room. Also the toiletries in the club rooms were just ordinary and not of the higher quality one might expect from Ritz Carlon. Overall, though, I can recommend this venue as top notch - the club lounge and its staff make this hotel one to which we'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in All Respects”
Reviews.Author: SarahInSoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Berlin for five nights in September. It was our third stay at the hotel and that alone should tell you something. We arrived rather late at night (after 10 pm) but the Club Lounge staff was still waiting to greet us, offer us a drink, and get us checked in. The gentleman who helped us was extremely helpful and efficient but also perceptive enough to know that we were exhausted after a long trek from California. We had everything we needed very quickly.
