Our room (we were lucky enough to have a corner suite) was beautiful. It had a large living area with a couch, chairs, a TV, desk and bar, along with its own half bathroom. The bedroom was also quite large looking right down at the Sony Center. The bed was huge and very comfortable. (One minor complaint was that the duvets on the bed were, at times, too warm. Given the lack of a top sheet we had temperature issues. Had we asked, I am sure they would have addressed it for us, but again, very minor.) The main bath had dual sinks, a shower and a separate small tub. The floor to ceiling white and grey marble was beautiful. As indicated above, we did stay on the Club Level, something we highly recommend. We took full advantage of the five daily food presentations as well as the drinks. Although a continental breakfast is laid out in the lounge, the team is more than happy to get you eggs or meats and cheeses. The breakfast and drinks alone made the Club Lounge worth the extra money. Plus the fact that wi-fi is included, makes it all the more worthwhile. We also took advantage of the Curtain Club bar one night (notwithstanding the free drinks in the Club Lounge). They had an amazing variety of choices and provided a very comfortable seating area. The spa was also wonderful although the locker areas were a tad small (but more than adequate). We both had massages, which were perfect after all of our tourist endeavors. Although we didn’t use the pool, it was a nice area to sit before and after our treatments. We found the hotel to be very well located. Most sights are within walking distance and if not, we had no problems finding taxis. I must give high praise to the Concierge team. Prior to our arrival I asked about a guide/driver to take us to Sans Souci and Potsdam. They arranged for “Till” (not sure I am spelling that right) who picked us up and gave us a great tour. I hope they pass along our praise and that they recommend him in the future. Service was excellent on all fronts. We were never waiting for our room to be made up or for turndown. Staying at this hotel is a bit like a fantasy at times. You never know what will be going on while you are there. Last trip a group of the Saudi royal family was there during our stay; watching their motorcade come and go was quite interesting. This time, on one evening as we were leaving to go to dinner we walked out of the elevator into the reception lines for a formal event – DreamBall to be precise, complete with formal gowns and paparazzi across the street. When we left Berlin the entire hotel was secured with barriers – we never did figure this one out but it was election day so assume it had something to do with that. In short, it is always interesting from the people-watching perspective. One final note: the hotel rolled out a new marketing campaign with pictures of the various staff members posted throughout the hotel. I love this touch and very much enjoyed looking at all of the different poses. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MayfairChick1
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. I loved the location. I had a corner room (915) which has two windows, really nice and clean. Highly recommend if you can get a decent price. Heard Tom Hanks and Halle Berry stayed here when they were filming Atlas Cloud. Too bad I just missed them.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless perfection plus kindness”
Reviews.Author: knollo
Reviews.Content: We've been through several of Berlin's self-denominated top hotels - and definitely, this one is the true #1. Not cheap, of course, and the bombastic style may not meet everybody's taste. But from bed to food, everything is flawlessly perfect, and what we like most is the staff - people who make you feel that they really love their job. More than just professionally kind, and whatever you ask for, you get a even a bit more than you expect. Q:"Late checkout till 2 pm?" A:"Would 4 pm be OK?" And so on. That's how a real top hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel in all except the location.”
Reviews.Author: bobbylion1234
Reviews.Content: best deal in berlin amongst top hotels. location is ok, but doesnt quite compare to adlons or romes, but otherwise top in every respect. not really something original - normal "american" glitzy look, but the rooms are huge, everything is perfect and breakfast is very good. what else does one need? i would recommend rooms higher up though

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetset65
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I ever visited. Spa is great. Food could be a little bit better.

Reviews.Title: “If you want good quality overall then this is the place”
Reviews.Author: L0veCr0atia
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be what we expected and more. Beautiful decorations and the rooms are very nice and large. The upkeep on the hotel is excellent and the decor is of high quality and standard. Room service very good and efficient. Can recommend anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Vitsk
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton, Berlin really is an absolute treat! Grand, elegant and classic - everything you would expect and more. The rooms are a great size (even just the standard) with quality fittings throughout. Large, beautiful bathroom and sparkling clean. The facilities (gym, spa, sauna etc) are first class. The location is excellent. Staff were all fantastic and always asking if there's anything they could assist with. As other travellers have recommended, spoil yourself. It's absolutely worth it and you will not forget the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never felt so welcome”
Reviews.Author: edithTheHagueHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in August and had a fantastic holiday. Staff is utterly helpful, kind and welcomes you with a smile. We booked a standard room and were surprised by the big space and the nice way it was furnished. As I am a wheelchair patient we asked the reception for a little chair to use in the shower and within 10 minutes an official showerchair for disabled was installed. During check-in someone must have noticed that my 60th aniversary did pass during our stay because at that day we found a lovely "happy birthday" cake in our room. The location at the Potzdammer Platz is very central and a good start to explore this fascinating city and, after a day of visiting the interesting highlights of Berlin, the Ritz Carlton is a great place to recover in all luxury in the fantastic spa, the beautiful lounge or just in your excellent bed. If I have to mention a negative point I'd say that the restaurant is rather everage for the prices that are asked but overall the Ritz Carlton is one of the best 5 star hotels we've ever stayed in and I can heartly recommend this hotel to everyone who searches a nice, welcoming and luxues place to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “the club level and spa are the best!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiboy
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel! german efficiency everywhere...every detail is taken care of. the spa with blue and gold mosaics is absolutely the most beautiful one I have ever seen, the services provided by la prairie and highly educated service personnel are a bonus. the massages are heavenly, especially the lomi lomi one. steam room and sauna are adjacent to the pool which is small but so beautiful, the glass mosaics were made in Italy and are a piece of art. the club level is so nice, one wants to stay there all day. i stayed there during the film festival and had the pleasure of having breakfast in the same room as some wonderful actors. very low key and sophisticated. the staff is highly trained, discreet, multi-lingual and take their job seriously. the best hotel in Berlin by far. Potsdamer Platz is of course an eyesore, with american style skyscrapers by Helmut Jahn and other architects...the Ritz is almost a copy of the art deco Chrysler building so it looks better than the surroundings. the Marlene Dietrich museum is opposite and worthwhile...wonderful hotel, great service and staff...and the club level...a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, great location, romantic stay.”
Reviews.Author: Pociag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August 2011 for our first wedding anniversary. The staff organized for a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolates to be sent to our room, complimentary. On top of this the concierge was very knowledgeable of nearby sights, made a reservation at a beautiful restaurant for our anniversary dinner and helped us organize transportation. All in all a very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling of opulence for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lavinia02
Reviews.Content: Our second trip - as we had stayed over New Year (which was fabulous as well!) Overall a wonderful stay - but a few points to mention (both good and not so good!) Very efficient check in - one (of the 2 rooms booked) not ready when we arrived but staff called us on mobile to alert us so we could return to the hotel and unpack Very nicely finished rooms - and fab bathrooms! Polished marble and fluffy towels - with beautiful (gold trimmed) robes and slippers Very attractive bar (which apparently wio an award) - very nice atmosphere No tea and coffee making facilites - and we were charged 15 euros for a kettle to be brought to the room - which arrived with only 1 cup (which was removed the following day - although kettle remained) Sunday morning we had to queue for the buffet breakfast - but it was worth the wait! SPa (and staff) were super - although pool is a little small (more a large plunge pool with a resister current to swim against) "Deal" included a free glass of champagne - nice touch but glasses presented only half full (which took the edge off the gesture!) Monday morning (a working day) we were woken early by the sound of workmen/refuse collectirs outside On the day we were due to check out the housekeeper rang our doorbell to clean the room at 8.30am!! And again at 9.30 When we checked out we found the breakfasts had been added to the invoice - but was removed as soon as we mentioned it Concierge and Door staff very helpful Overall a super stay - and do go to the Wintergarden to see the fantastic show "Forever Young". Also the City Segway Tour was a great success (and our tour leader Kevin Murphy was a great guide)

Reviews.Title: “Very nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rignana007
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay in a hotel where every effort is made to please young children, and where personal and friendly service is made to seem more important than the grand surroundings and marbled bathrooms. One thing that could improve is a better response to special food needs. Despite warning in advance that we would appreciate gluten-free breads and soy milk at breakfast, the best the kitchen could manage on the day was 'lactose-free' cow's milk.

Reviews.Title: “nothing like it in the western world - at a great value”
Reviews.Author: Exploration-2day
Reviews.Content: during my 22 years of travelling for business and pleasure, i've stayed in more than 200 hotels around the world + lived in quite a few so called "serviced apartments". none of them offers continuously impeccable service in every detail and from every employee - except the ritz carlton berlin. it's like having your own butler, but at a much higher level, as these "butlers" can deliver anything you can possibly imagine + a few things, you've never dreamed of... - and they never sleep: 5 outstanding cheeses served anywhere you like - at 4 in the morning, your favourite trousers repaired within a few hours (on a saturday) after an "accident" friday night, concierge getting you tickets for impossible long-sold-out events, access to "secret" clubs. one day my daughter wanted a special tattoo: no problem. we got an address in a spooky cellar in far east berlin managed by a real artist. my mother who just turned 75 stayed 5 nights at a special rate and nothing was to much trouble. during the stay she got hooked on the "bircher-müsli" and asked the chef for the recipe... "there you go, please". the breakfast served every morning is out of this world. make sure you don't miss it! the same goes for the sunday-champagne-brunch including as many oysters, lobsters, cold cuts, warm meals and desserts you can eat... - and of course free-flowing champagne (be careful - those servers fill your glass faster than you can finish it). when the weather allows it, you can get spoiled at the outside terrace with views to one of the new berlin landmarks; the sony center, a small park and the sunset over the tiergarten. rooms and suites are comfy, spacious and mostly taken care of by staff, who are long-time-loyal to the property. at my last stay i recognized the same maid in charge of my room, that also took care of things at my first stay more than 6 years ago. ritz carlton berlin is a classic, 5 star grand luxe property and the coolest thing is, that everything glides in a smooth, cozy, down-to-earth-attitude that a lot of the "hip" hotels don't practise anymore. maybe because they are busy trying hard to be cool. only one single thing stands out: internet is slow and you pay extra. not very 2011 ;-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel on the east west berlin boundry”
Reviews.Author: arikcz
Reviews.Content: ive been to a lot and this is a great hotel. spotless rooms, comfy beds, iphone speaker, great bathroom etc. lobby is cool. breakfast is outstanding but overpriced at 38 euros per head - go for it if youre ritz. service was cherrful helpful and much appriciated. location is close to park, brandengate, trainstation and museums

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels that I've stayed in...esp service-wise”
Reviews.Author: JaneTraveler2
Reviews.Content: This was a phenomenal hotel! Staff was inCredible. Facilities were top notch. Just an amazing stay. Accommodated my husband and 2 babies perfectly! Would stay again in a heartbeat. Berlin was also a great city. Also the doormen were so welcoming...even drove us to the train station in the hotel car.

Reviews.Title: “First stay”
Reviews.Author: dablair99
Reviews.Content: Stay was ok, and price not bad for Ritz Carlton, but did not live up to expectations. Service other than exceptional conceriege and doormen was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Never again suite and bed were beautiful but they dislike Americans and show it!”
Reviews.Author: HollyRadar
Reviews.Content: The Suitw was old fashoined but large and beautiful, clean, the bed was so comfortable the linen was incredible, the bathroom beautiful swimming pool and spa lovely, Breakfast was the best we ever had....... The staff reception all downstairs staff were horrible rude abrupt, did not like us Americans or British if you were and obvious Arab then they so nice!....... I telephone reception to ask if we could use the laptop in the room and was told " ABSOLUTLY NOT" we needed to pay extra!...... We were so irritated we checked out after 3 days and moved to a hotel in Potsdam and saved ourselves over $1000. Why should we stay were we are not welcome ?.

Reviews.Title: “To Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Really high standard hotel. Beautiful rooms with great service. Fab cocktails in the bar Staff very attentive. Good location near subway and easy walk to sites

Reviews.Title: “Would recomend this even with a few faults”
Reviews.Author: Kritisk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May, 4 girlsfriends and we all loved it. Only thing we did not like, was the problem with spabooking. We booked Spa for Saturday on Friday, but then they told us Friday night that we could not get the times we had booked after all. Very dissapointed. Breakfast is way too expensive, so go elsewhere. We did not eat at the hotel, bu the bar was nice to have a nightcap after dinner elsewhere.Also we were suprised over the tightness of shampoo and soap, we asked to get more but had to ask again. Beds and room are nice, spotless clean and good value. Location is super, consierce brilliant and doorman also very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel, with excellent Club facilities”
Reviews.Author: DrKaron
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is a beautiful, immaculate hotel that borders the 'Old East West Divide'. If you can take advantage of the Club package, do so as this gives you access to complimentary 5* food and drink facilities throughout the day and evening, and ultimately saves you a fortune. The staff can not do enough for you, in fact, their fanatical cleaning sometimes gets a little overwhelming. The Club accommodation is very spacious, elegant and comfortable. We enjoyed 5 fabulous days at this hotel, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in ideal position”
Reviews.Author: Keith M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in August and could not fault any aspect of our stay.By staying on the club level the breakfast and evening food presentations makes eating out unnecessary and the champagne and drinks another bonus..The rooms are large and luxurious the staff friendly and efficient and the location on the Potsdam Platz couldn't be better. One of the best hotels we have ever experienced anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The Superlatives are Appropriate!”
Reviews.Author: geodog88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, and I echo all the highly positive comments. Excellent service, exceptional room, good facilities (though the pool could be larger), and one of the best overall stays we've experienced. It was my partners birthday, and I asked for something sweet to be sent to the room and they offered to send a chocolate cake. There was timing issues - I expected it with the turn-down but it wasn't there - but when I asked they appologized and asked for a better time. They ended up traking when we returned from dinner (at 11:30 pm) and a delicious chocolate mousse cake was delivered shortly after we arrived in the room. Be sure to ask for water from the bell stand, it's complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel that is the epitome of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: sar2036
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for four nights in July 2011! The hotel is pure luxury, emphasised by the fact that the Real Madrid football team were staying whilst we were! The rooms are spacious and grand and the service that you receive whilst staying at the hotel is fabulous: nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they are more than willing to recommend good restaurants and make reservations for you! Considering we paid £100 a night, we think it was a complete and utter bargain as you pay more for a damp and dirty travelodge in London. It must also be noted that the beds and bed linen help you have an amazing night's sleep! Book it, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel at the heart of the reunification of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: leonardo_1964
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my wife during 2 days for a seminar. The position of the hotel is excellent at Postdamer Platz which is a highlight of the history of Berlin. It has an original architecture (like a US building of the 30's) and very luxurious facilities. The room was really big and the bathroom very luxurious as well. The only negative item is the fact that the capacity of the restaurant where you can have breakfast was limited, so that we had to wait before getting a table. I believe however that it occurs not very often, i.e. only with big seminars. If you can afford it in Berlin, get there !

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Z-brox
Reviews.Content: OK. So it's Ritzy! Great doormen. Umbrellas to borrow for walks. Valet parking. Kinda boring Potsdamer Platz, but cool in way... Mini Manhattan. But - €38 euro for a breakfast buffet!!! And - no free wifi! But great staff. And a great bar (but I didn't dare to look at the prices) Advice - book a room on Club Level (10th floor). Cost a bit more but still below €300/night for a double, Here you get the full VIP thing. Including a private reception desk, free drinks, lunch buffet and a club-library with big TV and fireplace! Like a B&B on the 10th floor! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “No surprises - great service and location”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on a sightseeing trip. The hotel is perfectly located to walk to the main sights and of course its next to Potsdammer Platz tube station. The breakfasts are fantastic but are of course not worth the headline €38 per person so make sure you book one of the B&B deals which will work out much cheaper for you. Rooms are huge and very comfortable. The staff are very willing to help. Only gripe is that the hotel seems to want to "ration" use of the WiFi as its €5 per hour - it should be inclusive at this kind of hotel. If it rains then the hotel has plenty of umbrellas. Berlin has plenty of great places to eat. If you dont want to go far for food then try the great Asian restaurant ,COA, which is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Czechgolfer
Reviews.Content: I can hardly find a better place for business trip. Though this is one of the most expensive hotels in Berlin you get good value for your money. Variety of food offered for breakfast was excellent. The staff was simply perfect. For example they fixed a problem with my key card within two minutes. The hotel is convenintly located - all main attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: easternbear
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, Excellent central location. I was amazed at the price we got this booked for as well some fantastic deals for this hotel out in internet land...

Reviews.Title: “Comfy digs, great staff, central locale ... not outrageously priced”
Reviews.Author: chicagocowgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin in late March, 2011 and stayed at the Ritz Carlton through an American Airlines vacation package. Granted, it was off season, but the Berlin air was crisp, the days sunny, and the daffodils in bloom. I would highly recommend Berlin at this time -- no crowds, decent weather and great service and sights! One of the best features was returning to the Berlin RC every night after a long day of touring. The staff are superior -- there is a real team atmosphere there -- and very knowledgeable about restaurants in every price category -- from off-beat pubs to upscale establishments. They know how to get everywhere in town (and out to Pottsdam -- a historical day trip not too be missed.) We did not stay on the hotel's club level, but were very comfortable nonetheless. Food in the hotel is expensive, and I would recommend going out for meals -- but a drink at the bar when it opens each night at 6pm (with quite a dramatic flair) is a fun indulgence. Vapiano -- right at the corner near the hotel's front door -- is a great spot for casual pizza and salads. All in all, would highly recommend the Ritz. It is comfy, and not stuffy at all in terms of atmosphere. Enjoy Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmom45
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel that I have given all 5 stars. It was that fabulous! My husband and I stayed here in October and loved every minute of it. We are in our early 40s and are American. We got a great deal for the Club Level and it was worth every penny. We ate our breakfast, and often lunch, there, and met friends for drinks every evening. The champagne was wonderful and the service was even better. They could not do enough to make us feel welcome. The club concierge even booked our train tickets to Cologne. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right next to the public subway station and many beautiful historic monuments (the Holocaust Memorial was incredible. Beautiful and haunting at the same time). And there was a Starbucks around the corner - loved a little taste of home and free WiFi. Finally, the restaurant downstairs was fantastic. Great food and our server was fabulous. I can't remember his name, but he was a cute young man from the countryside, who should go to Hollywood, he was so entertaining! What a fun night! We loved Berlin, found the people incredibly warm and welcoming, and hope to get back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoonySwiss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for two days for his birthday. We had a Club Room, and we were greeted very warmly and friendly at the reception area in the lobby, then we were whisked up to the Club Lounge Reception area for check-in accompanied by a glass of Champagne. We had a very nice, cosy room with the most comfortable beds that I've ever slept in (which are apparently made exclusively for the Ritz-Carlton). It was very quiet, despite being right on the Potsdamer Platz. The Lounge Service was friendly, helpful and very attentive. Breakfast and Dinner was very good. We particularly liked the fact that they put a birthday cake in our room for my husband. The bathroom was spacious, with seperate shower, toilet and bath. It was very clean, and the cleaning service was impeccable. For my taste the service in the hotel lobby (the concierge in the lobby especially) didn't give me a great feeling. I felt distinctly judged by our appearance, which probably didn't live up to the usual Ritz-Carlton expectations (mainly because it was incredibly cold and wet and we had to wear our outdoor jackets, which we didn't really plan to do) and we felt catergorized as "not so important". Concierge Service on the Club Room area was very good, though. If you like a plush, cosy and very luxurious hotel, this is very well located and probably ideal for you. I'd recommend it and probably will try to go there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very elegant and the service is great. The location is not bad, is is at walking distance from the center of Berlin but most probably is better to use a taxi. The room are very elegant and large, the resturant is nice but expensive as the hotel. The SPA is nice. The quality is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: brazilian2005
Reviews.Content: Best location in town! walking distance to everywhere or buses and metro in few steps. Room very elegant and the bed was extremelly confortable, good towels but the soaps, shower gel and lotion were not replaced, had to ask to.. Lobby with fresh flowers, very elegant. Breakfast excellent. Very good concierges, always there to help. Internet paid is a shame! It's like charge for air... is sooooo more nice to provide it for free... Probably in the future all hotels should offer it free. I know it is a great way for the hotel to make money but for me, as a guest who is already paying for the rate and know how much internet costs today, it's not understandable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ilbucofan
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Ritz with a great rate under $200. Cannot beat the location, service and room for this price. Thank you Trip Advisor for leading me to Trivago! A new hotel, only five years old, wih great rooms and good service. The concierge was very helpful with recommendations and reservations. The only quibble we had with the hotel was the expensive and very slow WiFi. At €20 per device per day it should at least be fast! Just go to the Starbucks around the corner - fast and free!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except one thing...”
Reviews.Author: JonatanLoter
Reviews.Content: I'm from Buenos Aires, Argentina and I booked my staying in this hotel instead of many others very nice hotels in Berlin because first of all, I wanted to experience the Ritz Carlton for my very first time and also because in equal conditions with other hotels, I thought that the Ritz Carlton has a very much better reputation and guest service. I left my home on Monday July 4th at 8am towards the airport and arrived to the hotel Tuesday at 1pm, that means 29 hours after I left my home. When I get in touch with the front desk for check-in, I filled out the check-in form and they asked me for a cell phone number in order to call me when my room will be ready... They didn't tell me the room wasn't ready, they asked me for a telephone number. And they told me two times that the check-in time is after 3pm. I asked in a very good maner for a room, i spoke to the reception manager and he told me that he can't do anything. Imagine the situation of being completely destroyed after 29 hours flight, almost falling asleep, dirty, and in a city that you don't know at all. And without a room, and it wasn't 7am, was 1pm. This caused me a very bad first impression, and during my two hours stay in the lobby, I wrote an email to the hotel manager explaining this situation. He wrote me back right away, with very nice words and saying that he deeply apologizes for not meeting the high-quality service level that the hotel usually offers. He sent me fruits to my room and gave me two nights for free whenever I would like to you them. This said, I must admit that it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. The concierges are great, as well as the reception and cleaning staff. The rooms are HUGH, VERY NICE decorated, extremely clean and the bathroom is really big and clean. The bed and the pillows are soooo confortable... The neighborhood is very nice. There is an underground station one block away, a shopping mall with restaurants and a supermarket two blocks away. And please.... Free internet in rooms or at least, in the lobby! I don't understand this....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttons74
Reviews.Content: Fabulous big room, great service & location, we were fortunate enough to get a complimentary upgrade and the hotel delivered some surprise birthday cake to our room as I'd mentioned it was my husband's 40th birthday, would definately recommend this hotel, only disappointed we didn't stay a little longer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not of Ritz standards”
Reviews.Author: Amits
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at a nice location walking distance from most of the local tourist attractions. parliament, holocast memorial, etc all under 5-7 min walk. Large number of eating options near this hotel - sony centre is adjacent so many options there as well as stand alone restaurants. This is suppose to be an upmarket area so food and drinks here are more expensive. The door man and the other service staff are excellent with their recommendations. The day we arrived was the last day of a carnival in berlin - would not have known untill the door man asked us to consider going just as we stepped out first thing in the morning. Turns out over 20,000 people were there with lots of music food and local and other cultural things. On the hotel, its nice with good service. Rooms are large and nicely appointed. However, I am sure Ritz must be struggling to justify this hotel under their brand. It has one restaurant which doubles up as a breakfast room, one bar and limited public space. If there was a swimming pool, we couldnt find it. The room does not have a list of things to do in thehotel which is typical of this type of a hotel. The room ammenities are not befiting a ritz carlton hotel. Overall great hotel, excellent staff but not a Ritz Carlton in standard

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, very central location”
Reviews.Author: vamanosNc
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with impeccable service. The rooms a spacious and the bathrooms are huge. There is a good workout area and a cool pool which is small but Has that endless pool current in it. The jacuzzi was nice but not quite hot enough. There are two coed dry saunas which were very nice. I mentioned to the concierge that it was my daughters birthday, and she delivered a complimentary chocolate cake to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with an outstanding club lounge”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Ritz Carlton Berlin in a Club Room. I do not regret my choice at all. This experience was lovely in every bit. Pros: - Good room size (approx. 35sqm) - Outstanding club lounge with real meals (beef filet with mushrooms for dinner) for free - Very caring service (especially at the club lounge) - Very reactive: I had some issues with the Wifi at 23:00 and in 20 minutes, I had a new room where wifi was no problem. - Lovely bar Cons: - The spa is clearly disappointing for such a hotel: The swimming pool is tiny and the massage I got was average, nothing more. - Expensive internet To explain in further details my point on the Spa, here were the negative points: - Therapy room not really prepared before I came in: music was not on, the towels were not prepared, wrong lighting and so on - Average quality of massage, really nothing outstanding - Locker rooms are a joke, looks like a public swimming pool locker room... Apart from the Spa, this hotel is truly a 5 star and I will definitely be back (but will use the Adlon Day Spa for treatments)

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JTen10
Reviews.Content: This RC is among one of the best I have stayed in. Its location at Postdamer Platz is unbeatable. The Gemaeldegalerie (Old masters paintings) is a short 5 mins stroll. I visited it 2 times during my stay. Museum Island (the chief purpose of our visit) is 10 mins by taxi. I was in awe - the Ishtar Gate is beyond belief. Nerfetitti made me weep. The Mao painting by Andy Warhol at Hamburger Bahnhof (previously a subway station converted into a museum) is a great place to spend the afternoon. All the other major attractions such as the Brandenburg Gate and Jewish Memorial Park are within 10 minutes walk. We visited the "huge" mall next to the hotel and it was lame. Maybe I am not doing it justice here but we Hongkongers are just so spoiled for choice when it comes to shopping. We spent an hour at KaDeWe which is the Harrods equilivant in Berlin. I did purchase many branded goods (Gucci/LV/BV) on Friedrichstrasse street (10 mins by taxi) from the RC. We took up a club level package which is a must for anyone staying there. In our big room we could see sunrise with beautiful city view. Breakfast at the club was great but lunch and dinner could be better. They sent up a bottle of champagne and a huge plate of strawberries to celebrate our anniversary. The small swimming pool is not worth a try. Unlike other RCs, I noticed the great team spirit among the staff. The club level staff are all well trained and efficient. Though I must say the concerige (male) was a little stuffy and tended to treat the non Europeans differently. We took the train to Prague after Berlin. The main train station is 5 minutes away by taxi. I will defintely come back again be it for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel overshadowed by some unfortunate service”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on the club level. The service was amazing beginning with some of the nicest, friendliest, most helpful doormen I have EVER encountered. The check-in was somewhat inefficient. I asked to have a $100 bill exchanged in Euros and two front desk clerks and a supervisor were unable to make it happen after about 10 minutes so I just said I would do it later. The club was beautiful with courteous, helpful staff; great food and comfortable environment. The room was beautiful -- comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom and all the amenities expected at a Ritz Carlton. Even after writing to the hotel, and getting a "heartfelt apology" but no explanation for this behavior. Unfortunately two incidents left a sour taste in our mouths. One night after returning from the theatre, a security guard followed us into the front door of the hotel and up the grand staircase before finally barking at us, "What are you doing here?" We were dressed appropriately, were not being loud or disruptive -- so this completely caught us off-guard. We were told we were "not allowed" on the grand staircase in the lobby that the stairs were "closed" even though there was no signage to that effect and we had seen people there early in the day. On the day of our check out we had some coffee in the hotel bar waiting for our car to the airport and the service was horrendous -- it took almost 20 minutes to be acknowledged and then another 20 minutes for our order to be taken. When it came time to pay after 10 minutes the server came to our table and informed me by Amex Platinum card was denied and I would need to provide another card. Knowing no reason for my card to be denied, I reluctantly gave him another card. After another 5 minutes with no bill to sign, I returned to the cashier stand and was told their credit card lines were down and that was the reason neither card was working. They asked that I pay in Euros but I informed them that I did not have any and finally the guy said that the coffees would be complimentary given we needed to leave for the airport and their lines were still not working. As we were leaving the bar the server came running after us saying the credit card finally went through and asking us to pay for the coffee. Not the most luxurious of encounters to say the least....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mikethebaggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I've stayed in. The level of service was exceptional. The staff were professional yet friendly and warm. The room, breakfast and restaurant/bar were all great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MarkPP
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Berlin and stayed at the Ritz Carlton Berlin. The hotel was fantastic and in a great location for the sights - 5 minute walk to Checkpoint Charlie in one direction and 5 minute walk to the Brandenburg gate in the other direction. All staff were helpful, polite and happy. Room was a good size and bed was very comfortable and bathroom well fitted. Struggling to find negatives - Wi Fi wasn't free and no iron in the room is the best I can come up with. Breakfast was included within our room rate (we booked with Expedia and paid £10 per person per day above the room only rate whereas if you just turn up the breakfast buffet is €38) and we would recommend it. The quality was fantastic and had loads of choice although was a little busy on the Sunday. Bar was cosy and had a good atmosphere with live music on the Saturday night. A great stay and would highly recommend. Would point out that due to recent security changes you now need to register on line to visit the Reichstag dome a few days in advance - we were disappointed to miss out on this and isn't mentioned in the 2 current guide books we had.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Susie_Stevie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend over the May bank holiday and had a wonderful time. None of us had been to Berlin before so wanted to take in many of the tourist attractions, which were all within easy walking distance (Brandenberg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc.). We really couldn't fault the hotel, from the time we arrived to when we left. The concierge was really helpful advising us on restaurants, travel distances and checking us all in for our return flight. The room was spacious, very clean and the bed extremenly comfortable. Highly recommended for anyone who wants a bit of luxury in a convenient, but quiet, location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: thebung
Reviews.Content: Ok, total luxury throughout and the restaurant served great food and wine in a nicely appointed setting. No complaints, but my side of the bed was a bit wonky and uneven due to the mattress top protector. I should have asked them to address it sooner, became ok later after I pulled the sheets up so the room service could see it. Everything else is good re location etc.... Walk to everything in Mitte. Might try the other top one next time right next to Brandenburg Gate as its been highly recommended. Porters do expect tips, you can tell what their attitude to service is when you do it, so that was a bit lacking in guest centred approach. I wonder what treatment we would've got if we did not generously tip the bag porter on arrival, I shudder to think. Minibar and wifi a total rip off. Overall too business centred rather than tourist friendly was what I sensed. Nice live piano bar music wafting thru the foyer every night. Top jazz pianist/singer. Nice welcome chocolate on arrival. Amazing bath room. Receptionist at checkout friendlier than check-in but nothing to complain about at all. In fact check-out was first class. Great location for The Berlin Philharmonic orchestra concerts next door. We enjoyed the luxury. Foyer, corridors, carpet, lifts all amazing. Cherry wood fittings in rooms amazing. They did not skimp on furnishing. General comment for hotel management: teach your porters to put guests first and not focus on a tip, no matter what. This is what the best hotels we have stayed in do. Service and all paying guests come first. Attitude is easy to detect.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fantastic hotel, location and service - our club level experience”
Reviews.Author: joe_anne123
Reviews.Content: After a few days in Berlin on business, we treated ourselves to a night at the Ritz Carlton. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left we were made to feel like really special guests. The service from everyone we encountered during our stay was second to none. We booked a club room which was on the 10th floor with a great view over Potsdamer Platz. We arrived a little early, but were taken right up to the club lounge and offered a glass of champagne while we checked in. The club lounge was great with views over the Tiergarten, the staff friendly and attentive with a good selection of drinks and quite substantial snacks available. We tucked into cheeses, meats, bread, olives, fruit and white and dark chocolate fondues with wine before we went out for the evening, and found we didn’t want any dinner! Hot food and plenty of other choices of savoury and sweet snacks were also available. We returned to the club lounge for coffee before retiring to bed. The room was amazing and the bed just heavenly. We were fascinated by the automatic curtains, which open and shut by the touch of a button! The bathroom has been described in one of the recent reviews so I won’t repeat that here. Robes were provided, and slippers were placed by the bed on little bedside mats by the turn-down service. Breakfast was served in the club lounge again: an order of magnitude above the usual breakfast buffet fare with organic cereals, fresh blueberries, raspberries, freshly squeezed juices, smoked salmon, eggs made fresh to order, and much more besides. It was all so lovely that I really did not want to leave. We both left smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort in a great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: tallulah_p
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to secure a good deal for a two night stay using Trivago. Upon arrival we were unable to check in as we were a couple of hours early, but we were offered the use of the Spa if needed to freshen up. Our corner room was extremely spacious with huge windows, writing desk and chair, and all the amenities you would expect from a 5*. The bathroom was well stocked, including a decent hairdryer, scales, illuminated make-up mirror ,double sink, bathrobes and slippers. The toilet was seperated by an etched glass door. The only thing missing was a kettle - and at 4 Euros for a cup of tea, that was a little hard to swallow! Infact the mini-bar and in-room menu prices were over the top, but we found a handy mini supermarket down in Potsdamer Platz UBahn station that sold water for 50 cents and cheap chocolate etc! The only other downsidesare the size of the pool (small) , the incredibly small changing rooms in the Spa, and no free Internet access. We paid 6 Euros for 1 hour WIFI. The bed was the most comfiest I had ever slept in and I appreciated the separate quilts. We needed an iron & board which was delivered within 5 minutes of our request. Nothing was too much trouble, although we would have appreciated being shown how to use the lifts, as you have to swipe your room key in order operate it. We did see some other guests being shown this by a member of staff - but not sure why we were not offered this help? We indulged in cocktails at thebar at 14 Euros a pop. Service a little slow, but the drinks were great. As for location, the hotel is right next to the train station and a short walk around the corner is the Brandenburg Gate, Tiergartern and Unten Den Linden. It's a good location for sightseeing but not great for restaurants and nightlife. There are a few cafes which are fine - Vapiano is a novel Italian cafe where you are given a credit style card and then you queue at salad, pasta and pizza bars whilst they cook your food freshly. It's cheap and tasty. But you will need to travel for better fare. Highly recommended was the Insider Tour. 4 hours worth of your time. If we had been staying longer, we would have done more tours. All in all, a wonderful hotel with understated service and top class facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and supportive staff”
Reviews.Author: Kikeguass
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the hotel in a pre-paid package. Accommodation was wonderful and, in general, services provided were in line with expectations associated with a stay in a 5-star hotel. At chek-out, there were some different views on the interpretation of the "package" we engaged, but staff finally accepted our interpretation of the terms of the contract regarding breakfast (in our view, the term "daily" should mean "Every day", not day one).

Reviews.Title: “Memorable - but not for the reasons you'd like.”
Reviews.Author: stevekub
Reviews.Content: We had booked a long weekend stay at the Berlin Ritz Carlton over Easter. We originally booked a Junior Suite with a $200 credit and free breakfast, although upgraded to a Bellevue suite upon check-in. This was unexpected, as Ritz Carlton does not normally upgrade, and we were also told upon check-in that we would have access to the Club Lounge. Again, this was unexpected as well, and we thought this was a great gesture. We also asked for a late checkout (3pm) to accommodate our late train departure. The suite, located in 604, was very nice and comfortable. Everything was in working order, and no visible issues were identified other than some damage to the marble in the toilet in the master bathroom area by the door. However, this looks to be repaired fairly well. What seemed like a great experience upon check-in quickly turned into a strange series of events, my partner and I wondered if we were in an alternate universe. A day after check-in, we decided to go to the Club Lounge after a day of sightseeing. We attempted to use our key cards to gain access to the club level, and found out it wasn't working. We went downstairs to inquire about this, and the reception staff was less than helpful. We were told that under no circumstance were we told we had Club Lounge access, and that we should have been grateful that we received the "double upgrade" from a "standard room to a suite". Moreover, the staff indicated that we were "already given internet access for free, and we had a 170 Euro / 200 Dollar credit". So, in almost no time, we were made to feel like unwelcome moochers versus welcome guests in a moment by the staff, when we were the ones (upon check in) surprised by the offer of lounge access (which is NOT given to anyone just because of status) and the upgrade (which is NOT given to suite holders) upon check-in. I guess the ignorance or incompetence of the staff upon check-in allowed them to offer us too much, and then cover up their error by stating that we were making it up. Needless to say our experience with the staff did not improve when we called down the next day to ensure our check out time was still 3pm (as promised upon check-in, but again, many other promises were made). Reception staff made the off-the-cuff/rude comment about "3pm is very late", and after a sour look from them, confirmed that was our check-out time. We skipped breakfast the first day for sleep, so our first experience with the buffet breakfast was on Easter Sunday. Breakfast was not in the restaurant, but a mishandled mess of an event in the lobby/lounge. We were told to sit "anywhere in the bar or surrounding area", even though the area was not set up with silverware/glasses/plates/etc. Then we were given sour faces for sitting in the bar area (as told by the staff), and moved to another area. If I had to pay the 38 Euros for breakfast after this experience, I would have felt very cheated, as many of the items that are supposed to be on the buffet were not. The next day (Monday), breakfast was in the Restaurant Desbrosses, and this was a 180 degree turn from the experience the next day. The buffet was expansive, and included all that was promised. A caveat to those visiting - make sure the buffet is in the restaurant vs. in the lobby or other dining area - otherwise, you can spend 38 Euros somewhere much better. I was hoping for a better experience at this hotel, as I was very impressed at check-in with the staff and the welcome I received. This quickly turned into an experience that made my partner question loyalty to the Marriott/Ritz Carlton frequent guest program (as a Platinum member), and me question the true quality of this hotel. I certainly hope this was a one-off problem due to junior staff working over the holiday weekend; however, this will make me think twice about where to spend my money in the future as well as the true value of brand loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in many ways”
Reviews.Author: zigmund
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the Club level rooms on the 10th floor over a long weekend and enjoyed every single minute I was there. In fact, I spent more time in the hotel than I would normally do, not because Berlin was boring (far from it) but because the hotel really was so welcoming. Food & drink was available throughout the day from breakfast starting at 0700 until the end of the evening service at about 2100. I found myself having breakfast, heading out for a few hours, returning to the hotel for some food, a small siesta, a swim and then heading out again, then back again for a little something and then heading out again. I could certainly have got food elsewhere around Berlin, but it was just so nice in the ritz Carlton and it broke up the day in a nice way. The staff were very attentive without being over the top, very friendly, greeted everyone by name, remembered drinks orders from the night before, etc . . . There are a number of hop on-hop off bus routes just across Potsdamer Platz and you can get tickets for €15 or €20 depending on the company. They all seem to go to more or less the same places. The location is brilliant - on the walk to Checkpoint Charlie (about 10 minutes) you pass "The Topography of Terror" which is an exhibition which pulls few punches, the Gropius Bau museum, and a few other interesting places. A few more minutes walk and you are at the Jewish Museum. Right outside the hotel is a "small" (maybe 10 sections long, so actually quite a big bit compared to the rest) remnant of the wall, so if you want to get your photo taken at 'the wall' you get that ticked off your list easily. In the other direction you can walk to the Brandenburg Gate in just a few minutes and then either head off to view the Reichstag/Bundestag or Unter den Linden. Of course, if you don't feel like walking the Potsdamer Platz U & S Bahn stations are right outside the hotel and provide great links to the rest of Berlin. The swimming pool was a bit small, but I don't know when I was last at a city centre hotel that had a big pool. Also, the air conditioning didn't seem to work. I had it set at maximum cold and maximum blast for the duration and yet the room was never cold. I wasn't too bothered and didn't pursue at the time. I will definitely be back. The internet prices were a little scary (€5.95 for an hour) but Club level guests don't have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton Berlin was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SSB28
Reviews.Content: I just checked out today and I have to say I was sorry to leave. I was in Berlin for a week on business. The service and hospitality at the Ritz-Carlton was some of the best I have experienced. I travel on business frequently and have stayed at many 5-star hotels so I have somewhat high expectations but the Ritz exceeded them all. I had a room on the club level (10th floor) which I would definitely recommend. The club room was great, with food and drinks served all day until about 10:30pm, which was great after coming back from a day of meetings. Everything in the room appeared very new and very clean. The marble bathroom was lovely. The location is also excellent and close to many of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveler_011
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great staff, and very comfortable rooms. Travelled with a family of 5 and stayed at the Ritz. Perfectly located within walking distance to major sites such as the Brandengurg Gate and across the street from the Sony Center (restaurants, bars, movie theater, shopping, etc). Right in Postdamer Platz where both U and S train have stations.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style in a modern contest”
Reviews.Author: ROTCHKO
Reviews.Content: The ritz carlton berlin is really a weird hotel: pretend to be a classic 80's style hotel in the modern contest of Postdamer platz. The room are bleak, without a real personality...even dusty. The positive note is the brasserie that also serves breakfast: charming, cosy, friendly and the tea time, the rest forget....make a different choice

Reviews.Title: “Club level is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JaJeNorway
Reviews.Content: We have found our home away from home in Berlin! The Club level is quiet, charming and discrete, offering free internett, food and drinks included. The service is wonderful and they go out of your way to spoil you :-) Best bed and pillows EVER.... We are coming back next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel with some outrageous prices”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. It was comfortable. The breakfast was good, there was an excellent bathroom friendly room service and most importantly for a short visit, the location was within easy reach, of everything I wanted to see. I found the service polite and friendly and the concierge helpful. This hotel is in my opinion not user friendly for the leisure traveller. Many of the costs are prohibitively expensive for guests in this category. I inquired about checking emails and the cost to use the internet €10 an hour, indicates that they are not interested in providing this service to their guests. They had no problem directing me around the corner to dunkin doghnuts. The underlying thinking seemed to be that everything had to cost a fortune to prove the quality of the product. I had fully intended using the spa facility.The costs at the spa were quite ok for this class of hotel, but things like a mineral water at €11 and outrageous internet charges just put me of spending any money there. A pity. Having stayed before in other ritz carlton hotels something just didnt fit right about this particular property. I just felt the whole place was a bit of a rip off

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say...”
Reviews.Author: SDG13
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say that I really was disappointed with this hotel on a number of levels. First off, I didn't care for the location..being near the Sony Center did nothing for me...it's a tourist area but there aren't alot of cafes or stores nearby. The hotel itself is big and glamorous. We arrived around noon and were told they would call us when the room was ready. No one ever called. Our room was a nice size and the beds were fairly comfortable. Unfortunately, we were next to a service entrance on the 5th floor and there was alot of activity that we constantly heard. The wifi rates are crazy but it seems to be a common situation in Germany. 20 Euro a day or 5.95 euro for an hour. Spa rates were also very high...no service for under $150 as far as I could tell. You need your room card key to ride the elevator at all times. Doesn't sound terrible overall but I found it stuffy there in an unnecessary way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but tired property”
Reviews.Author: OLV_P
Reviews.Content: With an ideal location downtown Berlin, the Ritz Carlton is a fine luxury hotel in the German capital, but due to the wear and tear, I can't say it is the best. While the hotel provides a high level of customer service throughout all departments, the facilities are in need of immediate refurbishments, furniture and carpets, especially in the public areas and hallways looking very tired. Also, technology wise, the hotel needs an upgrade: the overpriced wifi internet can be slow at times and TV sets are of older generation. So is the entertainment system (cinema/tv). Make sure you book a deluxe room on a high floor with a view of Potsdamer Platz and do not miss the Aromatherapy Associates massage treatments at the SPA, which I was surprised to find in a Ritz Carlton property (AA is the brand of most Mandarin Oriental hotels). Concierge has all the tips you need for the best restaurants and cultural sightings.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5* Hotel - except no free internet”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Polo_73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good. The rooms are big and nicely equipped. The restaurant (Brasserie) is really good, however a bit overpriced. The breakfast was one of the very best I had in a 5* hotel. I did not find any fault until except one. Traveling a lot on business and also for leisure always staying in 5* or 4* hotels I noticed that many hotels offer free internet now. However at the Ritz-Carlton - which claims to be one of the top 3 hotels in Berlin - I need to pay for 20Euro for Wifi access. Or I could take the hassle and go to a McDonalds or Starbuck or no-name-youth hostel close-by and use Wifi for free. Obviously I know that charging premium for internet access used to be a common trick to increase revenues per guest, I think since most 4* dropped these charges, also the top end 5* hotels should do this. I think it is time when every single customer who is charged extra for internet access at a hotel should complain. Its 2011 not 1995.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Piet_M
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt when I am in Berlin but I got a great deal on a room at the Ritz-Carlton so I stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is what you would expect a Ritz-Carlton to be - excellent service, nice rooms and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nerdos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid Februrary 2011. As soon as we had arrived and tried to check in we were ushered upstairs to the club lounge and checked in up there by the incredibly charming, courteous and efficient Fabian. I've only stayed at one other RC before (Moscow) and the club lounge in Berlin isn't huge but what it lacks in sqaure footage it more than makes up for with attentive, unobtrusive service. We chose to take breakfast downstairs with all the other guests rather than in the club lounge as the selection in the main restaurant was significantly more extensive. We did make full use of the club lounge at all other times for tea, coffee, wine in the evening (try the German red - Ursprung. It really is very nice and I'm not generally a fan of German wine) and cakes and hot food for lunch. In the evenings we took drinks in the Curtain Club bar which was comfortable to the point of being almsot cosy but, if you have suckled at the inclusive bosom of the club level bar then the prices downstairs can make your eyes water a little. In the evenings there is a Beefeater wandering around in the lobby. At first this seems a little incongruous in Germany and I never did ask him why he was dressed thus but he is a charming chap and well worth speaking to. I can't fault the hotel but what really makes it great is the staff. Bravo RC-Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: DC971
Reviews.Content: Good Points - Great location for lots of attractions, plush hotel, excellent rooms, attentive staff and nice ambiance. Bad Points - Mad expensive to eat and drink (6.50 euros for a tiny bottle of coke) Unusual pillows and 2 single duvets for a double bed. The swimming pool a waste of time too small.

Reviews.Title: “Club room package is a MUST!”
Reviews.Author: Heidipops
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted warmly then whisked up to the club lounge to check in whilst sipping champagne. Couldn't have asked for a better service with genuine smiles. <Rant alert> Some of the other guests however who were also on the club level could do with a lesson in basic manners! It would certainly bring me down if I had to look at those snooty miserable faces day in day out. a smile & a polite thank you costs nothing as we all know. <Rant Over> Breakfast, light lunch, Light dinner & snacks served throughout the day. Drinks soft & alcoholic (including a delicious champagne) are all included. Try the German red wine, Yum! Fab Location, Fab staff, Nothing is too much trouble - Definitely worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Fab, Fab, Fab”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld26
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great staff. We went for bed and breakfast which is worth it as the breakfast room is great and the choice is vast you could eat something different everyday. This hotel has a good pool and spa too which is nice after a day of walking around Berlin. Location couldn't be better either, everything in terms of sight seeing is in walking distance and if it isn't then metro station is right outside. We loved this hotel, the room was big and the bathroom was great. We would def recommend this to anyone visiting Berlin and cannot wait to go back at some point!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: voglioris
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is amazing, fully furnished, you have everything you need to enjoy Berlin. Follow concierge suggestion, he will lead you into true Berlin. Absolutely the place to be in berlin. And location is perfect too!!! Room service is fast and good. Please ask for a room with view. Internet wi fi is available, a relax area is in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The most luxurious hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaL
Reviews.Content: Location: right next to the Potsdamer Platz U and S bahn station, so the Ritz-Carlton Berlin is conveniently located. Room: classic, beautiful, elegant, immaculate, and luxurious. The bed is one of the most soft and comfortable I've slept in. The bathroom has a separate bath and shower, which is spacious. The room has all the amenities that you would expect from a five star hotel. Service: very good in general, but can be patchy in some areas. For example, the gentleman who checked us in was extremely curteous, efficient, and amiable, whereas the lady who checked us out was a bit distant and cold. The same applies to the staff at concierge - one gentleman was genuinely warm and helpful, and the other one was a bit aloof albeit knowledgeable. What impressed us the most was a tall, black gentleman at the bell desk. As we departed in the very early morning with our car, he ensured that we got all our luggage onto the car, did not leave everything in the room, and gently placed two bags of croissant and bottled water in our car (knowing that we wouldn't have time to have breakfast yet). Such a thoughtful and caring gesture! He was smiley and affable, making us feel that we were really being looked after and the hotel was happy to have us there. The hotel also provides complimentary coffee, tea and juice in take-away cups at lobby for people on the go. Only Four Seasons can possibly beat Ritz-Carlton in the service department. Hotel's public areas: The hotel's lobby is elegant and luxurious. It has an open fire that creates a warm and cosy atmosphere. The hotel has a business centre, a gym, an indoor swimming pool, and a spa centre. Guests can use the sauna, plunge pool, whirl pool, and swimming for free. The recreation area, however, is quite small, although it is beautifully decorated. For example, the whirl pool can only fit 3-4 people max. at a time. Another problem is that the pool/sauna area is not regularly maintained. Thus, we couldn't find big towels in the locker room, and the used towels were thrown everywhere. We only saw one female staff seemingly being pre-occupied by spa treatment, and she couldn't be bothered to replenish amenities in the locker room. Considering the price we paid (195 Euro/night, possibly winter special rate), the Ritz-Carlton Berlin is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller092
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here and is certainly in our top 10 hotels. Nothing was a problem for staff. We had an issue with a leaking basin and they replaced all taps in bathroom. Food particularly good. Location impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “TOP Hotel at Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: msdstefan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Ritz-Carlton for three days at the end of January 2011. The Hotel is right in front of the train station Potsdamer Platz near the Sony Center. You can't be more central in Berlin. At check in nobody seamed to be responsible for our luggage, maybe because we were travelling with a backpack and didn't look like the usual guest. We had to wait 2 minutes until somebody felt responsible. We stayed in a standard room which was very nice, especially the bathroom. The marble floor is heated which was very nice after a shower. It was one of the nicest bathrooms we ever saw, comparable to the Peninsula in Bangkok, one of the best hotels in the world. On our last morning we were already thrown out of the TV system at 7AM. They didn't sort that out until 11AM when we left. Definitely not the service we expected!!! The spa area is nice, but very small. Don't expect to do some serious swimming in the pool, which has the size of a small garage. Quite amazing were the mini bar prizes: 6,50€ for 0,2l of Coke or 11€ for 0,75l of water!!!! By any standards this is a rip off. It doesn't make it better that other top end hotels ask for the same indecent amount of money!!! Very good was the breakfast buffet, luckily included in our room price. We would not want to pay 76€ for two for it. There are fresh fruit, cereal, curt, crepes and plenty of cold cuts. Not much hot food except eggs and sausages.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that you expect from a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: capital1977
Reviews.Content: In Short, if you can afford it, do it. I have been in enough hotels in Germany to know that when you pay extra, you get your money's worth. You get every penny's worth here. The service is exquisite, the food was so good that we had the biggest breakfast of our lives (it was awesome!). The rooms in Europe are typically so much smaller than U.S. rooms. Not at this hotel. The room was well sized and had floor to ceiling mahogany and marble. The shower has a waterfall shower head (comes from the ceiling and not the wall) and also had a separate hand shower with hose. There's a separate tub and doors separating the toilet from everything else. Great service, great location (close to hot spots) and great amenities. The lounge bar was also nice with comfortable couch seats and great service. I docked one star from the hotel for its bed. While they offer a king bed (which is HARD to find anywhere in Europe) the bed wasn't super comfortable. I miss the pillow top beds you get at the best hotels. However, having a King bed is a big treat here. Well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: fortheride
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nts mid december for christmas markets & shopping.Beautiful hotel finished to the highest quality.Club floor package great value good food and drink all day,but its lounge staff that really stand out as friendly,helpful & professional.Curtain club bar has live music and chilled vibe on fri & sat nts.Sunday Brunch not cheap but well worth money for atmosphere ,food choice & quality and great service with endless drinks , soft to champagne,advice for brunch booking 6 weeks in advance min for december.Club room spacious & very comfortable tv,dvd ,marble bathroom heated floor etc.Hotel location good, market in Potsdammer platz opp hotel & 15 min walk to Gendenmarket etc.Very rare to find a hotel in europe who`s staff match fine hotel`s in Asia.If you try the Ritz most will enjoy but club is so worth the xtra

Reviews.Title: “the best ritz ever with the club”
Reviews.Author: trondLarvikNorway
Reviews.Content: Just go for it !!!! Take one weekend in Berlin and stay in Ritz club level! Best service and welcom, love the food there ,never forget soup taste and delicious beef snaks and champagne in evening! The staff in club very helpful with allthey also gave us some free coupons for free champagne too use in the bar before we went to a good night club Felix that the staff recomend us to go !! We stayed here in the beginning of february for two nights but we go now again for three nights 4-7 february and we gonne make this every year like a favorite because we celebrate that we met each other around this days for 9 years ago just 6 days to wait oh oh oh we are so excited to come back !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! GO TO THIS HOTEL,WE HAVE STAYED IN MANY RITZ AROUND THE WORLD BUT THIS IS NUMBER 1 BELIEVE US FAMILY FURULUND THANKS

Reviews.Title: “will be back for sure !”
Reviews.Author: serial2urist
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton Berlin may be one of the best hotel I ever stayed in! I have only good things to say about the rooms ,service ,concierge ,restaurant ,the only con would be the decoration -too opulent for my taste - and my short stay ,only two nights !

Reviews.Title: “Club package the best value I have yet encountered”
Reviews.Author: bear9IsleofMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights on my own on a cultur fest. I asked for a room with large windows overlooking Tiergarten and this is exactly what I got. What I did not expect was the Club Package (on the 10th floor) to be the most exceptional value I have yet encountered with different food (effectively meals) and drink provided almost all day, served by very helpful and friendly staff at no cost. A very rare case of " too good to be true" not applying. No charge was then made for a week's worth of wifi. . I give five stars very sparingly but I can't see how this could have been better - certainly for my needs.- except perhaps for a even lighter weight duvet !

Reviews.Title: “Classy Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: TERRI SCHWARTZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for 4 nights during some of the coldest, windiest, snowiest weather last month. The Ritz was warm and inviting and I loved after a long day out and about being able to rest in front of the fireplace in the foyer. The room we had was lovely (king bed) with a fabulous bathroom with all the ammenities at your finger tips (even a heated floor which I happen to have in my own bathroom). The breakfast buffet (which was included in our room rate) was worth worth it. We had freshly made omelets daily as well as fresh cheeses, breads and freshly squeezed orange juice. The service in the dining room as in all places in the hotel was fabulous and always attached to a smile. I would also like to recommend you use the concierge service as they were most helpful (especially Marc). I do wish the internet rate was included in the room charge.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury that is worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: FussyTravellerAus
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, with chandeliers in each corridor. There is a nice restaurant on the ground floor where we went for dinner. Breakfast is also served there each day, but it wasn't included in our price and was very, very expensive for the buffet - 30 euro (at the time $60 Australian, which is too much to spend on breakfast no matter how lovely it is). Although we only stayed in a standard room, it was beautiful and very large. There was a king-size bed (very comfortable) with a pillow menu and turn-down service every evening. The location is excellent - walking distance to all the major monuments and tourist attractions, but Berlin is a huge city and it is best to get around via the train system. There is a stop just outside the hotel. The bathroom was amazing, large and very clean. There was a separate bath and shower, although the bath taps weren't very user-friendly. There was a walk-in-robe with a safety deposit box, although it was disappointing that it didn't house an iron as I believe all good hotels should include one in each room. I only gave service 4 stars because I called for an iron to be delivered to the room but it wasn't there after an hour and I had to call again. I eventually gave up and had to wear something else to dinner. If you can afford the rates I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel service I've had in europe”
Reviews.Author: fourseasonslover
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel in every way, perfect location, perfect service. book here you'll be happy, this is a very young ritz carlton, younger employees that make it feel more hip. not stuffy like other ritz carlton's at all.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent”
Reviews.Author: montemaranne
Reviews.Content: After being welcomed by the doorman, we were escorted to the club lounge for check in and a welcome drink. It was definitely well worth paying the extra for the club room. Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated, with comfortable beds and a well equipped bathroom. In the lounge itself we were served breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, cocktail snacks and evening snacks. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly and helpful staff. They willingly gave tips and advice and always had time for a chat with their guests. It really was like a small private hotel inside the hotel and the decorations in the style of an English library just emphasised this point. The hotel is well located for sightseeing and shopping. We also had wonderful weather and were able to explore Berlin on foot. Normally, I always have some complaints but try as I would, I couldn't find anything here to complain about! Please keep up your excellent service - we look forward to staying with you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best....”
Reviews.Author: LondonGreenfield
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business trip and stayed in Ritz Carlton for 5 nights. I have to say, best service ever. From the receptionist to the porter to the housekeepers. Every night, there's a turn down service and they tend to leave little presents for you for when you get back from work. I got fruits, chocolates, etc... The room is spacious, clean, comfortable, and an elegant place. I find myself wishing I didn't have to go back home :) The bathroom is separated between shower and bath. Once again, really nice. The only fault I have with the bathroom is that the housekeeper did not clean the bath every day. I'm not sure why though....otherwise, everything else is spotless. The restaurant in the hotel was okay but nothing special. Nonetheless, the service was excellent. There are many restaurants just right outside the hotel and you would better off going there for your food. There are a couple of good restaurants on the left once you exited the hotel. Otherwise, ask the receptionist. They have many fabulous recommendations and they are not wrong! We have tried them and they were excellent. The location itself is fantastic - opposite a metro station. Though we didn't use the metro that often. There is always a taxi right outside the hotel and there's only once that we found the rank empty. However, the hotel hailed a cab for us within minutes so we didn't have to wait in the cold. I have to say the service is great and would come back again for leisure. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely top-notch - but at a price”
Reviews.Author: J0hnC
Reviews.Content: A super hotel, very conveniently located. Although their basic room (called "superior"), it was roomy with high quality fittings & very comfortable bed. The staff & service were impeccable. Only criticisms - very expensive breakfast (38 euros) & they did not even have warmed plates available for the cooked breakfast. Also coffee mediocre (lukewarm out of a thermos) until we complained - then the very nice waitress made us each one fresh & hot! Finally, at a hotel of this standard & expense, we would have expected a free Wi Fi Broadband connection - but you had to pay every inch of the way!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SohanTanna
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was brilliant, from the moment the taxi pulled up. Doorman took my luggage, checkin staff were great and got upgraded to the club floor/room. The rooms were great, styled fairly old but had a lot of technolodgy in them. Touch control for the lights, DND, curtains and night lights. Worked really well. Had a tray of complimentary chocolates given to me, and a hand written note from the management shortly after. The club lounge was great, lacked a little on the food side but was great. The hotel allowed you to connect to roaming partners such as Boingo for HUGE savings on the internet ($5/mo vs 20eur/night) which was amazing. Bathroom was great, and most things like Razors/Dental kits were already placed in the room instead of having to call up for it - which was very useful. Cannot fault this hotel at all, and would return!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: IrishMaurice
Reviews.Content: I won't write a long description of our 3 nights in the hotel. I have nothing but good things to say about it. Pure class. yes it costs a little extra but everything was superb. One night they forgot to leave a chocolate on my pillow (my wife got one)!!! And that's the worst thing I can say about this wonderfully located, amaxingly staffed hotel with a great breakfast (definitely worth the extra we paid for a cold buffet). Champagne in the room on arrival (a little extra treat), bottled water every day, a great concierge (which in Berlin is very important) and no pressure to tip at every turn. Living at the Ritz....just experience it and know why they sing about it. By the way I'm a pernicity type of guest (see my Moroccon hotel experience) but the Rits was perfect. Will be back when Ireland has an economy again (probably 2025 then!)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pictrip
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was so very nice. All the staff we dealt with were helpful, smiling and great at making suggestions to make our stay one we will not soon forget. We chose the club level which included breakfast, light dinner and drinks in the club level lounge. Lounge was a great choice to begin the day and a great escape after a full day of touring. Check in and check out was taken care of in the lounge. The staff in the lounge made us feel welcome. The staff at the entrance of the hotel were also very welcoming.
