The rooms are wonderful and the bathroom was extremely nice. Bed was comfortable. No complaints about this hotel. Only surprise was they wouldn't make a poached egg, but any other choice was fine. I would definitely return. Total luxury. There is a nice indoor shopping area very close to the hotel and people there were also very pleasant. It is a somewhat of a distance to some sites, but the hop on, hop off bus stop is across the street. If you don't mind walking, some of the sites are walkable from the hotel. There are restaurants in the area, but we ate at the hotel each evening as our days were spent fully on touring, lots of walking. The hotel restaurant was very nice. It is a very nice area to spend time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast - room without a view, smallish spa”
Reviews.Author: Rosinenbomber
Reviews.Content: The room was good, although without a view. The best about the hotel is the breakfast, which is really great - choice, quality, freshness. Just a few more and different papers would be fine. An unlucky experience was a fire-alarm shortly before midnight. We left the room and went to the lobby, but seemed to be the only guests doing so. It turned out to be a false alarm. The information was a bit slow to evolve, though. At least we got a drink for free. The spa-area is way too small for such a hotel. More befitting a three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: holaestoycollin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at A LOT of luxury hotels and this one was up there with the best of them. From the moment you walk in the incredible staff helps you with your every need. It was our first time in Berlin and the concierge could not have made us feel more at home. A definite 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class!”
Reviews.Author: SuperScotsGal
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully attentive staff. Stayed on the Club Level where the service was impeccable. Room was fantastic, fabulous bed, bathroom excellent with all the toiletries, bathrobes etc you need. Fully stocked bar, great views. The lounge on the club level was a great price to pay - with all drink and food free - breakfast, snacks , dinner etc. The front of house staff were very helpful - bar downstairs lovely atmosphere, even had a charity gala on while we were there so saw some celebrities. Good location by Sony Centre - tube and train stop beside hotel - didnt try the restaurant in hotel so cannot comment on the food there. the spa looked amazing - didnt try and thought the facials etc were a bit pricey for what they were but then again this is a hotel that charges 16 euros for 2 drinks - you dont come here to scrimp on prices!!! this hotel is to be enjoyed and endulged! highly recommend this hotel for a city break

Reviews.Title: “Classic 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ErikFromSweden
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for one night (business trip) and was not surprised but not disappointed either. This is a truly 5 star hotel from all points of views: the service, the interior, the room, the bathroom. And the beds were really great with very comfy quilts and pillows! The only thing I found a bit odd was that Wifi wasn’t included in the room price, I had to pay an extra € 19.95 for that. The year is 2010 and I think free internet access definitely should be standard! This time I had a business breakfast appointment so I didn’t have the breakfast buffet, next time I will for sure. Because I am coming back but this time with my own wireless internet connection. In short: this is truly a classic 5 star hotel and I'm looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBenji
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights in early Oct. and loved it. Staff was very helpful, room was great,especially the bed with real down duvets and pillows. I was glad the window opened, because as in many hotels, there seemed to be a scent from an air freshener . Location was perfect for sightseeing. We were no told our rate included breakfast, so ask when you check in. Very lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - well located for walking”
Reviews.Author: june1946
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, lovely room, and a bit cheaper than some Ritz, apparently because they are in competition with other 5 stars in Berlin. But i have 2 complaints, after travelling in many German cities: i don't expect the Ritz to offer the wonderful German breakfasts that are included almost everywhere, but they could at least have a coffee pot in the room. And #2: they should have free internet. And one more thing: we looked to the concierge for maps and info on tour buses, museum passes, and they were out of all brochures - that shouldnt happen. And when i asked for a list of museums included in the museum pass, they promised to put it under my door, and did not. Rather poor service. It is very well located for walking to museum island, the Brandenberg Gate and the parliament building (don't miss the free tour of the glass dome on top - incredible).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great service, completely up to Ritz-Carlton standards”
Reviews.Author: damaAMSTERDAM
Reviews.Content: Nothing more to add, just a great hotel with excellent service. Would defenitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service at Club Level, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveluxuryholidays_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RC Berlin over the August bank holiday weekend. The service in the Club Lounge was excellent, it was beautifully quiet (not a child in sight) and literally as soon as anyone arrived in the club lounge the staff would come over to assist. The Club Lounge serves continental breakfast, cooked lunch, afternoon cakes and cooked dinner (often the same as lunch that day). There was a group of 6 of us (3 couples) staying at the hotel and I asked the Club Level to book us in for a dinner reservation at another hotel which they did straight away, also when I was feeling ill on the last day the Club Lounge let us have late check out from our room which was really helpful. The rooms and the communal parts of the hotel are spotless. There is a lovely hotel pool and jacuzzi, the pool is not large but this is a city hotel. Breakfast in the hotel's main restaurant is a huge buffet with an egg chef and waffle chef, defiantly worth a visit. Overall I cannot fault our stay and would highly recommend the Ritz Carlton Berlin for a city break. We came back feeling relaxed and pampered!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing and Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLouise
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in great central location to east and west side of Berlin. Also very well situated on the Metro. The hotel is beautiful, well maintained and the service was excellent. Yes it is a 5 star hotel so one would expect a wonderful experience but it was the most lovely experience we have had in a hotel. The food was outstanding in both the restaurant and Club level facility. The room was beautifully appointed. The room rate was surprisingly reasonable in Berlin compared to other major European cities or hotels of this caliber. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure”
Reviews.Author: BravoBunny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times this year. The first stay - perfect. From there it was all downhill culminating in a room service fiasco during the World Cup. Can you imagine a hotel like this does not serve hot food after midnight or so? Not even a burger! So if you come home late - dont expect this place to feed you if you are hungry. Whats more they wont even order out for you. So after 3 complaints the room service guy virtually yelled over the phone "FINE, I will cook you a burger myself if you cant wait until 5am when the kitchen opens". When it arrived he should have just thrown it at me. Clearly it was a huge inconvenience, and needless to say I did not eat it cos god knows what he did to it in the kitchen as some form of revenge for waking him up from his midnight to dawn shift sleep. Anyway, the whole thing left a bad taste in mouth and I will stay at the Rocco Forte or the Sofitel this week when I return. Ritz room service - get an attitude adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ryhy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Berlin in July 2009 and was astonished with the hotel. We stayed on the gold floor and the extra cost was definetly worth it. When we arrived the whole lounge staff greetedus at the front of lounge with as well as gave ushot towels. The service was incredible and the staff was very helpfull. In the lounge they served breakfast and dinner. I don't think we even went out for one dinner as the food there was aenough for dinner. In Europe sometimes they don't let four people in a room however here they did. We had on cot and the sheets as well as the matress was as comforatble as the regular beds. The sleep quality was amazing as the beds were one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We had a great stay and I would deffinetly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - fab hotel & fab location”
Reviews.Author: travelchick066
Reviews.Content: As soon as you step into this palace of a hotel, you will feel like royalty. Our room was beautifully decorated and spacious. All the staff were informative, professional and extremely friendly. English TV channels are few but the hotel have a wide range of DVD's which are available from the concierge and are free to watch. Location could not be better - the Ritz is across the road from the Potsdamer Platz underground and the Sony Centre. It is a 5 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag and next door to the great park. The Reichstag is free to enter and the architecture of this glass dome is amazing. The Zoo is well worth a visit and allow a minimum of half a day here as it is the largest zoo in Europe and has the widest variety of close up animals we had ever seen - very impressive. Go up the panoramapunkt tower for a birds eye view of Berlin - breathtaking -just a 30 second walk from the hotel - 30 floors in the lift takes 13 seconds. The hotel's jacuzzi, pool and sauna were very soothing and relaxing. This is the place to mingle with the Stars who visit frequently. The Ritz Carlton lives up to its reputation of grandeur and perfection - I recommend this hotel to all - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nic81081
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in February for my Boyfriends birthday at the Ritz and it was outstanding. We had a great time. Drinks in the hotel are expensive as are the restaurants but it's nice to treat yourself once in a while. We actually got engaged while we were there so we were celebrating and weren't taking too much notice of the prices. The Sony centre is worth a visit as it has numerous restaurants and bars as well as a cinema. We went to the holocaust memorial and on the bus tour around Berlin. We also went to see Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag (big ques even in the morning in the snow). The bed in the hotel was massive and so comfy. We had room service for breakfast a couple of times since it was the other halves birthday and it was amazing but be warned the portions are massive. All in all its one of the best hotels we have stayed at and would definately recommend it for special occassions.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCES I HAVE EVER HAD”
Reviews.Author: Meanderer72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days at the Ritz Carlton. I has some qualms since i read in "Time Out Berlin" tjhat staying in this hotel was reminicient to being in Las Vegas and recommended the Intercontinenetal over this. They don't know whay thet are talking about.. We checked out the Intercontinental and there was no comparison. As an architect I feel know something about style and this is definitely was not like being in Las Vegas.. Let's call it " nouveau elegant " with top notch service. to matchthe room was extremely comfortable and well appointed. The pillows coul;d have been a bit more comfortable. The buffet breakfast was the best I haveever experienced in any hotel. It had everything you could imagine and it was all fresh and natural from the baked goods to the fruits, and crepes. Even the bacon and sauges were the best i've had in years. The concierges were extremely helpful in arranging dinner reservations, confirming flights, and giving good tourist advice in general. THE CONCIERGES WERE EXTREMELY HELPFUL IN ARRANGING DINNER One night I forgot my credit card at a restaurant. The restaurant called the hotel to let them know. The concierge arranged to have a taxi pick upthe card and deliver it to the hotel. It was in my hands almost before i realized it was missing I also read thaty the location was like being in times square. Not true. It was near a good transpotation hub, but we never sensed a "hustle and bustle" . There was a protest march outside the hotel one day because of a guest staying there, but that was unusual

Reviews.Title: “Can I give more than five stars?”
Reviews.Author: discerning_trvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton this weekend for the second time, the first stay being two years back. Even though there are a lot of hotels in Berlin, the Ritz Carlton is by far the most magnificent and overwhelming grand hotel there is. This time, we were in for a real treat. Since the hotel was fully booked, we were upgraded from a regular double room to a Grand Suite (the Lenée Suite on the 9th floor). Above that, there is only the Presidential Suite. We were on a prepaid, discounted rate - I have never experienced such generosity from a hotel! Thanks again! The suite was big. Really big. 105 square meters, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, living and dining room, library and working room, bedroom, walk in closet. 4 TVs, 3 sofas, 8 chairs and so on. Huge bathtub, walk-in shower - and everything decorated very lovingly. Since it is on the corner of the building, great view across the Potsdamer Platz. But don't worry, we have also stayed in the regular rooms and they are just as great - only a tad smaller. The beds are really amazing, the best sleep we have ever gotten in a hotel (and we have been to a lot of them, including LHW, R&C etc.). Service perfect, very friendly and authentic. The breakfast is definitely worth it (book a rate that includes breakfast instead of paying 38 Euros for it!). It is served in the Brasserie which has a real French feel to it. The variety is amazing, ranging from wide fruit choices, a good assortment of French cheeses, live cooking to a little bakery. Ah, the bakery - this is a special treat. They have all kinds of breads you can think of as well as French croissanteries like chocolate croissants, cinnamon rolls and so on. Furthermore, they make fresh crepes (!!!), waffles and pancakes, have a wide choice of toppings (little caramel bits, chocolate sprinkles, gummy bears and, and, and...) and fabulous marmelades. I would definitely consider getting up at 6 in the morning and spending my time there until they close breakfast. This breakfast is just too good to be true. In short - spoil yourself for a great price (when you compare their prices to what you would pay in other capitals of the world in such a league). Stay here - you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay for New Year's Eve.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelAddicts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Ritz Carlton's. It's kind of our guilty indulgence. We booked a club room for two nights, including New Year's Eve. Club room was nice and the staff was very attentive but the food and beverage selection was not really that good. It was nice being able to check in up in the club room rather than deal with the crowds (because of New Year's) in the lobby. The room was a typical Ritz Carlton room which is always very comfortable and clean. For the fireworks in Berlin, this hotel is about a five city block walk from the festivities and the Bradenburg Gate. There is NO VIEW of them from this hotel. Period. Also, most of the rooms have no view of anything but the buildings on either side. There is a metro stop right across the street. The pool is VERY small and we gave up trying to swim after about five minutes because it was so crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritneyNorthGermany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb! From the moment one arrives you feel valued and important. Nothing seems to be too much trouble for the excellent staff. The rooms are wonderful, the bed is a dream and the breakfast, although expensive at €38 each, is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotel's we have ever stayed at. Everything is super clean and brand new. Gorgeous wood tones and quality furnishings everywhere. Very nice location in Potzdammer Platz, near Sony Center is convenient to shopping, dining and S-bAhn/U-bahn transport. Bathroom is very luxuriopus. Bed is very comfortable, but we had to ask for for an exttra sheet since the beds only come with a nice but too-warm duvet cover which is very warm. Staff was hit and miss: on occasion there was no greeting or acknowledgement of our presence as we entered or left the hoyel. At other times we got a warm greeting. Restauranr serves a fabulous breakfast buffet which was include din our toom rate. Bar is very nice, elegant and cool. This was a very good bargain: less than 600 Euro for a roomy suite through AmEx Fine Hotels and Resorts. We'd happily stay again. One beef" the high speed internet charges are exhorbitant, about 28 uro per day. The hotel is so beautiful that we'll give it another try in the hopes that the staff can measure up to other RC properties...

Reviews.Title: “Best... Bed.. Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TheWexican
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to see the Christmas markets in Berlin after getting a great deal on-line. This hotel was a true 5 star experience. We arrived early and the hotel were good enough to allow us to check in early & we really appreciated this as we had a 5am flight. Ill never forget walking into our room and seeing the huge bed and falling into the and waking up about 4 hours later. It was the most comfortable bed Ive ever slept in and was hard to leave every morning! The room was nice, tasteful and spacious, absolutely no complaints. The staff were also excellent, especially the concierge who was very helpful and recommended a fabulous Italian restaurant to us. It was one of the best I've ever eaten in. The location is good. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and also has an underground stop right beside the hotel. There are a number of shops and restaurants nearby in a rather large & modern plaza. I also found the doorman to be extremely helpful, I wish I could remember his name. We did not eat at the hotel so unfortunately I cannot comment on that but I can say that it was a 5 star experience from start to finish and would go back just to sleep in that bed again! One word of warning though.. Be very careful if you are using the train system to get to the airport. We followed the map only to find that the train did not travel to the stop which was stated on the map & as a result we missed our flight home. I have since talked to a friend who suffered the exact same problem. Check with the hotel for the best route to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin more than maintains standards of Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ritz Carlton Berlin for a long weekend with friends. As a treat we all stayed on the Club floor with its complimentary food and drinks. The hotel was very impressive, well located, good sized rooms, well appointed with all amenities as you'd expect. The Club Lounge was nice, food selection was not as extensive as Rizt Carltons in the States, but still very nice. It was the staff who made all the difference for our weekend, nothing was ever too much trouble and all requests met with a smile - very refreshing for European hotels! The rooms were not the cheapest, but I felt we got reasonably good value considering we had complimentary champagne on tap! Would recommend this hotel if it's your first trip to Berlin as it's nicely located between East and West parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Maraki14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is obviously not intended for couples traveling with back-packs on a tight budget, however, money is well worth it. We were accommodated on the 10th floor of this amazing hotel, with window views at Potzdamer Platz, one of the major squares in Berlin. U-Bahn, main train station + bus stops all situated right at your door step. At 230euros/night (booked it via bookings.com) we got an all-inclusive offer for the Club Lounge, which apart from great meals all day long, gave us access to a complete private sector of the hotel. First day there, dined next to Renée Zellweger, so you knew you were getting just the at-most best. Large rooms with loads of amenities, which included Bvlgari toiletries, heated floors, extra-soft bedding sheets + pillows, complete sound-proof rooms, daily weather forecast of the following day on your bedside table, balance amount at all times also available by pressing a TV-button and really nice personell, ready to take care of your every need. Would recommend it to anyone. We're visiting again next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, First Class, Fit for Royalty! Most Elegant Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: BASEBALLNUTS
Reviews.Content: From the minute I walked in the grand entrance of the Ritz-Carlton Berlin, I knew I was some place special and a place I would never forget. The lobby is truly beautiful, the staff very helpful and courteous. Every amenity imaginable is available to guests; don't want to watch German television? No problem! The concierge has a large selection of dvd movies available to watch, FREE! High speed internet available at a nominal fee. Restaurants with grand fare and nearby food markets if you would prefer to gather a few little snacks to have in your room. There is an excellent memorial to World War II and the sad conditions and struggles that German Jews suffered through. It is an emotionally moving exhibit, so prepare yourself to be enlightened, educated and probably shed a tear. There is also easy access to trains and public transportation, and easy walking distance to great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: BlinkyBillQueensland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon. This hotel was supposed to be our 'splurge' at $600AUS per night. When we arrived we were given a room with two single beds but were told by reception that they were 'really big' and could fit two people in. We went up to the room and the single beds were just that- single beds. We went back down to reception and spoke to a different lady and after a 20 minute wait we were given a room with a double bed but told 'not to tell anyone'. The lobby appeared full of disgruntled guests. The room was lovely as was the bathroom. However the service was not up to scratch. Our bathroom did not have any sanitary bags so we called reception. We were told some would be brought up. They never came. We called again the next morning after our room was serviced and there were still no bags. It took a third phone call before something was done. When compared with other luxury hotels such as 'The Langham' this hotel leaves a lot to be desired. Definately not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, Good bye Ritz-Carlton !”
Reviews.Author: Syama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after Christmas time. I was disappointed to stay here. The room was very good at first sight. But a trash that the previous guest left was on the carpet! (It was a plastic collar cover of men's shirts.) It made me unpleasantness. And I met a problem in the bathroom. The bathroom was also beautiful at first sight. I poured the hot water into the bathtub. I waited 5 or 6 minutes at the room. When I came back to the bathroom, the floor turned "miserable pond". Although the bathtub was not full, the water was leaking from the root of the shower nozzle. (Maybe defect!) I thought "Is it Ritz-Carlton ?" I went to the maindinig retaurant "Brasserie Dssbrosses" twice.(two evenings) It looked American style grill restaurant. I ordered "cake of the day" as a dessert, but I could not have a cake eventually. The first day, he said "nothing today". The second day he said "today's cake is chocolate cake, is it OK ". I said "OK". But he brought a cheese cake to me. (I dislike cheese cake for my cheese allergy!) Of course I refused it. What a poor experience it is! I missed the cakes of "Kempinski Vier Jareszeiten Munich hotel". And the light of the restaurant was very dark. But the staff said "Do you want some newspapers or magazines ?" It sounds bad joke. Because the candle light on the table was very small for reading. I usually have light meals as a lunch at the lobby of a hotel at noon. I had a lunch at noon at the lobby bar of this hotel. The lobby bar was very dark ! and the atmosphere made me cold and dark. (Afternoon tea lounge was very bright place ! But I could not have anything there. It runs from 14:00-18:00. I had no chance then.) I met a "strange incident " at the hotel boutique. I bought 3 post cards.( 3 euro.) But the cashier did not use register and I wait.... I think I am a unlucky guest. But I nerver stay at this hotel again. Next time I will stay at "Grand Hyatt Hotel Berlin". Good bye Ritz-Carlton !

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: kbh33
Reviews.Content: We stay here 1 night only. We were wery pleased with it all. Perfect service, best breakfast I ever had. Very clean rooms. Spacius room, and nice decour, normally I best like more modern style, but when the more "old" conservative decour is so well executed its very nice. Love the chandeliars in every room, elevator, even the bathroom. The three in the room polish so it shined. Can only recommend it. Yes the wellness a bit small, but very nice anyways

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wins on all fronts!”
Reviews.Author: Doggy88
Reviews.Content: Well positioned. Amazing views of B/Gate. Plush and great front desk staff. We were here on our wedding celebration and the hotel went beyond by upgrading us to an amazing Brandenburg Gate suite. No other place to stay in town. If you going to Berlin stay here but dont cry when you have to leave. Its not a good look ;)

Reviews.Title: “"Welcome Home"”
Reviews.Author: Trojan88
Reviews.Content: The Bellman asked us if we had stayed at this Ritz Carlton before - which we did and he just said "welcome home" -- and that's what it feels like. This place is amazing - this time we stayed at the Club level - and that is actually something to consider - they are offereing a small lunch / tea / and dinner buffet included + a great lounge area. We hope to return soon ...

Reviews.Title: “Talks the talk but doesn't always walk the walk”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying that I was a bit disappointed with our stay at the RC Berlin. We stay at many luxury hotels and I am very familiar with the Ritz brand. I, for one, have seen a general reduction in Ritz values and service over the last couple of years and the RC Berlin was a good example of this. It wasn't that the hotel was at all bad, it simply was lack-lustre. We found this Ritz a frustrating blend of high quality and helpful service mixed with lower standards and inadequate staffing levels. There were also evident signs of the impact of the current financial situation in the hotel. Here are some examples: We arrived late in a cab. The hotel knew we would be arriving at around 10.30pm but there were no porters/ doormen waiting outside, leaving us to carry our luggage up the steps into the lobby. Once inside, there was a gaggle of porters falling over themselves to carry our bags the 6 feet from the revolving door to the reception desk! Having checked in - and been greeted by a very charming member of staff from the Club Floor - we went to our rooms and waited almost 30 minutes for our bags to materialise! Despite the fact that nobody else was checking in at the same time. On another day, I gave up waiting for service at the Curtain Bar after more than 15 minutes during which my presence was not acknowledged by two staff members behind the bar. I cannot think of any 5 star hotel anywhere else I have been, where bar staff wouldn't notice new customers coming in and sitting down after moments, let alone 15 minutes! The staff looked like they couldn't cope (even though the bar wasn't busy) and had no real idea of what they were doing. The Club Lounge was pretty much closed on a Saturday night at around 9.30pm and its lunch offering on the Sunday was absolutely woeful. On the other hand, the receptionist who originally checked us in was excellent as was the manager at the Club Lounge; the rooms themselves were beautifully appointed with a very high standard of finish and extremely well maintained. I didn't find the service warm or personal and there was no acknowledgment of my husband's birthday even though we are RC regulars and the hotel were advised by our TA in advance. I wasn't expecting a bottle of champagne, but a note or a slice of cake? Would that have been so hard? For what I paid it still wasn't bad value but frankly I would rather pay more and get more consistent, higher level service. It was a shame as we had looked forward to trying this Ritz and it wasn't as good as I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Berlin”
Reviews.Author: alunsford
Reviews.Content: The hotel was phenomenal. The service began when we arrived across the street and continued to the sandwiches they packed us for the train to Copenhagen. The facilities were immaculate. We had a gorgeous view of Potsdamer Platz from the living room and the staff went so far out of its way that they uncovered places my husband remembered from the early 90's with nothing more than a vague description from him. This was perhaps the best experience I have had in a hotel yet. The only disappointment was leaving.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 5 star staff”
Reviews.Author: noblige
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in a Junior Suite. Upon checking in we found welcome fruit plate and two bottles of water (which were refilled daily). We were also pleased to find small child bathrobe and slippers for our 6-month old child. Room was spacious and bright. During our stay there was some kind of grand wedding that prevented either my wife or kid from sleeping one night (being so loud and lasting until 3 or 4am). Adding more to that next evening we discovered that wedding is far from being over and was planned to be continued into 2nd night as well (at least 2am as we being told)! Seeing that as unacceptable (with wife and child being unable to sleep night before), we have contacted hotel staff to check if we can be relocated to a room father from ballroom (our current room being on 6th floor above). It turned out that all Junior Suites were located in the same wing as the ballroom. Being desperate we were considering a downgrade just be moved to other wing: but to our relief were offered free upgrade to Bellevue Suite located on upper floor in other wing, father from ballroom. A very well handled situation by hotel staff. Even more pleasing was to receive a letter week later from hotel manager with apologies regarding the noise during a wedding. Along with the letter was a stuffed toy bear in a Ritz uniform - how cute! Ordered in room dining twice: food was very up to par and quite moderately priced. Sumptuous breakfast, great selection of cheeses and fruits (including fresh berries). One of the best Eggs Benedict and omelets we have had in a hotel. To conclude: 5 star hotel with 5 star staff.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Welcome!”
Reviews.Author: sligo16
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in the Ritz Carlton Berlin for 5 nights from end of Sept. to beginning of Oct. While the hotel itself was fabulous, I have one huge complaint about it. On checking in, we were then ushered in to a little alcove and told to open our luggage. Then, we were asked to lift up some of the clothes in the suitcase and after this the 'Security man', complete with rubber glove , asked could he search it and this he did. At the time, I was amazed but being in a new hotel and different surroundings I went along with all this. But, once in our room, I thought ' Surely this is not right. Surely, this is not normal practice.' We had already stayed in 2 other 5 star hotels in Amsterdam and Baden Baden just before this and we certainly didn't encounter this. We did not get any explanation for it. I wonder is this acceptable at all - surely it is an invasion of guest's privacy. I am only sorry now that I did not refuse to do it . I wonder what would have happened! Also, I wonder did this happen to any other guest? While it did annoy us greatly, we still thoroughly enjoyed Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern. Room was ok; standard American sized rooms. Bulgari amenities, separate shower/tub/commode. Gym, pool and spa in the basement. Gym with two treadmills, two ellipticals and 2 bicycles. Dumbells to 22 kg. A couple of weight machines. Small pool, can't do laps. Good hot tub, though. All the staff were quite friendly with smiles. Certainly different than the usual stern Teutonic faces when out of the hotel. They knew me by name after the first hour. The Club staff were quite incredible and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. I wanted to practice my German and they indulged me with speaking to me solely in German. A couple of laptops with a printer are available. The food in the club was ok for the evening. A hot dish is provided. Drinks were nicely poured. The breakfast was excellent with passionfruit, dragon fruit, made to order eggs, muesli, yogurt, meats and cheeses and, of course, excellent German bread. Apparently we could have gone to the buffet, but the breakfast here was intimate and more than adequate. The Potsdamer Platz station is literally right at the doorstep. Regional trains, the S-Bahn and U-bahn go through this station. The Branderburg Gate and Reichstag are an easy 5 minute walk away. All and all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DAKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: All round a fantastic hotel, staff, location and rooms are all top notch. The restaurant was excellent and the breakfast buffet spectacular. Small touches were also very impressive (complemetary champagne and rose petals on the bed for our belated anniversary) and the conciege made excellent restaurant suggestions. The gym is well equipped and the pool, though small, inviting. My only gripe is that WiFi is not included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: amy70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed at and worth the money for sure. The rooms are massive with a really great bed (felt like we were sleeping on a cloud) and a gorgeous bathroom, complete with a tub big enough for two. It's ideally situated, just a 5 minute walk from some of the major sites and has a few good restaurants nearby (Midtown Grill at the Marriot is worth a visit) We tried to book dinner in the hotel to celebrate our anniversary, but it was closed. That was the only negative about the place. Would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect score from a tough grader.”
Reviews.Author: JD #25
Reviews.Content: Having had the pleasure of staying at many fine hotels around the world, I place this hotel at the very top. The staff is superb and excellent in every respect -- very sophisticated and highly attuned. The hotel is beautiful and immaculate. My family and I couldn’t have been more pleased. And, the on-site restaurant offers some of the very best food among many fine restaurants in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Birthday Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBunny87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to the Ritz Carlton Berlin as a present for my 21st Birthday. And all i can say is that is was one of the most amazing experiences of my life! at arrival they had placed alittle birthday (cocolate) cake in our room! so sweet! (and tasted delicious). The rooms are so beautiful, and the bed is amazing.. I wish I could've taken it home! The pool is also a great amenity. The hotel is beautiful and the location is fabulous!! Would return in a heartbeat :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: milsher
Reviews.Content: Nothing else to say about this place but: great! Obviouslly, it's somehow pricy, but worth every dime. Beautiful large rooms, quiet, clean, very comfy. We also very much liked the spa area. Recommend with all my heart.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ritz-Carlton Berlin for one night in club-level room. The check-in was pleasant in the club lounge - and the club lounge was really a perfect place as other reviewers have pointed out. Definitely worth the extra money. Room was nice (separate bath and shower, Bvlgari amenities etc.) and spacious, bed really comfortable and nice little donuts with Ritz-Carlton logos as a welcome gift. I ate dinner in the Brasserie Desbrosses which also was a nice place - although there were only few other diners. Concierges were really helpful. All in all, I would highly recommend the hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grams98
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at ritz carlton berlin: perfect location, we could walk to so many places of interest; but we did take the on-off bus for 2 days and really felt that was well worth it; we had breakfast included in rate, which we got a great deal on by reserving and pre-paying through their website. the breakfast was truly wonderful, more than enough for the day until dinner. also, since we had an overnight train on checkout day we were able to still use the spa later in the day for the pool, jacuzzi, lounges, showers, etc, which really made a great difference-- grams 98

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: London_JetSetter1
Reviews.Content: Nothing but the best & the breakfast is the most impressive I have ever seen. Great Rooms Luxury everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “central pleasant hotel, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: gorah123
Reviews.Content: as expected with ritz-carlton this hotel is smart, well appointed and upmarket. Breakfasts are excellent but pricey. Location is very good. Downside would be this is a conference venue

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great personnel”
Reviews.Author: docGamba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz for four nights. We arrive late at night and were dog tired. The staff at the front desk went out of their way to welcome us and accomodate us as quickly as possible. The concierge staff is excellent, even the front door personnel are helpful. The room itself was what you would expect - first class. We have stayed in other European cities at The Four Seasons and consider the The Ritz Carlton Berlin to be of the same quality if not higher.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Ritz is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BBCAL
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Berlin Ritz for 5 nights (two rooms) in early June with my family of 4. Everything was just perfect! I have logged 2+ Million miles traveling the globe and this was a top hotel stay experience for sure. Contacted the hotel prior to arrival and were quickly connected with the very capable Concierge Torsten. In addition to arranging arrival transportation, etc., Torsten’s recommendation of reservations at Restaurant Kafer on the roof of the Reichstag was fabulous. . . avoided the long lines and enjoyed a great meal with a fabulous view. The rooms were very spacious (especially for Europe), furnishings comfortable, the rain shower divine, and the public areas tranquil and elegant. Especially at check in and throughout the stay, the staff was attentive, efficient and welcoming. My family and I were remembered and addressed by name as we were welcomed back into the lobby each time as if coming home. The location is ideal, walk to the Brandenburg Gate in 5 min, subway around the corner to anywhere, big mall just across the street. Last but not least, breakfast was simply the best. Concert at the Charlottenburg Palace is also an absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “small faults”
Reviews.Author: molar67
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers have already told you, the Ritz-Carlton Berlin has a perfect location. We've found the standard rooms 820/822 to be spacious enough, clean and well fitted. The safe is large enough for a laptop. You get both a bathtub and a shower. Inter-room sound insulation is mediocre. The staff was very corteous and made us feel welcome. However, there were a few minor issues: The pool/whirlpool are tiny. The room rates were very reasonable, but the food and beverages are pricey - € 6,50 for 20cl coke. You'll get a cotton handtowel (the one you usually get in Italy, I call them "non-absorbing" - we use such towels to dry dishes) and a large terry cloth bathtowel. Obviously no one thought of using a towel to dry one's hair, so there is none

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: UptownGal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend away with my boyfriend. We are regular visitors to 5* hotels but were still blown away by the Ritz-Carlton. The beautiful lobby makes an excellent first impression and from the moment you arrive you are provided with teh most impeccable service. We had requested a king sized bed in a non-smoking room and were immediately shown to a beautiful room. However it became apparent from when we entered the room that a guest had smoked there (it was barely noticeable but not ideal) before we had the chance to say anything the concierge was on the phone requesting we be moved. Within minutes new key cards were brought up and we were taken a to another room down the hall which smelt fresh and clean. The room was impeccable and the mini bar and bathroom were very well appointed. The hotel offers a pillow menu from which you can select your prefered pillow(s) if you are not happy with the quantity or selection offered in the room. If you decide to stay heer I can not recommend the bath butler service highly enough. You need to give the desk about an hours notice but then a maid will come up and run the most luxurious bath for you leaving you with a selection of fruit and champagne to indulge in whilst you soak. Truly the most amazing bath I've ever had! We came down late and missed breakfast so we were invited to order in the curtain lounge instead, the food was excellent and once again the service we received was flawless. In summary what some of the negative reviewers say is right , yes you get exactly what you would expect from a 5*, this does mean that some of those quirks (and disappointments) you get in other hotels which make for funny or eventful experience are (thankfully) missing, but if what you are looking for is a beautifully appointed hotel with impeccable service then this is pretty much as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: zarknyc
Reviews.Content: i value the ratings on tripadvisor and i've been to berlin a few times in the past few years, but i don't really understand why the ritz carlton berlin got such raves. the location is as good as other luxury hotels, but it wasn't effortless service like the adlon or the regent. at the price i was paying, the staff shouldn't be trying to pinch every extra penny from me, like wanting to charge extra for an english newpaper? or charging me to access my email in their business center? no luxury hotel does that to my knowledge. my room was beautiful, the amenities were nice, the breakfast was incredible! but the hotel was half empty (probably from the economy) but wouldn't i be more likely to spend more at the hotel if i got a room upgrade or even an english newspaper?

Reviews.Title: “A real Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Bearcito
Reviews.Content: Everything was just ideal starting from our arrival - very friendly and helpful staff, clean room (not too big, but quite OK), excellent service, and lavish buffet breakfast. When you book your room make sure that breakfast is included in the rate, you will save your money this way. SPA was great too. Would love to be back there one day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: We arrived for the last throw at celebrating my 50th birthday. I had been to Berlin a number of times before but this was as I expected the best hotel I had stayed in in the city. The location was especially poignant as more than 20 years earlier on my first visit I had viewed Potsdamer Platz as part of the no man's land between East and West. It was now a superb location for this vibrant city. Prior to my arrival I received an email from the hotel with some general arrival enquiries and as a result of responding we were given an extended check out on the Sunday. We were warmly welcomed and relaxed in our room. The staff were genuinely friendly as opposed to just doing a good job. Our room looked out at the front of the hotel and was as anticipated comfortable and luxurious, we were on a good value weekend break. Breakfast was slightly over busy but the quality was ok. Only complaint was the weather but even the people of the Ritz Carlton cant regulate that.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: mur54
Reviews.Content: The service from all the staff is superb, everyone were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are of the highest quality and comfort. The breakfast was excellent but expensive if not included in the price of your stay (make sure it is before you go). The Hotel is centrally located near to Brandenburg Gate and fantastic Underground and Train network. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Wonderful Hotel - STANDARD services !”
Reviews.Author: luxadvisor
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Berlin is the 2nd Ritz Carlton’s hotel in Germany (after Ritz-Carlton Wolfsburg), which opened its door in January 2004, shortly after 1 ½ year of construction. Ritz Carlton Berlin stands as one of the main competitor for Berlin’s Luxury hotels market - along with other “Old Grand” like The Adlon Kempinski, The Regent Berlin (managed by Four Seasons group), Schlosshotel im Grunewald - or even the new comers such Hotel de Rome (Rocco forte group) and the Mandala Hotel (part of or design hotel). One thing that most agree about this property is – THE LOCATION – which is conveniently located at the prestigious Postdamer Platz – simply just a step away from the business and government district, shopping, cultural venues and other popular attractions. As we arrived in from of the hotel entrance street – I noticed the lack of immediately assistance at the front entrance – probably because it was Friday (week-end) and there are many arrivals – with a short wait - we was able to gave the car key for to the valet person (who seems in hurried) – and a doorman assisted our luggage immediately as we approached the check-in desk. The check-in went smooth – the agent is professional – scored only 80 points, as the agent missed to inform us regarding our room package benefits and our requested arrangement. On the other hand – the agent was successful fulfill our request regarding the 2nd room booked for our guests. The curb side check-in was provided as the agent guided us to the elevator (unfortunately did not mention regarding facilities hours – ex. Breakfast time, spa etc.). Our room is located on the High floor – overlook to Beisheim Center. In the room I found a welcome card well placed next to a chocolate amenity . The room lavish with wonderful dark red wood panel mixed with the golden sand colors – along with yellow, green and gray tone fabric – giving a bit a bit Prussian style feeling of USA glory 20’s art décor. The Bathroom has a good size – with separate standing shower and a bathtub (all in sand brown/pink marble). A small walk-in closet was well design - making it looks lovely even for its small narrow size. The highlight of the hotel facilities is the “La Prairie” spa – adjacent to the gym and small sparkling heated swimming pool. The spa is small but lovely – I managed to have a massage treatment, which I rated it “acceptable” - 70 points. The spa is well put – include with the sauna and whirlpool – one thing that I noticed clearly – they only have one agent in the morning – who is also a spa therapist – so there is only limited treatment time available. The breakfast was served in Brasserie Desbroses – which has lively, casual ambience. Breakfast is buffet style – the food quality and options are great (life cooking station and pastry counter). There are few downsides. First - the services were a bit slow, (ex. in replacing the coffee or removed used plates). The staffs appear professional – but missing the WOW factor “smile and attention (abilities to fulfill guests need in advance). Second - I understand that it is a brasserie style setting – but, for the luxury hotel standard I think a table clothes/wears are necessary. I rated 85 points for food and 70 points for services. Overall – I did enjoy the stay at the Ritz Carlton Berlin. Overall services provided just right on the standard. Certainly they are some rooms for perfection. I certainly recommend this hotel – especially for its location, the food quality, and their wonderful spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Unspectacular stay at The Ritz Carlton Berlin”
Reviews.Author: warum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ritz Carlton Berlin from December 26 - 28, 2008. The rate was company based and included breakfast. At arrival I was welcomed by a doorman who also took care of the luggage and guided me to reception. As I was the last arriving guest that evening, the receptionist knew my name before I could tell her and checked me in very friendly. I was told that I got a very nice room and was guided to the elevator, only - not the room. Room 629 was a standard room with no special sight and quite far away from the elevator. According to the floor plan it was the same size all standard rooms had. I couldn't imagine why that room was a special one. However the room was very comfortable and spacious, the bathroom had a walk in shower, bathtub and a separate toilet. Turn down was already done and a complimentary bottle of water was given. A welcome notice of the management or fresh fruits were not in the room. The luggage transfer to the room was short in time. I wasn't informed about the breakfast times from the staff so I searched for a directory, but didn't find any. After requesting one, it was delivered to the room. A paper was brought to the room next morning and shoe shine was done correctly. One had to get up not too late because breakfast was offered until 10.30am, only - even on saturdays and sundays. The breakfast was served in Brasserie Desbroses and both days it was an annoying experience. It seemed as if the Ritz Carlton philosophy ends when entering the breakfast restaurant: One first was asked for the room number (not the name) and had to sign a bill before entering the restaurant. As I told the staff that breakfast was included in my room rate and I would not like to sign a bill, I was told that everyone has to sign it and it will not be charged if breakfast is included. This dialogue wasn't friendly at all, the restaurant was overcrowded and the staff seemed a bit confused. A guidance to a free seat was missing as there were problems with the service in general (used plates were not brought away, used cutlery wasn't replaced and on sunday the ordered hot chocolate wasn't served). There was no table wear, just a paper placemat which informed about the breakfast price (38,-- Euro; one of the most expensive breakfast rates in Germany). The breakfast itself was very good, there were plenty of choices, a life cooking station and the products were of high quality. At 10.30am the staff did start to prepare the restaurant for lunchtime. All in all the lodging aspect was acceptable - but The Ritz Carlton Berlin is one of the most expensive hotels in Berlin and there might be higher expectations at the service level (especially at the breakfast restaurant). That's why I rate this hotel "neutral" - nothing special - with three Tripadvisor stars.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jimcbob
Reviews.Content: This is, quite simply, the perfect hotel. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, the service was perfect. The hotel is stunning, and in an excellent location. The (club) rooms are of a good size, with very good bathrooms (we loved the size of the bathtub) and wonderful beds. If you can, go for a club-level room. The club is fantastic. Not only are the staff wonderful beyond belief, but the food presentations (although too few) are very good and the choice of drinks excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: We love hotels. The best ones are life experiences and the awful ones can ruin trips. I should say that one of my life's goals is to stay at every Ritz Carlton in the world. In my opinion they are the absolute best in the hotel business. This trip we added the Ritz Carlton Berlin to our list and I think it is the best hotel in the world. (Not resort, just hotel) Everything is new as the property opened only a couple of years ago standing right on top of what was the Berlin wall. The lobby, lobby bar, team room, restaurants and common areas are full of luxury. The hallyways and rooms are appointed with beautifu furniture, but what gives the hotel its most amazing look is the polished laqured finish on all of the woodwork. The rooms themselves are very spacious with an entryway, floor to ceiling windows, flat screen TV's, automatic blinds and of course mable bathrooms and heated marble flooring. We stayed on the club level and had an amazing breakfast each day along with evening cocktails. Their staff is incredibly warm, friendly and will do anything to help. Truly, the best hotel stay in my life and I'm 30 week per year traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Insightful
Reviews.Content: I had a good feeling about this place the moment I walked through the door. The front-desk staff take you in hand the moment you arrive and ease you gently into a more comfortable way of living. In this regard, I would expecially like to thank both Maya and Louisa, two of the Ritz Carlton staff who embody the highest standards of customer service. The bedrooms in the Ritz Carlton are of the highest calibre, havens of comfort in a frenetically lively city. Only the sound of the New Year's firecrackers could permeate the soundproofing of the windows. When the time came to say goodbye to this marvellous hotel, I left it reluctantly, secure in the knowledge that I would return in the future. I arrived in the Ritz Carlton on the evening of the 31st of December, just in time to see the fireworks display in the Tiergarten close by the Brandenberg Gate. After the show had ended, I got back to the hotel in about five minutes, ready to sample a few glasses of their champagne. The atmosphere was very convivial, with everyone willing to imbibe the "gemutlichkeit". The hotel is just across the road from the Sony Film Theatre (which shows all its films in English without German subtitles). The young, mostly German audience, are so knowledgeable that, for the most part, they have no difficulty in understanding the nuances and witticisms inherent in the English language. They were laughing out loud at Woody Allen's "Vicki Christina Barcelona". More importantly, however, the Berlin Philharmonic is about 600 metres away from the hotel. It accommodates about 2,000 concert-goers and, although I didn't get to see the Philharmonic itself, I saw superb performances of the "Ode to Joy" and "Carmina Burana" by the Czech Philharmonic and Choir. Some of the tickets for the Berlin Phil are very reasonably priced and I intend to return in March to see Sir Simon Rattle and his orchestral colleagues in action . The Ritz Carlton is famed throughout Berlin for the quality of its buffet breakfasts. Though they're not inexpensive, Berliners travel from far and wide just to partake in the sophistication of the repast on offer. There's a bakery in the restaurant itself and, needless to mention, the selection of breads is out of this world. They also offer a wide variety of cooked dishes, as well has hams and cheeses from all over Europe. Avoid this hotel for breakfast if you're obese or have a sweet tooth, because the temptation to munch on some of their fruit-based pastries is simply irresistible. As for Berlin itself, I think it's right up there with Paris, London and Rome as a uniquely inspiring European city. You can't help but be conscious of the old East-West divide when you're there. Echoes of the bitter-sweetness you experience when you see Venice for the first time. (I was moved by the photograph, on the railings of the Tiergarten, of a young eighteen year old East German girl, who had been mown down by bullets when trying to escape to the West in 1989. Incredible to think that these atrocities were perpetrated less than two decades ago.). But, emotionally, it's also difficult not to be moved by the immense transformation that has taken place in the city over the past two decades. Whilst there, I took the ninety minute double-decker bus ride through the main attractions of the place. An excellent way of getting an instantaneous snapshot of the overall layout of this uniquely moving and vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tiffinbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels I have seen, and I am traveling a lot. I have to emphasize the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. Food is brilliant in the Brasserie and the Curtain Club. Rooms are exceptionally nice. Here are my critics: There is no smokers lounge. Guests have to smoke outside which looks a bit cheap. I was told that they used to have one but it was closed after complaints from guests A charge of 5 EUR for 15 minutes internet in the business is a rip-off. My experience with the overnight shoe shine service was clearly not 5 star worthy: After leaving my shoes outside my room the night before I had to find them unpolished in the morning. They just put the shoe polish on but didn't give it a shine. At reception I had to argue with the shoe boy and listen to excuses, like there were a lot of shoes to clean that night. My shoes got a shine in the lobby and I got a shoe bag as apology.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrague
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as the christmas surprice for my husband. We were in this hotel before christmas day, because of christmas market. One market is just in front of the hotel, also metro station is near by. Hotel have very good location. Entrance to the hotel is very nice, with big christmas tree. Door man was very nice to us and parked our car. We booked club level room, which is in 10th floor with lovely view. Staff in the club is very kindly, pleasant and polite. In club lounge you can have champagne or coctails like bacardi cola, campari orange etc, several food, canapes, sweets. Room is amazing, with bvlgari amenities, slippers, bathrobes. We have in the room complimentary water and lovely donut with name of the hotel, which was very kind. Room is very big and comfortable, with nice decoration. Breakfast was amazing , best what we ever had. With all what are you thinking, exotic fruit ( maracuja, blueberry, strawberry, grapewine, pinnaple etc), many kind of cheeses, ham, salami, eggs, best pastry what we ever had and many kinds of sweets. I highly recommend this hotel, specialy to romantic stay or as the present to someone. We come back to this hotel for sure. Thanks to all staff for unforgettable stay in Ritz Carlton hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vakantiewegwijzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in this hotel, booked with http://www.vakantiewegwijzer.com. It was very good, the people were very nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “Stately yet comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: KatieKDetroit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in October. It is a lovely hotel and you can connect conveniently to anyplace in Berlin, using the subway or walking. Lots of restaurants and things to do right across the street at the Potsdamer Platz, where there is also the subway. The door man (wish I knew his name) was incredibly helpful with recommendations for places to go and things to do. The room was large and comfortable. The spa was wonderful - the massage was the best.

Reviews.Title: “je ne sais quoi”
Reviews.Author: hi3655
Reviews.Content: I can't put my finger on it but this hotel has something special. The service was great, the room was large, breakfast kicked butt and the spa and pool were terrific. The location on Potsdammer Platz is great. Most of the subway lines, the U and S trains, are across the street. The Matte district and Museum Island is not too far by cab ( 5 euros at the most). For a quick bite I recommend Vipiano the place next store. It's really good for pasta, pizza and salad. And it's cheap. Beleive it or not the Ritz was a good value even at 225 euro a night. The Sofitel at Gendarmenmarkt was just as costly and half the hotel. Book through Amex for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Rare luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: ParisLAtoronto
Reviews.Content: Luxury is a word that has been much abused in today's hotel industry, but it has been my experience that the Ritz-Carlton Berlin delivers true luxury. Most of the credit in what makes the difference between a luxury hotel and a true luxury experience goes to the staff. Indeed the Berlin staff had the ideal blend of deference and appropriateness, always very professional, impeccably clad and always prompt to help with intelligent responses. The staff was neither too pompous or overly ceremonial (which is often an issue with staff of luxury hotels) nor unprofessional/inappropriate as is too often the case. Of course the hotel itself was perfectly located within walking distance from the Brandenburg gate and the start/finish of the marathon, the reason of our stay there. The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious, a bit heavy on the mahogany and marble for today's decoration tastes, with superbly comfortable beds/linen. The bistro-style restaurant and breakfast were perfect and the spa appropriate, but felt a bit claustrophobic with no outside windows. Lastly, the added touch that made the difference was when we came back to the hotel after finishing the marathon, the entire staff in the lobby stopped and applauded to congratulate the runners.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: neil_connolly
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the business. Rooms are beautiful and fully kitted out. The staff are unreal!! Would totally recommend this to any person.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: M747
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a Junior Suite. It was Excellent, classy and the service was great. Breakfast was magnificent, Dinner at the hotel michelin star restaurant was great. Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bespoketravel
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Berlin. Beautiful Rooms, fine furnishings, Great comfortable bed and down comforters. Bathroom is luxurious , fluffy towels, turn down service. Breakfast is delicious, fresh fruits , exotic main courses, delicious baker, truly a wonderful experience for dining. Location is superb, just a splendid hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Business”
Reviews.Author: TRET
Reviews.Content: Best Value for your money in Berlin! Nothing better when comparing rates to other five star hotels in the area. Excellent services, very helpful staff in all situations (once with my daughter, her camera had an empty battery - they brought us new ones five minutes later into our room - of course without charge).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night in the Ritz Berlin, arrived at 21.00 so didn't had much change to check everytging out. But what I saw was simply perfect. Very nice and warm welcome, quick and efficient check-in. The standard room itselve was simply perfect, the best bed I've ever slept in, 2 blankets and 8! pillows. The room is equipt with several chairs, a large desk and an art nouveau home cinema set. The bathroom is very large, offering a separate shower and tub. Classy amenities from Bvlgari. Extra's like minibar and roomservice is on an acceptable price level, the roomservice menu offers very great dishes for little ones and grownups. Definitely worth staying here, altough if you really want to be in the citycenter a bit far away...........

Reviews.Title: “NIce and stuffy”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 5 nights at the beginning of August. The hotel is very nice and makes a nice first impression, staff very friendly and helpful as would be expected. We stayed at this hotel after staying at 3 different Four Seasons in Eastern Europe immediately before (reviews posted). We love the Four Seasons and this was our first Ritz Carlton and were excited to see how they compared. While the Ritz Carlton is very nice it is decorated in an over the top stuffy style, my grandma would have LOVE it! The staff were very nice but there was just something missing compared to the treatment we had received at the Four Seasons but it is hard to put your finger on what it was. On one occasion we had had in room dining (which came with a card that said the "trolley" would be picked up in one hour.) Upon leaving the room we called to let them know that we would like our turndown service while we went for an evening walk. Upon return we came to a room which had had its turndown service but they had left the stinky trolley sitting there to greet us when we got back a couple hours later. On another occasion we were lounging in bed with the "do no disturb" light on and had a knock on our door. I peeked through the peek hole to see a hotel employee standing there. Overall though this is a nice hotel and from what I understand standard Ritz Carlton style. We did have a nice stay and the location is perfect. We booked our stay through the hotel website at a rate of 350 Euro per night for the lowest category room (we did get a slight upgrade on check-in though).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: WPKATZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. All the major Berlin sights are easily accessible either on foot, by U or S Bahn or City Tour Bus. Check-in and check-out effortless. Room immaculate. Buffet breakfast had plentiful choice. Concierge extremely helpful. Delicious apples in lobby. Pool cannot cater for lap swimming but as I had it to myself two evenings running, can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, prime location”
Reviews.Author: kxt37
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into the lobby, the supreme elegance of the lobby set the tone for our 2-nt stay. The room was equally elegant and spacious. Incredible bathroom/ shower with hidden ceiling speakers. Location is perfectt -- on Potsdamer Platz with multiple lines crossing through. Staff helpful as one would expect at a R-C. Advice: Take a bike tour -- Berlin is flat and has bike paths throughout the city. We took the tour that met at the Hackescher Mkt , and were led to the hostel around the corner to get the bikes. Excellent tour guide, and with the bikes, covered so much in little time. Restaurant Rec: Malatesta -- Italian restaurant with much better fare than most Italian places and with honest prices; run by passionate Italians who go out of their way to take care of you. Lovely outside tables w a view of the Gendarmenmarkt square. Restaurant Rec #2: Cafe am Neuen See -- a Biergarten Gorgeous setting in a park-like setting. Will need a cab to get there probably.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Mohikaner
Reviews.Content: I stayed just short of a week and it was a pleasure. Courtesy was not too contrived - to a pleasant level. The room immaculate and very well presented. The location is great, just out the front door and down the steps to Potsdamerplatz. There is even a convenient shopping center adjacent to the hotel itself. As the title suggests, the attention to detail from all levels, from initial greeting by the doormen to checking in is impressive. A smooth ride all the way. I'll be back. Anyone spare me some change? =)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SwissLuxuryFan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely renovated. The breakfast is absolutely wonderful. (A lot of choice) The service of the breakfast is sometimes a little bit slow. (notice that it is a reccurent comment in my review...) The check in was quick. Nevertheless the room we had asked ( high floor) wasn't available. That wasn't a problem but when we came back (december 2007) we still didn't obtain it. And no upgrade for coming back twice. The Pillow list (you can choose!) is not very true. Actually the housekeeping never heard from this "pillow list". The fitness center was a mess. (see pictures). But the swimming pool (with automatic waves) is very beautiful. Perhaps a little bit small for a (renovated!!!) 5 star hotel. There weren't any chocolate or flowers in the room. That is a normal criteria for a 5 star hotel in Germany (www.hotelsterne.de) The amenities, food and furniture are amazing. The problem is ALWAYS the serivce. (for example the room service, you seem to annoy them!!!) I hope his review could have helped you. Don't hesitate to contat me. I speak French, German and Italian too.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: abcdxyz001
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to stay in some beautiful hotels around the world. But the Ritz Carlton Berlin is by far my favorite hotel I have ever stayed in. I often find excuses to schedule myself layovers in Berlin when I travel just so I can try to book a room. I always stay on the Executive level as I find this is well worth it. Their breakfasts are massive and luxurious with increadible selections of fruits, cheeses, meats, nuts, and pastry items. Fresh orange juice and grapefruit juice is there as well. During the day they can make small sandwiches and salads which are excellent. Between breakfast and lunch I usually save mone eating in the lounge. The rooms are really spectacular for both business and leisure. Each room is equipped with a large flat screen telvision as well as an all region DVD player, so I could watch DVDs I brought with me in my room. From a design point of view, a wood-floor entery way with substantial closets, armoirs, and minibar give way to a carpeted living area with great space lovely furnishings and one of the most comfortable beds in which I have ever slept. The large marble bathroom has the best rainfall shower as well as seperate tub (this is one of the few tubs I know is clean enough to take a bath in). The staff are always excellent, while valuing professionalism over overt warmth, they are friendly and get the job done. Concierges (particularly Cairina and Thorsten) are excellent. There were some disappointments on my last stay. First, the quality of the food from room service was hit or miss and I really preferrred the food from the executive lounge. Furthermore, I could not get internet access in rooms on one side of the hotel as the design of the building blocks the WiFi signal. I had to change rooms to deal with this problem. I was then awoken at 8 o'clock in the evening say they needed to do repair work on my room (what I don't know). However, I was upgraded to a grand suite which was spectacular and a half bottle of Moet and Chandon was waiting for me with a hand-written note from the concierge apologizing for all the problems and thanking me for my continued busienss. One other disappintment: I was scheduled to leave the hotel on the day that President Medvedev of Russia was scheduled to arrive at the hotel. Despite the fact that German Federal Police began to close various parts of Pottsdammer Platz from early in the morning, the hotel would not tell me what was going on as they did not want to give away the "secret" of their VIP guest. His security etc., shut down Pottsdammer Platz and the lobby of the hotel for roughly 45-75 minutes. As I attempted to leave i was stopped. I very nearly missed an imporant connection to Munich for a business meeting because of this. Traffic around the Square was paralyzed and only because my train was delayed 45 minutes at Hauptbahnhof did I make it in time. While the hotel did send a bellman in a hotel car with me to the station to try to ensure I made it (which I eventually did), I was disappointed that staff were so secretive. Had they simply sent a note to all guests that an event was taking place which could cause delays during certain periods I could have changed my plans and avoided such problems. I have come to expect more from this lovely property. While it is difficult to discuss value when you are paying 300-400 Euro a night, comapred to what other hotels charge in Europe I am always happy to pay the roughly 350 Euro it usually costs to get a club room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Regent, I found the Ritz Carlton to be in the same league but with a slightly more relaxed atmosphere. The room was large and very comfortable, with the details expected from Ritz Carlton. The bathroom was also superb, with one the best showers ever (after the Amstel in Amsterdam) and toiletries from Bulgari. The restaurants were all good, and I enjoyed the tea lounge (very large selection of loose-leaf teas) and the Curtain Bar. While I did not like the decor of the Desbrosses Brasserie, I had a good lunch there, and the breakfast buffet is fantastic (but the jams and fruit juices were better at the Adlon). The spa was, as in so many luxury hotels, underground, so you could not enjoy natural light and a nice view. The fitness and the sauna are very good but the pool is too small to swim laps. Overall, one of the best experiences in a European city hotel, although, for my taste, it lacks the authenticity and patina of some of the older palaces (Bristol Paris, Sacher, Amstel, Baur au Lac, Ritz Lisbon).

Reviews.Title: “A stunningly suberb hotel that touches and exceeds all the bases”
Reviews.Author: willip
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and we chose it as the venue to celebrate my step-parents wedding anniversary. We had previously stayed on the club floor and again booked a club floor room for us and them and were pleased to find that standards were as good as before. Service in the Club Lounge is the best in its league in our experience and the staff are utterly friendly, welcoming, and professional. The daily food presentations and drinks cannot be faulted and the entire experience left us wanting more. The rooms are very well appointed and furnished to a very high standard, while the amenities are again without fault. We can recommend the Curtain Bar on the ground floor for both pre and after dinner drinks and the live music (piano and singer) set the right note for a relaxing end to both our evenings there. We took dinner on the first night in Desbrosses restaurant and with pre-notification from us they had prepared a menu of versions of their fare suitable for my mother-in-law who suffers from wheat intolerance. How's than for attention to guest needs? We are regular visitors to Berlin and will return again and again (budget permitting).

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly number one...”
Reviews.Author: pwt
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews here as this was a special birthday trip to be combined with running the Berlin half marathon. The excellent service started a few days before arrival when I was sent an email asking what time I was landing in Berlin and did I want my room early. We arrived at the hotel at our predicted time and were promptly and efficiently checked in and escorted to our room. The service and courtesy from all of the staff really made this hotel stand out - including the reception staff struggling with the Ryanair web page to check us in online for our return flight (obviously not many guests at the RC demean themselves by travelling on such an airline, and I have to admit this is the last time I'll use them).The contrast between Ryanair and the service at the RC really does show you get what you pay for. The room was large and comfortable, with all the luxury touches you expect from a 5 star hotel. The gym was good, and the breakfasts we had were good quality, but typical city hotel prices. For a city centre hotel, the whole experience is one of calmness and an escape from the hustle and bustle outside. The other major plus point of the Ritz Carlton is its location - right on Potsdamer Platz, making it close to transport links, food, shopping, entertainment and the excellent Gemaldgallerie along with several other galleries and museums. There are plenty of dining choices all around in all price brackets. I can thoroughly recommend 'Vox' restaurant at the Grand Hyatt nearby for a special occasion. Superb quality at reasonable prices (for the food) but €11 for a bottle of mineral water was a bit steep - especially since the £ has slumped against the € in recent months. Having previously stayed at the Marriot and Radisson SAS in Berlin, this was worth the extra for a special occasion, or just to experience service at a level not often found these days, even at other 5 star hotels I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER with a little but”
Reviews.Author: drop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is luxurious, staff are polite except on our last day! The staff at the reception was either hung-over or on something high - she did not listen to what my husband had told/explained to her, in the end it went wrong and she had the ordersity to return to my husband asking him what he had already explained twice. Luckily enough there were sober fast-thinking people around to fix the problem quickly. We asked for hot water on a regular basis for heating up our baby's food, on one or two occassion the hot water brought up was brown. We ordered food from room service all throughout our stay because of our baby, we were not impressed with the room service menu and some of the food that was brought up. On one occassion, the wrong order was brought up but I was too hungry to notify them. I personally felt insecure on entering the building because of all the staff at the door, but all in all very clean, sheets & towels were changed on a daily basis. The breakfast crew were very polite and on top of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MutatisMutandis
