Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Been there last year with my wife and we simply loved every minute of being there! Starting with the main entrance and going to the restaurant and the rooms evetyrhing is surrounded by exquisite good taste. One of the best hotels that I´ve been no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Pure relaxation in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: frankyboy800
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz-Carlton Berlin for one week in early March, and had a great time! I stayed on the club level, and was thoroughly impressed by both the attentive service and relaxed atmosphere throughout the hotel. The room itself was flawless, all rich colours and chandeliers, and very quiet. I also ate in the Brasserie Debrosses for breakfast each day, which was a pretty epic affair. Having previously stayed nearer the Ku'damm, the location of the Ritz Carlton was probably more appropriate for tourists, being near Potsdamer Platz, Under den Linden etc. I also found that the concierge and club lounge staff were excellent at providing good restaurant and travel recommendations. To summarise, the Ritz Carlton Berlin is the ideal case to explore and enjoy the delights of fantastic Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: keswickian
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the ritz-carlton for a 3night brake just before christmas. The very good location was an added bonus. The rooms were large with beautifully appointed bathrooms and the staff managed to be friendly without being "cheesy". I tried hard to find any fault, but this is just a great place to stay. I tried to book again for an easter break, but left it too late; so if you want near perfection- book early.

Reviews.Title: “Old-World Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DPBird
Reviews.Content: November 2007, paid ~250 Euro/night. Travel agent was able to get us bumped to Club Level at no extra charge which allowed drinks and finger food gratis. Style of Club lounge area was hunting lodge with dedicated concierge who were always helpful, friendly, and attentive. Room was nice size - very comfortable for two. Bathroom had separate shower and large soaking tub. Marble everywhere. "Pillow menu" was nice touch and appreciated. Great location near Tiergarten, Holocaust Memorial, and both U- and S-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: Quite simply this is the best 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in. The faciities and the staff were quite amazing - all 5 star hotels need to examine the staff selection and training processes at this hotel. To top it off we were upgraded to a corner suite on arrival - it was an amazing room. One thing about the location - I found the area a little barren and deserted at night. A wonderful overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PtyChirry
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, not one fault! and we were 5 couples. The staff was great, specially the doormen, waiters and staff at the concierge level. Rooms were everything you will expect, service and staff exceeded expectations, everyone was extra nice to all of us. Location was very good and without a doubt we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: jerseytravelfan
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Ritz Berlin and can honestly say that I have never had a better experience at a hotel. I have stayed at several 5 star properties including the Ritz London, and the Ritz Berlin easily surpasses them all. Every staff member is friendly and accommodating without being overbearing. I stayed on the Club level and feel the extra attention and amenities were worth the extra expense. I do agree with others who note the lack of variety with the food presentation, but it is not meant to replace a full meal. The drink service is impeccable- don't miss the double mocha macchiato. The Spa is small, but very nice and I had the facial of a lifetime!! The fitness room is also small, but well equipped. Location is very central, many sites are in walking distance and several hop-on/hop-off bus tours depart across the street from the hotel. I will definitely return to the Ritz when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel in best location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through AMEX and was upgraded on arrival to a superb room with access to the Club Floor. Stayed here for a week. Staff are wonderful and welcoming, particularly the hostess on the Club Floor. Club Floor features three delicious food presentations each day with complimentary beverages. Incredible value! Also ate in the ground floor French brasserie which was superb. The quality rooms and cleanliness are beyond comparison. The gym is good, but the swimming pool is more of a plunge pool. This is a fabulous hotel and perfectly located across the road from a main subway - Potsdamerplatz. Also across the road is an excellent undercover shopping mall, cinemas, and a leading Berlin restaurant: Facil, which I can also recommend without hesitation. The hotel is within easy walking distance along one of the Tiergarten's bordering streets to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, and Unter den Linden. In fact you can even walk to Museum Island from the hotel - probably takes 30 - 45 mins. Berlin is a city steeped in history and full of surprises not the least of which is this well appointed 5 star hotel at its epicentre.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, patchy service”
Reviews.Author: soundmonkey
Reviews.Content: I have spent quite a lot of time in Berlin and was returning this august with a party of four people, 2 of which don’t know Berlin so the hotels central location was one of the reasons I chose it. The hotel was rated as the best in Berlin by Trip Advisor reviewers and I trust the Ritz Carlton Brand name. I booked the hotel through Expedia and got a great rate £118 per night better than the hotels own web site. On arrival we were greeted by the very helpful desk staff, we were early and our room was not ready but they took our phone number and called us whilst we were out to tell us that it was waiting for us. We were upgraded to a room that was slightly bigger than the one we had booked as the hotel was quiet. The size of the rooms are very good, their standard room is the same size as a deluxe room at other 4 and 5 star Berlin hotels. The bathrooms are great with huge baths, walk in marble showers a separate toilet and double sinks, there are Bulgari toiletries and rose scented bath salts which are perfect after a busy day walking around Berlin. The Gym is small but well laid out, the pool is very relaxing with power water jets at one end. I also used the plunge pool and sauna. We used the Spa for pedicures and massage both very good. The breakfasts are good with a very large range, but we ate outside the hotel on a couple of occasions as the restaurant was very busy and quite noisy. The only thing that let us down on our stay was some of the service. In the Tea Lounge and the Curtain Club on the ground floor, the staff were very pleasant but on 4 different occasions we had problems with our orders. The service was very slow or the order didn’t turn up, we were wrongly charged sometimes to our benefit sometimes to our detriment. On the second occasion the manager of these areas realized what was happening and came to speak to us, she was very professional and pleasant; we were given complimentary Petits Fours and champagne. Then the next day our order was wrong again and so on. Even though everyone was very helpful, I felt that this isn’t the level of service they would want to offer and when I returned home I received a letter from the marketing manager of the hotel saying the same thing to me. This said I would stay there again as I think the problem was young inexperienced staff and they did everything they could to rectify mistakes. The hotel is in a very convenient location, the rooms are large and comfortable, if you want cutting edge interior design this isn't the hotel for you but the furnishings and servicing are high quality with lots of small touches which set them apart from other hotels. The concierge service was very good. We got a great price and enjoyed or stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz-Carlton Berlin lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: It will sound terribly blase but the Ritz-Carlton in Berlin is the best hotel I have stayed in Berlin and one of the best I have stayed in worldwide. What makes it truly outstanding is not the facility,although it is grand in the old world style.Rather it is the impeccable service from every single staff member I came into contact with during my 3 day stay! The sort of service that go's out of it's way to make you feel comfortable with receiving assistance.If you ask where is the breakfast room (mmm,don't get me started on the breakfast buffet...) any member of staf you ask will not point out the way or give you directions.Rather with a polite smile they will simply say "follow me sir" and lead you all the way there! If you walk into the lobby with a piece of paper in your hand the staff will catch your eye and politely ask whether they can relive you of your burden! and so on and so on.Really a rare experience in todays world of pre packaged microwaved service! Throughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect interior, best service”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: Being the second time in the Ritz-Carlton Berlin, it raised quite some expectations to the overall experience. Getting into the hotel was again a pleasure, large wooden doors, incredible stairway and friendly staff. Although I have to admit that the service orientation of the staff is so much above the German average, that it feels sometimes strange to always get greeted. The rooms are still very, very luxurious. In the evenings, your bed get prepared and of course everything is clean. This time, I had a room where the toilet and the shower are in one room, better ask for a room with seperate shower, bath and toilet. Strange to me that the rooms still have regular TV's and no FlatTV's, but I guess that is too modern for those guys. Overall, still the most luxurious hotel that I have ever been too, and even for a very good price (we payed 205 Euro excl. breakfast +29 Euro). The only downside is that the hotel does not provide free Internet access, what a pitty for a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: NumberOne&Two
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel last week on a business trip, only stayed one night, but have already booked a surprise visit for my girlfriend in the lead-up to Christmas. This is simply one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and is dripping with class. The location is perfect and the staff and so polite and very approachable. For a city centre hotel, the room size was off the scale, with a walk-in wardrobe, ginormous marble floored bathroom with gorgeous round bath, separate room for WC and huge 'drench' shower. I arrived late and felt peckish, so enjoyed a perfectly cooked steak and vegetables, brought to my room in a heated trolley within 25 mins. Check-in and check-out very painless, but breakfast was on the pricey side (you can go a la carte for €10 & drinks, or buffet for €30 - £20 - $40 per person, per day) Just an incredible experience - bring on December!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Ritz-Carlton Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: sn00zie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous! Even got upgraded to a deluxe room. 5-star bliss! Would definately stay there again. Very close to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie and Unter den Linden. If only in Berlin for a short visit take the tour bus to see the sights which leaves opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Price, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Junket
Reviews.Content: When is a deal too good to turn down? €195 per night at the Ritz-Carlton is a deal, a steal - the sale of the century! I had a wonderful view of Potsdammer Platz. Now it took this deal to prise me away from the Kempinski - (still my favourite crash pad in Berlin) and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were very friendly and made an effort to get to know me, especially the porters and the bar staff. The room was very tasteful and the bathroom elegant. There was only one downside, and it is a singular gripe that I have with many hotels and that is the charge for using the wireless broadband. This of course will become a thing of the past when mobile broadband becomes more common place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJessica
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get more luxurious. Everything dripping in chrystal and gold; yet the staff was not pompous and were very helpful. Hotel's location on Pottsdamer Platz is alive and fun and tour trolley for hoping to sights is on nearby corner. The breakfast buffet might keep you there all morning, it's fantastic. The cafe restaurant has great choices at realistic prices although it needs some breaking up into smaller areas; it's one wide open space with no charm. The Bar is stunning and expensive but worth a visit. The only annoyance was all the card advertisements in the room & especially the bathroom; very tacky for such a gorgeous place.

Reviews.Title: “a hotelier's report”
Reviews.Author: JamesChong
Reviews.Content: 1. Lack of water pressure in shower 2. did not have toothbursh as a complimentary item for a 5 star 3. the exisitng electronics are outdated. the fridge is not cold and has smell inside. 4. the room was beautiful and so was the general hotel. 5. i was there for a conference. the coffee and food for the conference was horrible. 6. the staff in general were nice and the location was great

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect 5 review”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelerTO
Reviews.Content: What more can be said about this hotel. We spent 3 nights at the Ritz-Carlton in early June as part of a 9 city trip to Germany, Austria, Budapest, and Prague. Of the 9 five star hotels we stayed at, this was our favorite city hotel. The weekend rate makes this hotel a real steal compared to its competition. Special raves about the incredible buffet breakfast. We loved Berlin, especially compared to Prague. My wife a true shopper highly recomends KaDaWe, Berlin's answer to Harrod's. The food pavillion is an incredible bargain and treat.

Reviews.Title: “a great find in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: GMBLondon
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from a long weekend in Berlin where we stayed in the Ritz-Carlton on Potsdamer Platz.The hotel -like all of this area-is relatively new and was a great location for our short visit. The service in the hotel, from the bell-hop to restaurant staff was excellent and the mood and feel of the hotel was lovely and friendly. Bedrooms were superb with really comfortable beds and lovely soft pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: HoratioLondon
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with this hotel,as soon as we got there we were treated like royalty.There were loads and loads of very impressive chadalears,however they did notput you off the utter luxury. This eserves 10/10 and i will definately be visiting again and i advise you to. The food.... The staff..... The rooms... everything Magic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Traditional Ritz-Calrton Elegance in Contemporary Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Berlin exudes old world traditional elegance, more than I have seen in any of their other properties. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted by friendly doormen, and an abundance of chandeliers. The lobby is reminiscent of something you might see in Versailles, as another reviewer noted. Although I am a young traveler, I remain open to a variety of taste levels, including those that are more traditional in style. That being said however, the Ritz-Carlton Berlin has taken opulence to another level, which I often felt imposing throughout my stay. Firstly, let it be said, that service, comfort and quality were all exceptional, and delivered in true Ritz-Carlton fashion. I felt however, that the design of the hotel was more conducive to hosting dignitaries, than it was a place to relax. I tend to enjoy a hotel, which caters to a variety of purposes, as I feel most newer Ritz-Carlton's do. The service at this property is fantastic, and typical of most Ritz-Carlton's. Despite the language barrier, communication is excellent, and the staff was superb. The location of this hotel was quite central, and adjacent to the modern Sony Center. Just blocks away from the hotel are Berlin's most historic attractions, as well as the city's famous shopping street. The rooms were well appointed, but again opulent and quite gaudy. Rich woods, gold colors and frills were all used in the decor, to make the rooms appeal more to the liking of a king, than a Ritz-Carlton guest. We enjoyed a club-level deluxe room, which was spacious and allowed us access to the Club lounge. The lounge features were nice, but not as generous as others I have seen. There were three food presentations each day, including breakfast, lunch and a combined evening hourderves and dessert. I felt that many of the items were repeated each day. As with the rest of the hotel, we felt quite intimidated by the Club environment. Given our younger age (mid twenties) we were often given the "look" in the lounge. The Ritz-Carlton Berlin is a great hotel, but may only appeal to a limited audience. Given the opportunity to visit Berlin once again, I might decide on another hotel. Rarely have I had this opinion on a Ritz-Carlton property, and I've stayed in several worldwide. If you desire opulence and grandeur, this very well could be your hotel of choice, as it still upholds all the traditions of a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant old-style posh hotel for the 'ritz'!”
Reviews.Author: john017
Reviews.Content: O.k, so i didn't exactly fork out the 500 euros per night for this hotel, we stayed complemenary since my freind, a journalist, was doing a story about the hotel. although the service is beyond service, the food excellent and the rooms stunning, i didn't feel that comfy there, but that's probably because it was me, not used to such luxoriousity. every time you enter or leave the hotel, it's a big deal with the doormen opening and closing the doors for you - that's not for me, just leave me alone. you canno't be annonemous at this hotel. while we stayed there, we saw presidents of countries, diplomats and royals. this is cleary a hotel for the rich and famous. the rooms are amazing, with stunning furniture and the most amazing bath and WC i ever saw. they are large and spacious. the location is great at the western part of the city, in potsdamer platz, right opposit the marriot and the sony center with IMAX 3D, and a starbucks around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “pure luxery!”
Reviews.Author: beniboi
Reviews.Content: Well first off. we didn't book to stay at this hotel, we were soposed to stay at the marriot nearby but our first night was double booked, so they upgraded us to this hotel, not that we were complaining, and then we had to be upgraded to a deluxe room because there "standerd" rooms were fully booked... so yea we felt like we like stars! the staff are very friendly, couldn't do more for you, the rooms were huge, very confy beds, and an extremly posh bathroom. they also supplyed posh toiletries ( la prerie or somthing like that) so of course we took them as were getting free desinger stuff! the location is excellent accross the road from the sony centre which was very nice with bars and the like. the breakfast was very good as you would expect, set in a french resturant very nice. choice was excellent. we were sad when leaving back to the marriot in the morning... but as you can read from my marriot review that it's as good as the ritz which is a hard thing to do! so the only thing we can't comment on is the price payed because we got this for free almost.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yanswife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first trip to Berlin for a flying weekend. Excellent hotel, as said faultless service and facilities. We used the club floor and would highly recommend this. The Debrosses Brasserie was also very good and not too expensive for the high quality food. Berlin itself was great with lots to do in spite of poor weather for our stay. Would go to this hotel again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October last year. Booked a club room and was not disappointed. The club floor staff are absolutely superb and anticipate your every need. Everything in the club fllor, including champagne is included and is all served at your seat. We ate in Debrosses Brasserie which was also superb and reasonably priced. Would I go back again? Absoultely!

Reviews.Title: “Opulence with a reasonable price tag”
Reviews.Author: AndersCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: You probably won’t find such magnificence at this price level anywhere in Europe. It is not exactly motel price levels, but when you take the splendour of the Ritz into account – rooms, breakfast and hotels services – it is a bargain and ideal for a special celebration! Don’t miss out on the spa facilities in the cellar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmalux
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two wonderful nights at the Ritz-Carlton Berlin. We arrived at 9 am on a Friday morning and the first pleasant surprise was that we could get our room immediately. We had booked a deluxe room which was very spacious with windows on two sides. The room was impeccable and it is very obvious that a huge amount of money has been put into the construction of this place. Personally, I would have preferred a more modern design instead of the old-style chic but the room, the bed and especially the bathroom remain a true delight. Fantastic bed and fantastic shower. We were quite surprised to find an old-fashioned box of a TV set but we didn't turn it on at all during our stay. I'm not a big fan of the Ritz-Carlton toiletries and would have preferred the Bulgari products. The rooms are really quiet and we didn't hear any noise at all. It was only at breakfast that we realised that the hotel was, in fact, VERY busy. The first morning we had to wait 15 minutes to get a table for breakfast and everything was rather stressful including the service. However, the quality of the food is outstanding. The staff is excellent and they truly seem to care about what they are doing. The only thing we didn't like about the place and which really needs improvement is the gym. If you only use cardio machines you will be OK but if you want to do some weight training you will VERY quickly run out of options. There is basically just one seated row and one chest press machine + some dumbbells. This is simply not acceptable for a new hotel of this standard. Furthermore, the gym is right next to the gym which makes the air too hot and too humid for a good workout. We liked the central location on Potsdamer Platz as it is very convenient to commute both to the western and eastern parts of Berlin. Many attractions are within walking distance. Overall a wonderful hotel and fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Luxury”
Reviews.Author: HolyBoy
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton is conveniently located on the Potsdamer Platz. Some Berlin sights/shopping are within walking distance however the Potsdamer Platz itself isn't very appealing. I booked a Club room and it was well worth it bec the club staff provides great personalized service, the Club lounge is very spacious, luxurious and pleasant place to relax and offers a wide variety of complimentary food and also beverages, all day, including alcohol, the food is self-service and drinks are promptly served by the staff on request. They also provided a bottle of champagne in the room. While the facade of the hotel is not any special the interiors are very luxurious and opulent. I definitelly not like modern, understated and minimalistic design-hotels but despite that the Ritz was a tad too much even for me - crystal chandeliers everywhere (including bathroom), all in polished wood, marble, too many bold colors. The room itself was a bit small yet included all amenities of a fivestar hotel, marble bath, bedside control panel (A/C, light, curtains, do not disturb) and the hotel is new so also all furnishings were in best state and all was of course perfectly clean. The bath had La Prairie amenity, separate shower, separate toilet, two types of bahrobe to choose, the option of Bath Butler etc. The Spa is also a great place to relax, with a gym, wide range of La Prairie treatments and a pool and whirlpool. The pool is quite small, actually the whole area is not very spacious and if there would be too many guests it could be unpleasant (but there wasn't so it was OK). All the staff is very courteous, there is a fine dining restaurants though I did not try it as it was closed for summer holidays. The Ritz together with the Adlon are the best hotels in the city. The Ritz is newer, more opulent and has better value/money spent ratio (espec with the Club lounge amenities) while the Adlon has a more appealing location, more understated (but still very luxurious) decor and more prestige being a historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault it”
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: It's true, this hotel is excellant. If you can afford it (we had a freebie), stay here. Great service, good breakfast, AMAZING bathroom. End of!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: buzze
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, club level, weekend. This is probably the best hotel either of us has stayed in and we thought good value in comparison to the prices of other 5 star hotels in other capital cities. The service was very good and we found the staff friendly and helpful. Room- The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, bathroom well appointed with seperate walk in shower, large bath, separate toilet. Robes, slippers and nice toiletries. Used room service only for morning tea - arrived rapidly. Views from our room included the roof of the Sony centre and the old facade of the Hotel Esplanade now enclosed behind a protective case. Location - We loved the location of the hotel right in the heart of Berlin and the new architecture of Potsdamer Platz. Its within easy walking distance of many tourist sites including the Holocaust Memorial, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Topographie des terrors. When we were there there was a busy Xmas market and toboggan run ( complete with snow) in the square. There are both U and S bahn stations in Potsdamer Platz so access to other parts of Berlin is easy. Food/ Drink- As we stayed club level drinks were "free" including champagne. Ate breakfast in club lounge every day and evening canapes on two evenings. All very enjoyable and again "free". The coffee was fantastic. Ate at Desbrosses ( french bistro) one evening and had a good but not exceptional meal. Would recommend Modern Art of Asia (MAOA) - nearby ( 5 mins walk ) Leipzeiger Platz for its good food and lively atmosphere. Would we stay again ?- I hope we do. Berlin is a fantastic city and we just scratched its surface in 3 days so we have to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the Berlin Wall and the Reichstag.”
Reviews.Author: Christine171
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and had everything that we needed except coffee making facility. We stayed on the club floor so had access to a private lounge with complimentary drinks (from tea to champagne) and canapes all day. Across the road is a huge shopping mall which was fun. The main shopping area is about 15 mins away by cab and seemed to have everything you could possibly want (if you like shopping). I found my stay at the Ritz very relaxing, though I didn,t use the spa or gym so cannot comment as to whether or not it is tiny (see last review).

Reviews.Title: “Standard 5 Class Fare”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_D_R
Reviews.Content: What you'd expect really. Ruthless politeness and helpfulness from the staff. The Gym and Spa are both tiny and unimpressive for a top end hotel however.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: bckrSTHLM
Reviews.Content: Great location, superb service. great prices. Fresh rooms! A hotel that shows the way.

Reviews.Title: “loved the ritz”
Reviews.Author: 50 & Fab
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful three nights stay at the Ritz Carlton. We stayed in a club room and it was certainly worth the extra. We were checked in, in our room and what a room it was. It overlooked the sony centre and tiergarten. The room was immaculate as was the whole hotel. Staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The whole experience was first class as you would expect and it is justifiably the number one tripadvisor hotel in Berlin. Look no further than the Ritz Carlton if you want 5 star luxury and to be within walking distance of all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: MOF_CPH
Reviews.Content: A new hotel. 5-star. Helpfull and pleasent staff. Great room with exellent service, though view was unlimited. Lounge floor is recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mmsmith2
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying anywhere else when i visit Berlin. This is a true Ritz-Carlton, none of those cheap rooms that have been dressed up. The staff is very friendly and helpful- there always seems to be someone there when you need them. The conceriege sent us to fabulous resturants and everyone was wonderful! The location is also great, there is a S-Bahn station in from of the hotel and the The Reichstag area is a 5 min walk and Checkpoint Charlie is a 5 min walk too!

Reviews.Title: “Simply said: PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: OK-in-MUC
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Ritz Carlton in Berlin is definitely a treat. I just came in from a short and demanding business trip to singapore (where I also had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz-Carlton) and went directly to Berlin. They gave me a Club Level room (without the privileges) and although my personal taste is much more on the modern side, I just loved the classic beauty of the Karl Friedrich Schinkel-inspired furniture. The room is spacious (working desk with ink-well and old-fashioned nib), the bed is a dream (yes, they have a pillow menu to choose from), the marble bathroom does have a heated floor (if it is not warm enough for your taste, ask housekeeping: they will turn it up), the TV cabinet also houses a DVD-player as additional entertainment option. And did I mention they actually placed a "La Prairie" body emulsion with the bathroom amenities? The Spa is luxurious, the small gym has the latest state of the art technogym equipment. But all this would not make the Ritz-Carlton the extraordinary place it is without the Ladies and Gentlemen working there. My company hosted a four-day client event at the Ritz-Carlton. One evening, we had a special guest (a well known up-and-coming German actor) invited for dinner outside the hotel. We returned and settled for drinks at the Curtain Club. You know, they don't close as long as there are guests... and the night became longer and longer with drinks and talk. At two thirty in the morning, the actor and one of the top managers felt like playing a round of chess and they asked the bartender if he had a board. When he declined, the actor off-handishly said something along the lines of: "...that's kind of weak, I thought this was a luxury hotel..." A quarter of an hour later, the night concierge had found a set of figurines. He also downloaded the image of a chess-board from the internet and had it printed on canvas... so the guests got their game of chess, which lasted until six a.m.. ...going above and beyond the usual duty of a bartender and a concierge is what makes the Ritz-Carlton so special. Needless to say, everyone in the entire group learned about the famous chess-board... ...and this was not the only time the staff at the Ritz-Carlton proved to be the heart and soul of the hotel. All our clients, who are seasoned and demanding travellers, were very pleased with their stay at the Ritz-Carlton - and for me, the RC is definitely the hotel by which I measure every other hotel I stay at. One other thing I can recommend: Try the afternoon tea - served on fine Wedgewood porcelain, it is a luxurious passtime that has style and flair...

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in town”
Reviews.Author: Laurentine
Reviews.Content: The location is second-to-none: On Potsdamer Platz, next to the Sony Centre featuring futuristic architecture and countless bars, restaurants and shopping opportunities. Within walking distance of the Reichstag, Brandenburg gate, Holocaust memorial and Berlin Philharmonic Hall. The hotel is true Ritz-Carlton material. Excellent service, beautiful building & amenities. Worth every cent. Would recommend absolutely. Service at the Desbrosses brasserie restaurant on the slow side but this seems to be a general syndrome that we noticed at each restaurant in town.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: AndreasHamburg
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this extravagant hotel and decided to book a club room. Having been a guest in some other fine Berlin hotels, I must say this one is by far the best. The staff is not only professionel and catering to every need, but really friendly. No matter whom you will meet, the bellboy, the ladies from the housekeeping or a manager everyone will wish you a good day. And it seemed to me, they really meant it - that was not just the result of good training. The room was spacious,nicely decorated with lots of cherry wood, the bed perfect, everything could be operated by a touchscreen panel - even the curtains. The club lounge offers three food presentations and drinks all day long. The staff on the club floor is just perfect! They will know what your wishes are, before you tell them. And they will remember your name. The amenities are chosen with a faible for details and a sense of humour: You will find a "Berlin pancake" (some kind of filled doughnut) in your room, which is a wellknown specialty of the town. At night I did not only find a handwritten greetingcard, but lavender too. In the bathroom you will find candles and fresh orchids! The location is convenient: at the Potsdamer Platz, close to the Philharmonie, the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag and adjecant to a wonderful park, the Sony Center and a mall. I can highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tottie
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day stay at the Ritz Carlton Berlin. This is a fantastic hotel. The service was exceptional. Stayed in a Club Lounge room -which is certainly worth the extra few euros - complimentary drinks from 6am to 10.30pm, breakfast, lunch and nibbles in the evening. The lounge is tastefully furnished as is the rest of the hotel. The room was spacious, the bed very, very comfortable and the little extras ie water, donoughts and a present from St Nicholas were really appreciated. Ate at Debrosses which was lovely - the portions were enormous. The next evening ate at a French restaurant called Le Piaf - recommended to us my Alexandra in the Club Lounge. This was in Charlottesburg and thoroughly worth the 15 euro taxi ride. The whole stay - though brief was fantastic - any bad reviews on this site take with a pinch of salt. RC number one as always - thanks for a wunderbar time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mjmsf
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a week stay. A lovely hotel, the service is outstanding (most 4 star US properties could not compare), the location is very central for walking, touring and getting any number of busses, trains, and trams. Don't expect any gorgous views from the hotel, but the food, room service, spa, and many other ammenities make this place truly first class.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkle those Ritz Carlton chandeliers over Potzdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: serendipit4
Reviews.Content: Simply phenomenal. Don't let the overt opulence of marble.chandeliers and some of the worst paintings in the history of art deter you! Time Out was not inaccurate when they described RC Berlin as 'Versailles meets Vegas.' My wife and I were lucky enough to spend a week here being gloriously pampered in the Club Lounge on the 10th floor. We had the holiday of a lifetime. This was our 6th Ritz Carlton experience and every time we just have the most unbelievably spoily package. Ritz Carlton is the epitome of customer service. The hotel is alive and has a buzz to it that reflects the whole shock of the new that symbolises the reclaimed no man's land of Potzdamer Platz. As the chill out music gently supplements the champagne and vodka cocktails. the visitor can look out on the changing colours of the Sony Centre and soak up this whole spectacularly arty and radical urban environment. As remnants of the wall are encased almost directly outside the hotel. one senses a whole new commercial and stylistic vibe that confronts that old cold war misery head on. Yeah chandeliers. bring em on. How do you like them? More, more, more! If you do have wet liberal misgivings about the opulence here or more likely a distaste for the overtly vulgar or 'chav' then check out the Adlon Kempinski that surprisingly tops the tripadvisor chart. After RC we found the Adlon mundanely 4 Star. Parochial, old school and snobbish, guests and staff alike. Tired and dull. we returned to Ritz Carlton happy to be back within the sparkle. Berlin is a must see. Great Art galleries, steeped in history, good food and beer. Take a river cruise along the Schiffe. check out Check Point Charlie as a matter of duty (grubby, cramped and full of students) but. be sure to reward yourself afterwards with some steins of cold Budweiser (Prague brew naturellement!) and be sure to try the Currywurst. The Tea Gardens are very peaceful and beautiful too with ducks, statues and bridges. RC has 2 fabulous restaurants. The Sunday champagne and lobster at Desbrosses is surreal in the sense of an upmarket French restaurant theme park uprooted piece by piece from its origins. Vitrum is one of the best restaurants in the world. My wife described it as a cacophony of taste. I asked for the best steak in Berlin and was more than met with that request. The Club Lounge has free internet access and 2 laptops available. The service is nothing short of stupendous. We were deluged with gifts from morn til night. Fruit bowls, poems. pictures. sweet concoctions. the list is endless regarding the staff's commitment to ensuring the best . Breakfast was excellent with decent bacon and scrambled alongside the usual RC delicacies. Champagne and chandeliers. Oh yes. ich bin ein Berliner!

Reviews.Title: “All's well that ends well”
Reviews.Author: Rumpelstilzkin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz twice, at the end of July and a week later in August. It was not a problem-free experience. I had decided on this hotel in large part due to the spectacular-looking pool and fitness facilities(check out their webpage). So, I get to the hotel after a long train ride. At check-in the reservation agent upsells me on a more expensive room which I hate but reluctantly accepted. I get to the room and ask the porter how I get to the wellness area and the pool. He gives me a startled look and explains that both those areas are closed for renovation. The hotel is barely over ONE year old. So, I go back down and ask why this was the first time I had heard anything about it. The folks at the front desk claimed it was supposedly sent to me via email but I double-checked and no such information was ever provided. They did, to their credit, remove the upsell amount and let me stay in the room. Nonetheless, I was sorely disappointed. Otherwise, the hotel was fairly empty and the service was pretty good. They had some excellent people working the nightshift who seemed to know what they were doing and cared. The location is good and the breakfast spectacular. The staff is large and generally efficient and careing. I will stay there again, hopefully with a working wellness area.
